loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito  vive en la calle Manuel Oyola  de la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, su esposa vive y trabaja en su comunidad ubicada en otra provincia del departamento,
 
Trabaja como comerciante de papa, que adquiere en su comunidad y vende  semanalmente en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así mejorar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Benito lives on Manuel Oyola Street in the Bautista Saavedra district of the city of El Alto. He lives with his 3 school-aged children. His wife lives and works in a community located in another province.

He works as a potato trader, buying crops grown in his community and selling them on a weekly basis in the city of El Alto.

His loan will be used to acquire a greater amount of merchandise and thus improve his sales.

This is his first loan with IMPRO. The results of his evaluation indicated that he qualified for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Johanna De La Concepcion

texts.es: Johanna de la Concepción J. Z. tiene 38 años. Es una mujer casada. Johannna tenía 1 hijo pero dadas las circunstancias de la vida falleció, y con la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, con el apoyo de una tía que le proporcionaba la mercadería, entonces Johanna visitaba a sus clientes para ofrecerles sus productos. Le motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, perfumes y cremas. Por lo que su deseo es establecer una pequeña distribuidora.
texts.en:
38-year old Johanna de la Concepción J. Z. is married and had a son, but due to unfortunate circumstances he died. With help from her husband, she has managed to move on. Her work is selling cosmetics. Johanna is a hardworking woman, and she has always enjoyed working. She’s been doing this job for more than ten years—with help from an aunt who provided her with the merchandise, and Johanna would visit the customers to show them the products. She wants to use the loan to buy more products such as underwear, perfumes, and lotions. Her dream is to open a small store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John B. is married and has 8 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. John operates a cold store selling frozen meat and fish at Kwamikrom, which he has done since 1996. His wife is a petty trader who makes very little money. John uses his income solely for the upkeep of his large family. John will use the loan to purchase fresh fish, meat, and livestock to sell to expand the business. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish, meat and livestock

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn C. is from the village of Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Roselyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Roselyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Roselyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily allowances. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Adelaydo

texts.es:
El señor Adelaydo A. tiene ya mas de diez años dedicándose a la elaboración de figuras de fierro , muebles para la venta de tacos  y también elabora asadores.
Esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, ya que trabaja en un lugar especial en su casa.
Le está haciendo falta más material prima ya que desea elaborar otros tipos de producto y así tener más variedad en su negocio, también le hace falta una maquina más moderna para soldar ya que la actual no está en buenas condiciones.  
Don Adelaydo ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente y está solicitando un préstamo para tener más ingresos a su familia y con el cual pagara el crédito.

loans.use: Comprar materia prima y una maquina de soldar

loans.name: Gerardo Boanerges

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Gerardo Alemán se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de  pollo y embutidos los cuales son comercializados a diario por él mismo desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El señor Gerardo se ha destacado por ser un excelente comerciante que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio pero hoy en día requiere de un crédito para la compra de los embutidos y el pollo para continuar brindándole satisfacción a sus clientes.

loans.use: Compra de embutidos

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị is a 47 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phố Chờ 01.

N. is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, N. operates a family member's business venture operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đặng Thị N. is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

2.  Lê Thị Quý is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

3.  Đặng Thị N. T. is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030001) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phố Chờ 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND.  Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đặng Thị N. (20201030002) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Lê Thị Quý (20201030003) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Đặng Thị N. T. (20201030004) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20201030005) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es:
La  microempresaria Salvadora Natividad R. Sevilla tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos en edad de estudio, se dedica desde hace 19 años a trabajar como joyera realizando trabajos en oro y plata, es la única mujer en esta ciudad que realiza este tipo de actividad comercial. Entre los productos que confecciona tanto en oro como en plata están las cadenas, anillos,  normal de matrimonio y de promoción, aretes y pulseras.

Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos por parte de Kiva los cuales a pagado en tiempo y forma. Estos préstamos según doña Salvadora le han ayudado para tener mayor cantidad de materia prima y aprovecha a la vez este espacio para agradecer a los prestamistas y a Kiva por esa noble labor de ayudar a los más necesitados.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando para poder comprar más materiales para la elaboración de sus productos ya que en estos días existe demanda de anillos de graduación, por lo que solicita lo siguiente:

Para comprar: 45 gramos de oro, lo compra a US 10 dólares cada gramo, 30 gramos de plata la compra a US 0.80 dólares cada gramo, 2 libras de yeso a US 3 dólares cada libra y 12 piedras para anillo de graduación.
texts.en:
Salvadora Natividad R. Sevilla is a 46 year-old single mother with three school-age children. She has worked 19 years as a jeweler, making products in silver and gold. She is the only woman in her city to do this type of work. Among the products she makes in silver and gold are chains, rings (including wedding and class rings), earrings, and bracelets. This small businesswoman has been the beneficiary of two Kiva loans, which she repaid in a timely and efficient manner. According to Mrs. Salvadora, these loans allowed her to increase the amount of primary materials necessary to make her jewelry. She would also like to use this space to thank various lenders and Kiva for the noble task of helping the most needy. Currently, she is asking for a loan so she can buy more materials to make her products. These days there is a high demand for class rings, so she is asking for assistance in buying the following: 45 grams of gold (sold at $10/gram), 30 grams of silver (sold at $0.8/gram), 2 pounds of plaster (sold at $3/pound), and 12 stones for the class rings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying gold, silver, plaster, and stones for class rings

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita B. is from the village of San Luis Cauayan City. She is 42 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Emelita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Emelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 every four months from this activity.

Emelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Emelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos R., 24, is a good homemaker who cares for her children and cooks tasty meals for her family. She is married and has two children who are going to school. Besides her housework, she also helps her husband with his fishing business and cleans up tools when the fishing is finished. The head of the family is Mrs. R.'s husband, who makes an income by catching fish in and around Tunle Sap River. Recently, R.'s husband has not been able to go fishing because he lacks the necessary fishing equipment. R. has requested her second loan of $600 to purchase nets, traps, and a boat engine for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and a boat engine for fishing

loans.name: Doris Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Atenas se formó con  mujeres que  tienen un gran vinculo de amistad y formaron un buen equipo de  trabajo,  las socias viven en diferentes  partes de la urbe cuencana, está cuidad está  ubicada en la zona austral y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, esta  localidad es muy reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad,  las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, su suculenta gastronomía y su gente cálida atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.


Doris V. tiene 37 años,   vive  con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de   16, 10, 8, 7 años de edad en la urbe cuencana,  su esposo trabaja como contratista de construcción,  su hija mayor estudia en el colegio Ciudad de Cuenca, su hija de 10 en la escuela Dolores J. Torres y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela Gabriela Mistral, aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven  en casa de su suegra.

Doris trabaja como empleada hace cinco años,  su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 1 p.m. y el resto día  se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, Yanbal hace un año, las pocas ganancias que obtiene aporta a su hogar para cubrir algunas necesidades urgentes.

Nuestra socia lleva trece años integrando su banco comunal incentivada por su cuñada a ser parte del mismo,  se retiró un tiempo y regresó  nuevamente como socia activa de su banco hace cuatro años, los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en necesidades de su casa ahora con  el crédito solicitado  va a  comprar perfumes, cremas, labiales, tratamientos, bisutería y más cosméticos de las líneas Avon y Yanbal para la temporada navideña para ofrecer a sus clientes e incrementar su negocio.

Su  sueño es llegar a tener  su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Atenas Communal Bank was established by women who have a great bond of friendship, and they created a great working team. The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is located in the southern region, and it is the capital of Azuay Province. It is renowned for its writers, artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe the city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its succulent food. The warmth of its people attracts national and foreign tourists. Doris V. is 37, and she lives with her husband and their four children. They are 16, 10, 8, and 7. They live in the city of Cuenca. Her husband works as a construction contractor. Her oldest daughter goes to the City of Cuenca School. Her ten year old daughter goes to the Dolores J. Torres School. The two other children go to the Gabriela Mistral School. They do not yet have their own house, so they live in her mother-in-law’s house. Doris has worked as an employee for five years. Her schedule is from 8 a.m. until 1 p.m. The rest of the day she sells Avon and Yanbal products. She has been doing this for one year. The small earnings that she gets contribute to her household to cover some urgent necessities. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years. She was motivated to join by her sister-in-law. She retired for a time, but she came back as an active member four years ago. She has invested the loans she has received in the necessities of her household. She will use the loan she is now asking for to buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, treatments, jewelry, and more Avon and Yanbal cosmetics for the Christmas season. She will offer the products to her customers and expand her business. Her dream is to come to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, creams, lipsticks, treatments and other cosmetics

loans.name: Rourm

texts.en:
Rourm T., 50, is married and lives with her two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia. Rourm is a skillful chef for wedding parties. She has to travel to many places in her province to provide her cooking services. She is able to generate an income of USD 8 per day to assist the family.  Rourm has been in this business since 1996. Her husband (pictured here) helps his wife in the business, and when he is available, operates his motorbike as a driver, earning USD 5 per day. 

Rourm and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as meet the daily living expenses. As a result, Rourm T. is requesting a loan of US $1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to rent a food stand at a local market to sell food. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To rent a food stand at the market to sell food

loans.name: Gloria Estebana

texts.es: En el municipio de Villanueva la señora. Gloria R. se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria. Ella es madres soltera de dos hijos que mantener y el crédito lo esta solicitando para la compra de materiales para mejorar su vivienda ya que esta en malas condiciones por lo tanto necesita brindarle un techo digno a sus hijos. Con el crédito se beneficia ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Villanueva, Gloria R. works as an elementary school teacher. She is the single mother of two children that she takes care of. The loan is requested for purchasing materials to improve their life since it is in bad condition. Most of all, she needs to give her children a decent roof. With the loan she and her family will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Roeun Chab Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeun C. is a 61 year old married woman who lives in Ta Su village, Takeo province. She is a member of a village bank loan group consisting of 5-people. With this loan they hope to increase their income to improve their family living conditions. Mrs. Roeun C. and her husband, Mr. Ten Chan, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow crops to earn for living.

Mrs. Roeun C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timber and zinc strips to improve the structure of her house. This couple has one child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy timber and zinc strips for house repair

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon N. is 59 years old and a villager who lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns an 8 hectare field to cultivate rice and owns a plowing machine and a water pump machine to support her farming. In this farming, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming and the rest of the loan she will use to repair her plowing machine and water pump machine. Mrs. Lon N. is a widow with a child who is a students and also supports the mother's farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to repair her plowing and water pump machines.

loans.name: Emerlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Emerlinda R. is from Upper Sto Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old and married with two children. She operates her pig raising business in order to have an income. Her husband is a farmer who supports their basic daily needs. She has managed her business for more than two years, earning approximately $140 a month.

Emerlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial support for engaging in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan from PMPC of 13,000 PHP. Now she has a new loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which is being used to expand her business and to have additional capital. This is her 5th loan from PMPC.

loans.use: additional capital for her pig raising

loans.name: Artak

texts.en: Artak G. is 32 years old; he lives in Tsovagyugh village, in the region of Sevan. Artak is married and has two school-aged children. Artak worked as a firefighter for 2 years.  He now works as a technician for an ecological company and also manages his own food shop. With the profit from his business, Artak provides for his family's needs. He is also involved in stock breeding and his wife helps him with farming. Artak requires 1,100,000 AMD to buy fresh fish to resell.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics products.

loans.name: Kavira

texts.fr:
Kavira S.  est  entrepreneur, vendeuse des poissons Tilapia, cliente au 14e cycle, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants respectivement âgés de 9 ans et 4 ans.  Tous étudient, le fils ainé fait la 3e année primaire et le second fait l’école gardienne. 
Son mari est aussi vendeur des poissons, elle s’entraide avec son mari dans ce business de vente des poissons Tilapia.
Madame Kavira S. a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre. Elle fut petite marchande, revendeuse des poissons  sans capital, détaillante, elle spéculait avec les marchandises (poissons) de ses amis et connaissances qui étaient déjà grossistes. Elle prenait les poissons à crédit et les revendre pour payer après l’opération. C’était une façon de lui initier à l’auto prise en charge. Cependant  les petits bénéfices cumulés de son business informel lui a permis de se constituer un capital de 50$ pour démarrage. Et un peu après, elle a profité le 1er crédit de l'IMF Hekima.
Au paravent, quand  madame Kavira S.  avait un petit fond de rotation, elle vendait les poissons du lac Virunga (en RD Congo) anciennement appelé lac Edouard, lac Idi Amine en provenance de la pecherie de vitshumbi et Nyakakoma, deux villages situés respectivement à 150 km de la ville de Goma. Plus tard, lorsqu’elle se vit  son capital  augmente en volume, immediatement elle a préféré  changer l’axe d’approvisionnement pour réaliser plus des profits, elle vend des poissons Tilapia provenant de lac Victoria de l’Ouganda. La spécificité de ces poissons, ils sont plus gros par rapport aux poissons de lac Edouard. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poissons. Elle s’installe sur le lieu public, route Katindo, entrée du camp Militaire.
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Kavira S. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  600 kg des poissons  frais appelés « gros tilapia».
Madame Kavira S., explique le défi majeur de son activité est lié à la pourriture de poisson, surtout lorsque le glace (glacier) est finiou transformé en liquide pour garder les poissons en état frais. En outre le transport de leur marchandise de l’Ouganda-kampala vers la RD Congo pose un problème d’autant plus qu’il n’y a pas assez des véhicules transporteurs impliqués dans ce secteur de transport poisson. Par exemple à ce jour, madame Kavira S. n’a pas des marchandises parce que il n'y a que’un seul véhicule qui fait ce trafic routier transfrontalier, et seulement 3 ou 4 operateurs ougandais qui font ce transport avec leurs véhicules jusqu'au frontière entre l'Ouganda et le RD Congo.
Dans l’avenir, elle ambitionne louer, elle seule un camion de poissons Tilapia sans se faire liguer avec d’autres associés de sa corporation.  Elle reste très optimiste en soulignant qu’un jour elle sera grand fournisseur des poissons tilapia dans la ville de Goma. Dans le futur, elle souhaiterait  acheter sa propre parcelle et y construire une maison, étant donné qu’elle est encore locataire de maison. 
Madame Kavira S. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kavira S. is an entrepreneur, a seller of tilapia fish.  She is a 14th cycle client, 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children, aged 9 and 4.  Both are in school.  Her son, the eldest, is in the third grade, and the other is in kindergarten.  Kavira's husband is also a fish seller.  She and her husband help each other in this business selling tilapia.  She started her small business with her own funds.  Kavira was once a small-scale merchant, a fish seller without working capital, a retailer.  She used to speculate with goods (fish) belonging to her friends and acquaintances who were already wholesale merchants.  She got the fish on credit and resold it, paying afterward.  This was a way for her to become familiar with self-sufficiency.  Meanwhile, the small profits from her informal business accumulated and enabled her to build up $50 in capital to start off.  A year later, she availed herself of the first loan with the micro-finance institution Hekima.  In the past, when Kavira had a small revolving fund, she used to sell fish from Lake Virunga (in the Democratic Republic of the Congo) formerly called Lake Edouard, Lake Edi Amine from the fishery of Vitshumbi and Nyakakoma, two villages located 150 km from the city of Goma.  Later, when she saw her capital increase in volume, she immediately favored changing her supply source in order to make more profit.  She sells tilapia from Lake Victoria in Uganda.  These fish are specifically bigger compared to the fish from Lake Edouard.  She has been in this business selling fish for eight years.  She situated herself in the public space on Katindo Road, at the entrance to the military camp.  With the Hekima loan, Kavira wishes to increase her sales by buying 600 kg of fresh fish called gros tilapia.  Kavira explains that the major challenge in her business is related to fish spoiling, especially when the ice has turned liquid in the cooler for keeping the fish fresh.  Furthermore, the transport of Uganda-Kampala merchandise toward the Democratic Republic of the Congo poses a problem, as much as there are not enough transport vehicles involved in this sector for transporting fish.  For example, today, Kavira has no merchandise because there was not one vehicle running the trans-border trade in the DRC, and only three or four economic Ugandan operators using their vehicles to take fish as far as the border.  In the future, Kavira has the ambition to lease, on her own, a tilapia truck without joining forces with other companies in her corporation.  She remains very optimistic, emphasizing that, one day, she will be a major supplier of tilapia in her city of Goma.  For the future, she wishes to buy her own plot of land and to build house on it, since she is still renting a house.  Kavira thanks Hekima for the loans she receives without the need for any collateral at all because, thanks to these loans, she is managing to meet the needs of her children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 600 kg of fish

loans.name: Heidi Natali

texts.es:
Heidi Natali tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera  reside en el Municipio de Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, viven con su abuela, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, su abuela inicio el negocio  hace 16 años y con mucho esfuerzo ha logro obtener un puesto en el mercado de Jucuapa donde vende comida (Frijoles, Huevos, Carne, Vegetales, prepara desayunos y almuerzos) y le  enseño a Heidi quien actualmente es la encargada de manejar el negocio; ya que por la edad que tiene su abuelita ya no puede.
Heidi se ha visto en la necesidad de obtener el préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas donde puedan los clientes consumir los alimentos que ella prepara y ofrecerles un mejor servicio, esto contribuirá a generar más ingresos y continuar el negocio para solventar las necesidades de alimentación y salud para su abuela. Ella aspira tener un negocio grande, con mesas y sillas, una cámara para mostrar los diferentes alimentos a sus clientes, mejorar la calidad de vida su familia y continuar con el espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Heidi Natali, 25, is single and lives in Jucuapa, Usulután department with her grandmother. She sells prepared meals. Her grandmother started the business 16 years ago and through much effort managed to secure a space in Jucuapa’s market where she sells food (beans, eggs, meat, vegetables; she also prepares lunches and breakfasts); she trained Heidi who currently is in charge of the business because her grandmother’s advanced age precludes her from continuing. Heidi needs funding to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can consume the meals she prepares for them and she can offer better customer service. This will contribute to higher earnings so that the business can continue to produce enough to cover basic needs like food and health for her grandmother. She aspires to having a larger business with tables and chairs, a camera to show her various dishes to customers, better quality of life for her family and to continue in the enterprising spirit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
la sra. Macaria I.  G. es una señora muy alegre y dispuesta a salir adelante junto con su familia.
Macaria vive en el barrio Las Delicias de Langue Valle. a vivido ahí toda su vida junto con su esposo el señor Rosali Meza Canales. Macaria se dedica al destazo de cerdos y a la venta de carne, este negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años. Dice que vende todo los dias y le va muy bien sus hijos la mayoria radican en los estados unidos, y a veces le apoyan economicamente.
su mayor deseo es tener mas clientes que le compren su producto y que su negocio siga creciendo dia a dia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas cerdos para criarlos y luego destazarlos.
texts.en:
Macaria I. G. is a very happy woman who is determined to get ahead with her family. Macaria lives in the Las Delicias de Langue Valle neighborhood. She has lived there all of her life with her husband, Rosali Meza Canales. Macaria butchers pigs and sells the meat. She has been in this business for several years. She says that she sells everyday, and it is going very well for her. Most of her children live in the United States. Sometimes they help her economically. Her greatest wish is to have more customers to buy her product. She also wishes that her business continues to grow day to day. She will use the loan to buy more pigs to raise and later butcher.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Abu B.

texts.en:
Abu B. F. is a devoted, hard-working and very sincere business man. His business is located along Rogbaneh Rd. which is one of the busy streets in  Makeni. He got his business capital from his father after he dropped out of school.

Abu is married to a businesswoman who also helps him with his business. He sells electrical materials, tape recorders, and building materials which he has  done for 10 years. How to manage his business in such a way that he gets his livelihood and can continue in business is his challenge. 

Abu needs a loan to improve his business and make it more profitable. He intends using the proceeds of his loan to send his eldest son to college, feed his family, pay school fees, and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy additional electrical and building materials for resale

loans.name: Marcelino Alexander

texts.es: Marcelino Alexander tiene 38 años. Sus 2 hijos a cargo, son lo más importante para él para brindar apoyo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de carpintería, pues hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, este negocio lo inicio ingresos del trabajo que poseía anteriormente, ya que él se instruyó en una carpintería de sus tías, por lo que Marcelino con su propio esfuerzo decide establecer su propia carpintería, a pesar que enfrento dificultades como lo fue la compra de todas las herramientas necesarias para su taller, pero esto no desanimo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para comprar  madera, clavos, pega, maque, entre otras cosas. el desea establecer otro negocio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcelino Alexander is 38 years old. For him, supporting his two sons is the most important thing. He has a carpentry workshop, and has been in business for over 16 years now. He started the business using earnings from the job he previously held in his aunts' carpentry workshop, where he learned his trade. When he decided to set up on his own, Marcelino overcame hurdles such as having to buy every piece of equipment a workshop needs, but he was not disheartened. Now he is seeking a loan to buy wood, nails, glue and varnish, among other things, so that he can set up a second business for his sons.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shirts, pants, women's dresses

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Joy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like shampoo, candies, and soap in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ligia Janett

texts.es:
Ligia Janett tiene 45 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella inicio por la necesidad de buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia, la necesidad de salir adelante y colaborar con la economía de su familia hizo que años empezara un negocio se encuentra situado en su vivienda, con este negocio brinda a su familia la estabilidad que necesita. Ella desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. El objetico el de financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos entre otros.
Ella es una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Ligia Janett is 45 years old and manages a store. She started her business out of necessity as a way of earning income for her family, moving them forward, and helping with the finances. Her business was established years ago in her home and provides the stability that her family needs. She wants to acquire more products in order to expand her business and increase her sales. This loan will be used to buy candy, natural refreshments, basic grains, and other products.

Ligia is a peaceful, hardworking, and enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, natural refreshments, basic grains, and other products

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan N., 61, is a widow and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer, making $1 a day.  She is also supported by her two children who work as garment factory workers making approximately $3 each per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation struggles have affected all Cambodians. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for much of the country. The country’s economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country’s economic difficulties, Phan N. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase cows to plow farmland. (Phan N. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow farmland

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio L. O. de 52 años de edad, es una persona muy emprendedora, el cual se dedica a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz. Reside en Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Ovidio se dedica a la siembra de semilla de maíz la cual cultiva para posteriormente comercializarla en diferentes negocios. Su esposa le ayuda a vender el maíz en su casa de habitación y así mismo sale a ofrecerlo en los mercados del lugar. Ovidio solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en más maíz para sembrar y así mismo para comprar todos los implementos necesarios como abono, y otros más para lograr una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Ovidio L. O., 52, is a very enterprising person.  He works as a corn farmer.  He lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with his wife and two minor children.

He cultivates corn which he later sells to various businesses.  His wife helps him sell corn from home and also goes out to offer it to various local markets.

Ovidio is asking for funds in order to have enough money to invest more in corn to plant and to be able to buy all the necessary supplies, like manure and others, to have an excellent crop yield.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife, working in selling chickens since 2008. Hussein travels through villages to sell his chickens. He doesn't own a shop. It's only his car that he uses to improve his business. 

This is Hussein's first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua. He wants to increase his capital and also to buy a car for his wife in order to help her in making an extra business, which will increase their income and improve their living. 

He hopes to expand his business through buying a shop where he will sell chicken and poultry products.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas II”, ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y tiene 01 hijo independiente, la señora estudió hasta 4to de educación secundaria.

Silveria viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 meses,  nos cuenta que su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de pescado.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito  S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio venta de pescados y papas.
	
Su sueño es tener más capital para su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Silveria is a member of the “Mujeres Activas II” Communal Bank, which is located in the Juliaca district of San Román province, in the Puno region of Peru. She is 42 years old, single and has one adult child. She has completed 4 years of secondary school.
Silveria has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 months. She tells us that she first received a 500 PEN loan, which she used to increase working capital for her business selling fish.
She is requesting a new 800 PEN loan to invest in selling fish and potatoes.
Her dream is to have more capital for her business.
Her favourite things about her communal bank are the meetings and the savings.

loans.use: Invest in selling fish and potatoes

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
A. rakhi is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is married to M. M. who is a laborer by profession. She has two sons and two daughters. Her elder son left his education after 8th grade and started a clothes selling business, while the younger children are attending school and getting their education. 

She lives in Kamoki, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its rice industry.  She lives there in the area named MuhA. azizpura in a two-room brick house with her husband, children and nephew. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her nephew in his embroidery business. He runs a shop in the market and offers his clients many different and unique embroidered designs on their clothes. With the loan, he will buy another embroidery machine and hire a worker who will help him fulfill orders on time. 

He has been operating this business for the past ten years and A. rakhi is hopeful that this investment will increase the output of his business and make it more profitable. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application. She hopes that it will be helpful to her nephew.

loans.use: To buy another embroidery machine

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle C. is from the village of Capellan. She is 38 years old. Anabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anabelle owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anabelle has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 11000 PHP a month in these activities.

In 2004, Anabelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Anabelle from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys Eleonor

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladys tiene 48 años  de edad y  hace algunos  años su esposo falleció pero de esa  relación tiene tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad.

Tiene un pequeño local en donde vende los deliciosos encebollados de pescado albacora, los mismos que son muy apetecidos por los habitantes del lugar. Trabaja de martes a domingos desde las 7h30 hasta las 12h00 o hasta que se termine lo que preparo. Nos cuenta que lleva 24 años con este negocio y que le ha servido mucho ya así ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que ella fue padre y madre después que su esposo falleció.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca y otros ingredientes necesarios para preparar este delicioso plato. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 21 ciclos y siempre le ha gustado por la unión del grupo.  Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In the Nueva California zone of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of La California Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

In this place we know Gladys well.  She is 48 years old.  Several years ago her husband died, leaving her with 3 children, all of whom are now adults.

Gladys has a small locale where she sells her specialty, delicious albacore cooked in onions, following an appetizing recipe much favored by local residents.  She works from Tuesday through Sundays, from 7:30 until  12:00 or when what she has prepared runs out.  She tells us that she has had this business for 24 years, and that it has served her well.  Gladys has been able to advance her family, serving as both mother and father, following the death of her husband.

This loan will be used to buy fish, yuca and other necessary ingredients for preparing this delicious dish.  Gladys has been a member of her communal bank through 21 loan cycles, and she has always liked  the group's unity.  She dreams of having a larger business.

loans.use: TO BUY FISH, YUCA AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HER MEAL STALL

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco.

Her name is Susana, and she is 23 years old. Susana has a common-law husband and one child. Susana buys electronic appliances for the home from Tacna, Peru—near the border with Chile—and sells them in Cusco. For example, she will buy and sell blenders, microwaves, and televisions in the street in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to invest in more inventory for her business.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her household appliance business

loans.name: Sharifaan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifaan is a housewife and lives in a combined family system in Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city in Punjab Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She came here after her marriage to M. A.. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Three of them study while youngest one is only a year old. Sharifaan is a very supportive lady. She carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She is also a very caring mother and raising her children with great responsibility. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who will invest the loan in his grocery store business. He sells daily use items like cooking oil, sugar, rice and spices etc through his store and will buy more stock with the loan. He started this business three years ago and Sharifaan is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, 43 years old, lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family. She is married and has 3 children, aged 23, 20 and 9. Elvira and her husband are both farmers. They own the land that they are tilling. They plant and harvest rice crops and then sell them at the market. When free of farming duties, Elvira's husband uses his motorcycle to transport people around their community. Elvira says income from the motorcycle helps in their daily needs.

Elvira joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, medicines and seeds. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, medicines and seeds

loans.name: Ekua Abiba Grace

texts.en:
Ekua Abiba Grace A. is single and has 4 children. She has received a senior high school education. Ekua Abiba sells smoked fish, kokonte (dried cassava that has been processed into powder) and other items at Dompoase near Elmina in Cape Coast.  Cooked kokonte looks like banku, but the colour is slightly different due to the drying of the cassava – it can sometime be dark or brownish in colour.

Ekua takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales.  She is requesting a loan to add to her initial capital to expand her business. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit back into her business.

In this picture, Ekua is pounding the dried cassava to be milled into powder for sale.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: 020403 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Thang L. T. (403019) is a 50-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thang is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0203014 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa (020403 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa). Thang is married and has two adult children. To making a living, Thang operates a family member's specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Thang has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. In 2011, Thang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thang is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Thang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Tiep (403020) is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business. 2. P. T. Hue (403021) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock business. 3. L. T. Nhung (403022) is a 19-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock business. 4. L. T. Thang (403023) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business. 5. N. T. Nga (403024) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business. 6. T. T. Thuong (403025) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock business. 7. T. T. Tuyet (403026) is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her livestock business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thang L. T. (403019) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Thang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0203014 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa (020403 Xuan Phu - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm chăm sóc sức khỏe & dược phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thang kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND. Vào 2011, Thang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thang đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Tiep (403020) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 2. P. T. Hue (403021) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. L. T. Nhung (403022) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. L. T. Thang (403023) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 5. N. T. Nga (403024) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 6. T. T. Thuong (403025) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 7. T. T. Tuyet (403026) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Angel Manuelito

texts.es:
Angel Manuelito G. L.  tiene 35 años, es soltero   vive  con la madre y tiene dos hijos pero no vive con el padre de ellos, viven en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS esta constituida por 12 socios esta se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora, tomate y maíz, son agrícolas por mas de 10 años los mas antiguos y otros miembros que estan comenzando con esta actividad.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, tomate y maíz en grandes cantidades, las compras las realiza en Chillanes en Agro y las vende los días domingos en la feria de Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es apoyar a los hijos para que estudien.

Le gusta descansar y pasar con la familia
texts.en:
Angel Manuelito G. L., 35, is single.  He lives with his mother in the Ecuadorean province of Bolivar.  He has two children.

The COOPERATIVA LOS MOREROS community bank has 12 members.  The bank is located some 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  The members are all farmers.  They grow blackberries, tomatoes and maize.  Some of the members have been farmers for up to 10 years and others are just starting out.  

Angel grows blackberries, tomatoes and maize.  He buys what he needs from Agro in Chillanes and sells at the Sunday fairs there.  

Angel is applying for a loan to buy the supplies he needs for his farming business: seeds, manure and chemical fertilizer.  Your loans will fund the investment he needs.  His biggest challenges are the pests and plant diseases that can destroy his crop and the ever-changing weather.  His greatest wish is to help with the children's studies.

Angel likes to spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Progresistas esta conformado por 4 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones. Nuestras socias laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y así entregar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.

La Señora Vicenta M.  es socia del banco comunal Las Progresistas, vive por la comunidad de Ayaloma que  pertenece al cantón Nabon.

Tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 5 años y un bebé 3 meses de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como oficial de albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros de manera independiente.

La Señora. Vicenta ha iniciado el negocio de cría de pollos hace 3 meses, eligió esta actividad por que le da la oportunidad de cuidar de sus hijos que aun se encuentran pequeños.
 
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco, fue invitada por su amiga quien es socia activa del mismo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y en su alimento.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Las Progresistas ( The Progressive) communal bank is made up of 4 women and 3 males who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is the 3rd most important city in the country, a cultural heritage site, it has great food variety and its people maintain its culture and customs.  The members work in different sectors that allow them to supplement their household finances and this way provide a better quality of life to their families.

Vicenta M. started raising chickens 3 months ago, she chose this activity because it gives her the opportunity to care for her kids who are still little.
This is her first loan, she was invited by a friend who is a current member of the same bank.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of more chickens and their feed.
Her goal is to grow in the business of raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase hens and feed for the animals

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
Yang S., 31, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. and her husband are farmers and sell palm sugar, earning an income of 5 USD each per day. Each month the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 35 USD on the other necessary expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase traditional grinding tools to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy traditional grinding tools to resell

loans.name: Oloturiaki

texts.en:
Oloturiaki I. is 39 years old and married with three children. He lives in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. He has been farming for the past four years.

He is a humble client. He found out about KADET from other clients registered in his area. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD and he intends to spend it on preparing the land for farming and purchasing maize seeds.

He intends to plough his anticipated profit back into the farm and dreams of being a big farmer. He can achieve more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy maize seeds

loans.name: Barkat's Group

texts.en:
Barkat is 39 years old, married, and has five children: the eldest works in a factory, the second eldest helps her husband in his business. The youngest one is studying in class at fourth level while the remaining two stay at home. 

Barkat herself is a housewife; she stays at home and manages the household. 

Her husband has a construction supplies business. He provides construction material to his clients at very reasonable rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and stones which will help him fulfill client orders on time and earn better profits. 

Barkat is hopeful that her husband will be able to get positive results from his business by investing this loan in it, which will in turn help her family to live better. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Barkat.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 28 years old and is married with three children. He owns a house in Kasese. For the past three years, John has run a retail shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase clothes and saucepans to sell. In the future, he would like to educate his children and expand his business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes and saucepans to sell

loans.name: Rita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rita del Carmen tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Rita se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta dedicarse hacer la limpieza del hogar.
texts.en:
Rita del Carmen is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The October 27th Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Sofia, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank is composed of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Rita is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and sells her products at the fair in the same location.

Rita is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests that can attack her crops. Her dream is to buy plots of land.

Rita enjoys cleaning house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 26 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Babylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Babylyn runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. Babylyn has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Babylyn would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 43 años vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 8 a 22 años, y un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, allí vende todo lo que le encargan: camas, comedores, juegos de sala productos de madera en general y hasta ropa y calzado. Su negocio inicio como muchos otros por la necesidad de generar ingreses mediante una actividad independiente ante el desempleo reinante, pero principalmente porque siente un gusto especial por el establecimiento de relaciones comerciales y ha descubierto su gran potencial a través de su trabajo en él. Su meta   principal es incrementar su capital de trabajo para hacerlo más eficiente y ayudar al desarrollo personal y profesional de sus hijos.  Su mayor desafío ocurre cuando ha tenido inconvenientes con el sistema de financiación de su negocio. Mientras Jorge se esfuerza por lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio maneja una rotación de inventarios de 27 días, y una utilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 44% . Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancía encargada como juegos de camas sencillas, juegos de comedor, y ropa, aprovechando que este segundo semestre se incrementan las ventas en los sectores productivos y espera que èl también sea impactado con buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is 43 and lives in southwestern Barranquilla. He has five children between the ages of 8 and 22. He has a business where he makes a living selling a variety of merchandise, from beds, dining room sets and general wooden furniture to clothing and footwear. His business started like many others, out of necessity to earn income through an independent activity against the prevailing unemployment, but primarily because he feels an affinity toward commercial relations and has discovered great potential in himself through his job. His main goals are to increase his capital by becoming more efficient and to help the personal and professional development of his children. His biggest challenge is when he has inconveniences in financing his business. While Jorge works hard to make his business sustainable, his inventory turns over every 27 days and his profit margin is no less than 44 percent. This loan is his first with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to use it to purchase items such as bed sets, dining room sets and clothing so he can take advantage to improve his second-half sales and make good revenue.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bed sets, dining room sets and clothing.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a focused and a hard-working 23-year-old businessman. He is married  but has no children. To make ends meet for the last three years, he has been involved in welding and metal fabrication. He wants in the next five years to have his business grow and become stable so as he is able to realize his dream of being financially stable.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal sheets. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for their immense advice that has enabled his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Elvira has a retail shop that sells detergents, beverages, snacks and breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paraiso, tiene 62 años, tiene un puesto de abarrotes en el Mercado Vivanco,  el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mas mercadería para su puesto de abarrotes, aparte de eso Rosa reparte ropa, ella es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años y le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se relaja y aprende mucho.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the “Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She’s 62 years old and has a grocery stand in the Vivanco Market.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her grocery stand.  Besides that, Rosa also sells clothes.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for the last four years and she likes the communal bank meeting quite a bit because she relaxes and learns a lot.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and brick for repairing her son's house.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos 2.0 Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Juntos Podemos”, lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de abarrotes en almacenes, venta de ropa y cachureos en la feria, y preparación y venta de comida rápida. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Conchalí, ciudad de Santiago. 
Palmenia integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, en el lugar del medio, vistiendo un pantalón café y una polera estampada con colores negro y gris. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida, entre los cuales prepara helados, sopaipillas y completos. 
Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a sábado durante las mañanas en un colegio y en la feria. Sus ventas las realiza en un carro. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que además tiene clientela fija.  Y su mercadería la compra en la vega (feria destinada a la venta de productos preferentemente para comerciantes).
Con el crédito comprará un horno industrial.
Sus metas son obtener un carro completero, que contiene toda la implementación para obtener el permiso de salubridad. Actualmente ya cuenta con una freidora y una conservadora de alimentos.
Palmenia vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 20 y 12 años de edad, además a la espera de un tercer hijo, ya que está embarazada (6 meses). 
Sus sueños son postular al subsidio habitacional para obtener su casa propia, con ésta inversión Palmenia puede instalar su negocio en su misma casa, para flexibilizar sus horarios, así dedicar tiempo al trabajo y sus hijos. 
Palmenia está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. 
Además comenta que existe una buena relación de confianza con el grupo del Banco comunal. 
Conchalí es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile)  ubicada hacia el norte de la misma. Posee un barrio industrial delimitado, y múltiples actividades económicas y comerciales de pequeño tamaño, incluyendo ferias libres, talleres artesanales, garajes, terminales de buses, entre otros. El sector microempresarial es muy relevante en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Juntos Podemos”. It consists of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different businesses which include selling groceries in stores, selling clothes and trinkets at street markets, fast food production and sales. They all live in Conchali in the city of Santiago. Palmenia, a member of the communal bank, who in the photo is seated in the middle of the first row and is wearing brown pants and a shirt emblazoned with black and grey colours, makes and sells fast food, such as icecream, sopaipillas (deep fried dough) and completos (hotdogs topped with tomato).

She works Mondays to Saturdays in the mornings at a school and at a street market. She sells from a food cart. She says that she is doing well with her business as she also has regular clients. She buys her products in the valley (a market dedicated to the sale of products especially for retailers). With the loan she is going to buy an industrial oven. Her goals are to obtain a fully equipped food cart that is set up so as to obtain a health permit. She already has a deep fryer and food storage cabinet. 

Palmenia  lives with her husband and 2 sons, 20 and 12 years of age. In addition she is expecting a third child as she is 6 months pregnant. Her dreams are to apply for a housing subsidy to obtain their own home. With this investment Palmenia can install the business in her own home so as to make her work schedule more flexible and thus spend time both at work and with her children.

Palmenia is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also says that there is a good relationship of trust with the communal bank group.

Conchalí is a part of the metropolitan area (where Santiago, the capital of Chile is located), located to the north. It has a defined industrial area, and multiple economic activities and small businesses, including street markets, craft workshops, garages, bus terminals, among others. The microenterprise sector is very relevant to the commercial actvity of the area.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: AbdulRahman is a 23 year old young man. He is a blacksmith with a decent salary.  He has one sister and wants to pay the university fees for her, but he hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. When AbdulRahman gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay the university fees for his sister. This will enable her to complete her education and improve the standard of living of her family. AbdulRahman is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his sister.

loans.name: Lesiamon

texts.en:
Lesiamon is a 32-year-old married man and a father to three children. He has been a farmer for the past three years. 

Lesiamon is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd after he repaid his previous loan well. He plans to use this loan to buy farm supplies like pesticides and seedlings and pay for the labor on his farm so that he can prepare for the next planting season. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest the remaining amount in farming.

He dreams of becoming a well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more albeit limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en: Nergui has used her loan usefully and this time she needs to renew her broken nail-machine and make some adjustments to her workshop.
