loans.use: To renew her broken nail-machine and make some adjustments to her workshop.

loans.name: Karama Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Jovia, age 47, plants and harvests groundnuts to earn a living. She and her husband have seven children and live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She dreams of educating her children and expanding her business so as to earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from growing beans. 

Jovia is requesting a loan to buy groundnuts seedlings for planting. She is a member of a group in which each one guarantees the other in accessing loans.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seedlings for planting

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a kenkey (fermented corn dumpling) seller at Dompoase. She has four children. Ekua has been selling kenkey for 10 years now. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. Ekua will use her loan to buy maize to make kenkey. She will expand her business with the profit she makes.

loans.use: to buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Laider

texts.es: Laider, de 46 años, es una hombre bueno y trabajador, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos menores y todavia dependen de él para continuar con sus estudios. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el kilómetro 26 de la ciudad. El trabajo de Laider consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad y bebidas. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además se dedica a la siembra de cítrico, actividad que lo ejecuta en la chacra que le cedieron sus suegros. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 15 años, trabaja solo pero en ocasiones debe contratar peones. Él se inició con pequeñas siembras pero con el tiempo ha logrado una buena productividad y a la vez ampliar la siembra, ahora sus margenes de ventas son altas. Le esta yendo muy bien, pues ambas actividades se están desarrollando de la mejor manera. Este será el préstamo número 18 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos recibidos. Esta muy contento de pertenecer a su grupo, ya que el es fundador y siempre esta en espera que les vaya bien ya que lucharon mucho para consolidarlo y mantenerse como buenos clientes. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará bebidas, productos de primera necesidad, y contratar peones para que realicen la limpieza de campos y ayudar en la cosecha de frutas cítricas.
texts.en:
Laider, 46, is a good and hardworking man. He lives with his common-law couple with whom he has 3 young children. His children still depend on him to continue with their studies. Together, they live in his house located in the 26th kilometer of the city. Laider works in the sale of basic consumer goods and drinks. He has a small grocery store in his house. 

He also works planting citrus fruits, which he does in the field his parents-in-law gave him. He has been planting for 15 years. He usually works alone, but sometimes needs to hire laborers. He started out at a small scale, but with time he has improved his productivity and expanded his farming. Now, his sales margins are higher. He's doing really well, since both business activities are developing in the best possible way. 

This will be his 18th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP) and he hopes to receive everyone's help to continue with his objectives. He pledges to make his payments on time, like with his prior loans. He's very happy to belong to this group, since he is the founder and is always hopinh that eveyrthing goes well with them given their considerable effort to form the team and maintain their status as good clients. 

With the requested loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, he will buy soft drinks, basic consumer goods, and hire laborers to clean the fields and help harvest the citrus fruits.

loans.use: to buy products and drinks to stock his store and hire laborers.

loans.name: Shange1 Group

texts.en:
Happison is 28 years old, single with no children and no dependents.  He has a flea market stand at Leopold Takawira market in town.  He has been in business for one year six months and has no employees.  He buys his products from South Africa.   He has no other source of income. 

Happison faces a challenge in high competition in the market.  He would like to own a shop in town and wants to use his profits to improve his standard of living and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, blankets

loans.name: Nyanthic

texts.en: Nyanthic is a 35 year-old married woman with six children — three of them in school. She has had a food-stall business in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Nyanthic is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans and sugar to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, luchadora con ganas de progresar, es conviviente con Elmer quien es agricultor. Vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante, y juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Aurelia consiste en la venta de jugos, por la mañanas prepara desayunos y jugos  en su local propia ubicado en el mercado del Campo Verde, negocio que abrió 05 años, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida en el mercado. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, que le ayuda en la elaboración de jugos  y atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite socializarse y tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, lo que no le gusta es que los precios de los productos para la elaboración de sus jugos como las frutas no es estable y están en alza, pero esto no es impedimento para seguir creciendo. Tiene planes de abrir una tienda de repuesto de motor. Este sería su préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, con el grupo que trabaja se siente muy cómoda pues los conoce muy bien por el tiempo que viene trabajando, lo que le anima a seguir en el grupo. Además de estar agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener un crédito. Con el préstamo solicitado de 2000 nuevos  soles comprará repuesto de motor para su nueva tienda la cual piensa abrir.
texts.en:
Aurelia, age 42, is a charismatic and determined woman who wants to make progress. She is in a common-law relationship with Elmer, who is a farmer. Aurelia and her partner live with their three children, which is why she strives to move forward. They live together in their own home. Aurelia’s work consists of selling juices. In the mornings, she prepares breakfast and juices from her own shop at the market in Campo Verde. She opened her business five years ago and has become well-known in the market over time. In addition, she has the support of her daughter who helps with making juices and attending to customers. What Aurelia enjoys most about her work is being able to socialize and earn an income in a peaceful manner so that she can provide the best for her children. The part she does not like is dealing with the unstable prices of the products she uses for making juices, such as fruits, because they are rising. However, this has not stopped her from continuing her growth. Aurelia has plans to open a motor parts store.

This will be her third loan with the MFP organization. She feels very comfortable with her group because she is very familiar with the other members when it comes time to work. Aurelia is excited about continuing with her group. In addition, she is grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan. The loan that she requested in the amount of 2000 PEN will be used to buy motor parts for the new shop that she plans to open.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for her new business.

loans.name: Dikore Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIOKORE ENDAM a été créé le 04/01/2010.Il est composé de 22 membres qui sont issus du village environnant.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Salimatou qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 45 ans,elle est mariée et s'occupe de 06 enfants dont les 04 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité consiste à la vente de légumes(carottes et choux,elle fabrique aussi du savon.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en légumes.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes;accroitre son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DIOKORE ENDAM was created on January 4, 2010. It comprises 22 members who are from the same nearby village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Salimatou, who is found at the far right in the photo, is the group's official. She is 45 years old and married, and she takes care of six children. Four of the children are her own.

Her business involves selling vegetables (carrots and cabbage). She also makes soap. She has been active in this kind of work for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on vegetables.

Her goal is to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 44 year old maried man, who has 5 family members. From Al Russeifeh Jordan . He is requesting a loan of 1500 JOD for his restaurant improvments. He has a machine for Hummus and Falafel and he wants to buy another machine to make Foul (a type of bean dish) . In the future he hopes open another branch for his restaurant.

loans.use: to pay for his restaurant improvements

loans.name: Amar Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAR AZUL” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de polleras, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de baterías, elaboración de cotillones, venta de abarrotes, salón de belleza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, cuando ayudaba a su madre en el negocio familiar, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa, arroz y aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Amar Azul" communal bank will start its 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of nine members, and led  by a board of directors, of which Julia is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied; they include sewing skirts, selling food, sale of cosmetics, sale of batteries, making party favors, sale of groceries, and beauty salon.

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Julia. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five loan cycles, and joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling food. She says that she started this business several years ago, when she was helping her mother in the family business and later decided to start her own.

The loan she will now take out is to increase working capital (buy potatoes, rice and cooking oil at wholesale) which she will acquire in the wholesale markets in the city of El Alto, and after preparing them, sell at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she as she is in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLLILAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jaqueline ella es conviviente y tiene 23 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

loans.name: Chingondo Group

texts.en:
Esmie is 51 years old and married. Her husband works as a security officer. She has three children who depend on her.

Esmie runs a small business selling beans. She would like to use this loan to order more bags of beans to sell to her customers at the market, as well as her home where she works from. She hopes to feed and clothe her family with the profits from her business. She started her business to become self-dependent and support her husband in paying for household expenses. A couple of her family members help with the running of the business.

Esmie hopes to repair her dwelling house by replacing the grass-thatched roof with an iron sheet roof. She also hopes to open a second business with the proceeds from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of beans for her business.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and a single mother. She has one child who stays with her mother because Josephine has been unemployed and could not be able to provide for the child.
She recently started a business of selling chicken to local hotels and individual buyers at the Municipal Market. She learnt the art of chicken dressing from her grand father who use to trade at the same market before retiring.
She started her business by stocking chicken given to her on credit by her mother’s friends. She sells the chicken then pays the creditors leaving some income for her. Sometimes she is unable to get the birds on credit and sometimes the Friends do not have the birds. On such occasions she is unable to supply the hotels and therefore earns no income.
Josephine is requesting a loan of US $ 675 to buy a stock of 300 birds. This will enable her meet the demand from her customers without depending so much on her mother’s friends.
The income that she will earn will enable her take her son from her mother and provide for him herself. She will be able to take him to school and to meet her own up keep.
She will employ one other person to help her with the chicken dressing while she concentrates on marketing.
She has enough customers and she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase Chicken from Farmers and re sell to local hotels.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is a 58 year old seamstress, married with 4 kids, 2 working in American Samoa for a fishing company, one locally employed at Aggie Grey Hotel and one finishing school next year.  Tala’s business has provided so much support in her family that she was able to finance her children’s schooling.  Tala will no longer be able to tailor, due to her eye sight. She aims to develop their family plantation because she believes that she’s got the strength together with the husband to work towards achieving and getting good income.

loans.use: To purchase planting materials, fertilizers, chemicals, fungicides

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina is divorced and she has two older children who do not live with her. With the need to incur an income to cover her expenses, she followed a friend’s advice by staring her own business selling nutrition based products. Adelina used to buy these products, which gave her good results, and eventually led to her decision of recommending and selling them. Fortunately, the products have been widely accepted and the demand has grown considerably.

Currently, Adelina needs a loan for $700 dollars to be used in the purchase of products to cover her clients’ orders. She plans to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. Today is a good time to help those in need; you can help Adelina to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelina es divorciada, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad que ya no viven con ella, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para solventar sus gastos, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de productos nutricionales, comenzó por invitación de una amiga. Anteriormente Adelina utilizaba estos productos y obtuvo muy buenos resultados, fue así como decidió recomendarlos y venderlos, afortunadamente los productos que comercializa han tenido gran aceptación y la demanda por ellos se ha incrementado considerablemente.

En estos momentos, Adelina necesita de un préstamo por $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrece devolverlos en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, tú puedes ayudar a Adelina a mejorar su calida de vida, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/ Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 49 years old and married with 6 children. Thirteen years ago she and her husband opened a grocery store, which provided the necessary income to maintain the family and pay off their children's studies. In order to increase their income, Blanca's husband purchased two carts to facilitate door-to-door sales. He used one to sell fruits in the morning and the other to sell ice cream during the afternoons.

With great sacrifice, they realized that their everyday sales resulted in a very good income. Now they desire to increase their stock through Ms Blanca's decision to ask for a loan of 800 dollars to purchase a greater variety of canned goods, dairy products, flour, olive oil, and vegetables. These will help her meet demands since she is the only grocer in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca tiene 49 años, está casada y tiene 6 hijos. Hace 13 años abrió junto con su marido una despensa que les provee del ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y solventar los estudios D. sus hijos. Para poder aumentar sus ingresos su marido compro dos carritos para realizar ventas D. forma ambulante, uno lo utiliza para vender frutas por las mañanas y por las tarD. utiliza otro carrito para salir a vender helados.

Con bastante sacrificio ellos realizan sus ventas todos los días y esto les acarrea buenos ingresos. Hoy día desean aumentar su stock D. mercaderías para el almacén, por lo que Doña Blanca ha decidido solicitar un crédito D. $ 800 que los destinará para compra al por mayor D. productos enlatados, lácteos, harina, aceite y verduras; con esto ella podrá abastecer su demanda pues es el único almacén en la zona.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, dairy products, flour, olive oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Junaedi

texts.id:
Junaedi is a hard working young man. He sells daily goods, such as soap, shampoo, balm, etc. around his neighborhood with his motorcycle. With $500 invested capital, he earns about $5 to $8.50 per day. Junaedi wants to expand his business by hiring a helper that would cost him about $300. He expects his business' productivity and profit to significantly grow with that extra help. Currently Junaedi lives with his friend who owns similar business. They share a room that costs $25/month to rent. Junaedi sends his excess earnings to his parents who still live in Java.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

/b> Junaedi adalah anak muda yang tekun dan ulet, saat ini Junaedi mempunyai usaha berjualan sandal serta kebutuhan Rumah tangga lainnya seperti sabun, shampo, minyak kayu putih dan sebagainya dengan cara berkeliling menggunakan sepeda motor. Dengan modal Rp.5.000.000 Junaedi memperoleh keuntungan Rp.50.000 s/d Rp. 75.000/hari. Junaedi berkeinginan untuk memgembangkan usahanya dengan menambah satu tenaga kerja dengan modal yang dibutuhkan Rp.3.000.000.- dengan harapan keuntungan akan lebih meningkat. Saat ini Junaedi tinggal dengan temannya dengan usaha yang sama, mereka tinggal di tempat kost dengan membayar sewa kamar Rp.250.000./bulan yang tentunya pembayarannya dibagi dua dengan temannya. Dari penghasilannya sebagai penjual kebutuhan sehari-hari Junaedi dapat mengirim sebagian uangnya kepada orang tuanya yang masih tinggal dijawa.

loans.use: Purchase goods to be sold

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
My name is Luis G. and I sell popular consumer products. I've had my business for 4 years. My wife helps me attend our customers, who are from my community. My store is located in front of a public school. This business helps me to support my family. I would like to give jobs to others who can help me provide better customer service. I hope to remodel my home, support my family, and provide a good education with the profits I make from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Luis G. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mi esposa para la atencios de nuestros clientes, los cuales son de mi localidad y son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en frente de una escuela publica, dicha actividad me ayuda a mantener a mi familia y me gustaría en mi futuro poder darle trabajo a otras personas para una mejor atencion a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion, mantener a mi familia y darle un buen estudio a mis dos hijas.

loans.use: to buy popular consumer products

loans.name: Víctor Luis

texts.es:
Victor works hard to cultivate his products such as bananas and avocados. He sells them in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. He began this work because he realized the great business opportunity and economic need in his city, where there was not much work nor many opportunities. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. He is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer, better meeting the demands of his customers who wait for him every Saturday at the market. Let's help Victor as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

Encontramos a Víctor trabajando impetuosamente en el cultivo de deliciosos y apetecibles productos como; el plátano y la palta, productos que posteriormente son comercializados en el mercado siendo muy solicitados por toda la población y comerciantes debido a su calidad y buen sabor. Él se dedica a esta actividad por la inmensa oportunidad de negocio que ha observado y por la necesidad económica que existe en su ciudad de residencia debido a la falta de trabajo y oportunidades, por lo que con gran amor se desempeña en sus actividades agrícolas, ya que este trabajo lo llena de optimismo y además le permite transmitir su apoyo a sus queridos hijos.Él es aún un gran sostén económico en su hogar y por esta razón trabaja incansablemente con un solo objetivo, ofrecerle estudios superiores a sus cuatro queridos hijos. El deseo de este virtuoso padre es mejorar la calidad de sus productos agrícolas, para lo cual necesita comprar mayor cantidad de abonos y semillas a fin de seguir satisfaciendo los paladares de sus clientes que esperan ansiosos cada sábado de feria probar el excelente sabor de sus productos.Para cumplir sus objetivos solicita un préstamo. Ayudemos a Víctor a continuar con su noble tarea por el bienestar de su amada familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE GREATER QUANTITIES OF SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF HIS PRODUCTS AND GROW HIS BUSINESS.

loans.name: Janali

texts.en: Janali is 21-year-old farmer who breeds sheep in the small village of Imishli. He has three years of experience in breeding sheep and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Meat is in very high demand all across the country. Janali has a very small herd and he would like purchase additional sheep to increase his herd, he applied for 1200 USD to purchase 12 sheep for estimated price 60-70 USD, he will use the rest of the money to purchase fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Elva Alicia

texts.es:
Elva Alicia has been running a convenience store for 3 years. She started this business because the salary her husband was earning as a newspaper deliverer was insufficient to meet their living expenses and provide for their 6 year old daughter. Moreover, they just bought their own home and needed to make payments. The convenience store is located in their house; they have increased the amount of items they sell at the store but it is not enough.

For this reason, Elva Alicia requests a loan of $325 which will be paid off in installments over the course of 6 months. This loan will be used to buy merchandise so they can have more variety of items for sale in their store. With your help, Elva will be able to help her husband pay for the house and provide for their little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Elva Alicia tiene desde hace 3 años un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio lo comenzó puesto que lo que gana su esposo como repartidor de periódicos no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos que genera su pequeña hija de 6 años. Además de que acaban de sacar su propia casa y necesitan para pagarla. El negocio de abarrotes lo tienen en su casa y poco a poco han ido incrementando la mercancía sin embargo no es suficiente.

Es por eso que Elva Alicia está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elva podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su tienda. Con tu ayuda Elva podrá ayudarle a su esposo a pagar la casa y a pagar los gastos de su pequeña para poder dejarle un patrimonio a su hija.

loans.use: Comprar más mercancía

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Martina M., who is married with two children, aged 13 and 15.

In 2007, Martina established a bar. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $85 per month from this business. Martina now requests a loan of $275 to purchase additional stocks of beer in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $30. In the future, Martina also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Martina’s bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer in bulk for her pub..

loans.name: Teresia's Tuungane Group

texts.en:
Teresia is single woman. In 2006, she began a business of tailoring clothes. She works from 7:30AM to 6PM and earns a monthly profit of $140.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more raw materials to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing in weaving sales and spare parts sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for a tailoring business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
The general store U. located in the municipality of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega is the business owned by the gentleman Tomas U. who offers his customers a variety of edible products such as sodas, beverages, candy, sweets and crackers. He has been running this business for several years with the intent of providing the daily support for his family. His children are very proud in having such a hard working father and help him take care of the business whenever they have the time available and are not in school such as on the weekends.

Mr. Tomas U. currently is in need to quickly acquire products for their sale. Since he does not have the financial resources he is seeking the support of Ceprodel and requesting a loan which will enable him to buy the beverages and candies that he can sell in his store. It is important to note that he is a loyal customer of the institution and has repaid previous loans on time and according to the established agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La pulpería U. ubicada en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega es el negocio propio del caballero Tomas U. que atiende ofreciendo los diferentes tipos de productos comestibles como gaseosas, bebidas, golosinas, caramelos y galletas. Desde hace varios años se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de proporcionar a su familia el sustento de cada día. Sus hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de tener un padre muy trabajador y por este motivo ellos también le ayudan en la atención del negocio cuando tienen el tiempo necesario y que no están en el colegio como son los fines de semana.

Actualmente la necesidad que el señor Tomas U. atraviesa es la pronta adquisición de los productos para su comercialización. Al no contar con el recurso económico busca el apoyo en Ceprodel y ha solicitado el préstamo con el que logrará la compra de las bebidas y golosinas para venderlas en su pulperia. Es necesario destacar que es fiel cliente de la institución habiendo cancelado los anteriores créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purschase of beverages and edibles.

loans.name: Thi Tuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thị Tường (MS: 11020001), 33 years old, has two small children. Her family do rice farming, raise livestock, have fish pond and also sell feed. The income is 300,000VND a week. She is applying for a loan of 2,006,000VND to buy breeding pigs. Her group has 6 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers except one.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thùa (MS: 11020002) applies for a loan to invest in her grocery stand.
  • Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS: 11020003) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nghiêm Thị Hà (MS: 11020004) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Tuyết (MS: 11020005) applies for a loan to invest in her construction store.
  • Nguyễn Thị Cửi (MS: 11020006) applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thinh (MS: 11020007) applies for a loan of 1,534,000VND to buy feed for pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trần Thị Tường (MS: 11020001), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị có 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị không chỉ làm ruộng, chăn nuôi nhiều ( có mô hình Vườn-Ao- Chuồng) mà còn bán các loại cám cho gia súc, gia cầm.Thu nhập của gia đình chị là khoảng 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lợn giống. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiệm để trả vốn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thùa (MS: 11020002),vay 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị Nguyễn Thị Sáu (MS: 11020003), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Hà (MS: 11020004), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết (MS: 11020005), vay 2.006.000 VND để bán hàng sắt và đồ điện. Chị Nguyễn Thị Cửi (MS: 11020006), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thinh (MS: 11020007), vay 1.534.000 VND để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Comité Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.en:
In the city of San Roque Gonazalez in the neighborhood Sagrado Corazon de Jesús, located 12 km from the Carapeguá office, some women of few resouces learned of the program Women Entrepreneurs Group and decided to meet to receive information about the program. They were looking for a little more support to promote credit through their family incomes and improve their quality of life. These individuals grew thanks to this program. They need this operating credit to invest in their respective micro-businesses and to achieve sustainable growth that makes them grow as a group as well as individuals. Thanks to this new venture, they were able to have better economic returns.

Unable to attend the meeting for the photograph: Cinthia M., for reason of studies, Nilda S., for reason of work, Laura A., for reason of work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for grocery stores, crafts, a freezer, candies, soda, and some ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca started her bakery business in order to take care of her household expenses. Since she was only able to rely on her children for a small amount of help, 10 years ago she decided to start a business selling bread and cakes to her acquaintences and neighbors. They started recommending her to others and today she has a large number of clients.

She needs a loan for US $400, which she will repay in 5 months, to buy ingredients and some cooking equipment which she does not have. With your help, Rebeca will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rebeca inicio el negocio de reposteria para salir adelante con los gastos de su casa ya que solo cuenta con la ayuda minima de sus hijos, para solventar los gastos de su casa, por lo que deicido comenzar su negocio hace 10 años, vendiendo pan y pasteles, a sus conocidos y vecinos, quienes la fueron recomendando y actualmente ya tiene un gran numero de clientes que la conocen.

Ella necesita un credito por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima y algunos accesorios de cocina que le hacen falta. Con tu apoyo Rebeca saldra adelante.

loans.use: Buy ingredients.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., 61, and her husband, Mr. Oeun Kim, 61, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1973 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Two sons study in local school, and one daughter weaves silk at home.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver for forty-seven years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Oeun raises cows.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Ndèye Salimatou

texts.fr: Ndèye Salimatou S., 38 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Salimatou S., 38, married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for 6 years. She wants to purchase peanuts to make into peanut butter for sale. The income from her business will allow her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment./b>

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Senada

texts.en:
Senada was born in 1979 and lives in Kalesija, Bosnia.  She is unmarried and lives with her parents.  She works as a tailor at a textile factory and earns 450KM/month.  (The equivalent of roughly $300USD.)  This is barely enough to meet her basic needs, so she also tailors clothing from her home at night with her friend's sewing machine.


Senada requests a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women International, which she will use to purchase her own sewing machine.  She hopes to start designing her own clothing and thinks that through fashion she can create a better life for herself.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 49 years old and lives in Nghe An Province. She has been in TYM for four years. She first took a loan to invest in a small trading business. Now her family has a restaurant in Nghi Loc district, which is the family's major income. She is requesting a loan to increase her food supply for the restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio tiene 51 años de edad,  habita en barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua, estado civil casado su esposa es ama de casa y tienen seis hijos de los seis, cinco ya son mayores y el menor  de 16 años de edad estudia. Los planes para su familia es dejarle un patrimonio en cual  sus hijos puedan tener .Don Julio se desempeña como vigilante en unos de los mercados de la capital desde hace ocho años. Sus objetivos  en el ámbito económico es cambiar de trabajo con un mejor salario construir su casa por completo quiere construir las divisiones de adentro son de madera y casi no tiene privacidad, y le resulta muy incomodo es por eso que desea hacer esta construcción. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedras, ladrillos y ofrecerle a su familia sus propios espacios, la seguridad y protección para ellos.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio is 51 years old, lives in the neighborhood Villa Reconciliación in the capital of Managua, is married, his wife is a homemaker and they have six children, of the six five are older and the youngest is 16 years old and in school. The plan for their family is to leave an estate that their children could have. Mr. Julio has worked as a guard in one of the markets in the capital for eight years. His economic objectives are to change his job for a better paying one and build a complete house- he wants to build divisions because the inside is wooden and there is no privacy, which is uncomfortable and for this reason he wants to do this construction. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic he can purchase construction material such as: cement, iron, stones, bricks and give his family their own spaces and security and protection.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make divisions in his house

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran A. is 39 years of age. He lives with his wife and three children. Kamran has been breeding livestock for nine years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover his living expenses. He goes out every morning to graze his animals. He enjoys caring for his animals, and he is grateful that this work puts food on the table for his children. Kamran’s family is his greatest love, and they are the biggest motivators in his life. He will use the loan to purchase young cattle, which will revitalize his herd and help him become the best breeder in his area. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor M. is a supportive husband to his wife, Fely M.. The public primary school building situated in their village, commonly called Barangay Casilagan, is where they put up their school canteen business. The couple is mainly focusing on the business at present since they don’t have any children yet. Melchor is 25 years old while his wife is just 23 years old. The couple chooses to be thankful that their children have not arrived yet. They just enjoy each other’s company while waiting for their baby or babies.

Apart from hoping that they will be good and responsible parents, Melchor also wants his family to be financially stable by means of sustaining the livelihood resource they are managing now. This is the reason why he wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional financial capital for their school canteen. Being the head of the family, Melchor should perform his task well by being hard-working, responsible and patient towards the development of their small business enterprise in their village. He also adds that through this program, he hopes to have a good start to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: additional capital for their school canteen

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes García tiene 53 años, es soltera, no tiene hijos. Es por eso que se dedica a su negocio, sus propósitos son mantener la actividad económica ya que este es su único ingreso. Hace veintiún años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Las actividades económicas de Doña Mercedes es un comedor y una pulpería y aquí ofrece las comidas como: tacos, gallo pinto y gaseosas. Por lo que su única ayuda a la que puede recurrir son los financiamientos ya que estos ayudan a fortalecer su negocio. Sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un buen lugar para vivir. El financiamiento solicitado es para la compra de capital de trabajo como: granos básicos, gaseosa, refrescos naturales y verduras por lo que le gustaría que recibir la ayuda necesaria paras seguir con su negocio. la cantidad solicitada es de C$12.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Mercedes G. is 53 years old, single, and has no children. This is why she is dedicated to her business. Her goals are to maintain her economic activity since this is her only source of income. For 21 years she has owned this business. Ms. Mercedes' businesses are a restaurant and a small grocery store. Here she offers food such as tacos, gallo pinto (a spicy dish with rice and beans) and sodas. The only help she has access to is this kind of financing, which helps strengthen her business. The requested loan is for working capital such as basic grains, sodas, fresh juices, and vegetables; she needs this to help her continue operating her business. The amount requested is C$12,000 cordobas over a 12 month period.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Carol Ivette

texts.es: La Señora Carol Ivette Gaitán A. tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Carol es la venta de productos de belleza. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio, Doña Carol comenzó con una pequeña pulpería desde hace tres años ella inicio vendiendo pan, tamales, leche agria por lo que las ganancias de estos fueron invertidos en su negocio ya que los ingresos de la pulpera disminuyeron, es así como decide establecerse con el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza. Los propósitos de Doña Carol son de obtener buenas ventas por lo que tiene que promocionar sus productos y sus clientes puedan interesarse en sus productos. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para realizar la compra de más productos. Los sueños de Doña Carol son de obtener un trabajo más estable para que su familia no pase necesidades económicas. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 4.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Carol Ivette Gaitán A. is a single, 24 year old woman. Ms. Carol's business is beauty product sales. She has been working for more than five years. She started with a little store three years ago, and she started out selling bread, tamales, and milk, and invested the earnings from her sales in her cosmetics business, since the earnings from her store were decreasing. This is how she decided to establish herself with her cosmetics sales.

Ms. Carol's goals are to obtain better sales by marketing her products to increase interest among her customers. This is why she is asking for this loan, to use as working capital to buy more products. Ms. Carol's dream is to find a more stable job so her family doesn't want for anything. She is asking for $4.000 córdobas (about $200 US).

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purcahse of merchandise

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Hà năm nay 55 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm  2004. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị  là từ chăn nuôi cá, lợn gà với thu nhập  2.500.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hà mong muốn được vay 17.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc chăn nuôi lợn  tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Dang Thi H. is 55 years old. She has two grown-up children. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2004. Currently, the businesses that bring the major source of income for her family are fishes, pigs, and chickens raising with an income of VND 2,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. H. wishes to borrow VND17,000,000 to invest more in pig raising to improve her family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan T. Nguyễn was born in 1984. (No: 010105060027 ). She lives with her husband and two children. They have a breeding farm (chicken, pigs, fish) and they grow trees. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND (or 225 USD). She is a group leader. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry. There are four other Fund participants in her group.
 Hồng Thị Đặng was born in 1974. (No: 010105060030). She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND.  She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or 233 USD) to breed pigs and poultry. 
 Hồng Thị Vương was born in 1975. (no:010105060031). She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 VND (112 USD). She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND (or 208 USD)  to breed pigs and poultry. 
 Tuyết Thị Ánh Trử was born in 1982. (No:: 010105060028). She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND (169 USD). She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or 233 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Basilia R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de artesanías de madera ofrecidas en su localidad el cual la posee muy surtida gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en su negocio.

Actualmente, el negocio requiere de una inversión por medio de la compra de los productos artesanos y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo por medio de dichas compras.
texts.en:
In Chinandega city, Ana Basilia R. sells hand-crafted wooden items from her store which she keeps well-stocked thanks to her many business efforts. Currently, the business requires an investment in additional wooden artisan works, and to do this she has sought the support of Ceprodel, requesting a loan to purchase these products so she can advance her business. Her store really needs Ceprodel's support, which can be provided with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of artisan works

loans.name: Ilmer

texts.es:
ILMER V. D. O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” con domicilio en el Jr. TRUJILLO  N° 252 del distrito D. Callería, tiene 47 años, 04 hijos, dos D. ellos menores, y su esposo trabaja en el área D. administración en una institución educativa.

La primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró golosinas y los ofreció en la vereda D. su casa para venderlos, pero el negocio no resultó debido a que había muchas bodegas cerca D. su casa y decidió cambiar D. negocio y empezó a vender  ropa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra D. ropas como; blusas, pantalones, etc. para luego salir a vender a sus amistades.

En los tres años que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante, además se siente feliz D. ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y sobre todo en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Ilmer V. D. O. is a member of the "Las Divinas" Community Bank; she lives in the Callería district. She is 47 and has 4 children, two of them minors. Her husband works in the administrative area of a school.

With her first loan (300 new sols) she bought candy to sell outsiD. her house. The business was not successful as there were a lot of shops nearby, so she decided to change the business and began selling clothes.

With this loan of 1,800 new sols, she will buy clothes (blouses, trousers, etc.) for sale to acquaintances.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos NGO for three years and is very grateful for the assistance provided to women in order to succeed; she is also happy to be able to help her husband and children and, above all, the household finances.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing such as blouses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana A. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Juliana sells cookies and meat pies at Sekondi, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a teacher. Juliana uses her income for feeding the family. Juliana will use the loan to support her business, towards the making of cookies. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To support her business in the making of cookies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
For the past five years, Maria has been selling beauty products out of her home. She sells cosmetics through word-of-mouth referrals and by visiting beauty salons and spas. Her work pays off and she's able to supplement her income as a housekeeper, which in turn helps provide for her four sons and eight grandchildren.

Like many entrepreneurs, Maria has faced many challenges, the biggest one being not having access to capital to grow her home-based business. The lack of capital has delayed her plans for expansion, plans for opening a small cosmetic retail store in the neighborhood where she lives. 

Maria was very grateful to hear about ACCION USA and applied for $1,000 loan to buy merchandise in bulk to diversify her inventory and to get better pricing, thus increasing her profit margin. Maria plans to continue growing her business so as to turn it into a small retail store one day. She also gets a sense of accomplishment from helping other women in her community start their home-based sales businesses.

loans.use: purchasing beauty merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Maria Carmita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Carmita es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza perteneciente al barrio Punta Corral, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Hacen pequeñas fiestas entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras, hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúnen cada 2 semanas. 
La señora María Carmita tiene 36 años, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, 17,13y 9, de los cuales viven con ella todavía, la de 13 estudia en una academia de corte y confección llamada Digna Rodríguez ubicada vía al sector de Baños de cuenca, el de 9 estudia en la escuela Francisco Astudillo del sector de Turi, la señora trabaja como empleada en varias casas de su comunidad, limpiando y haciendo los quehaceres domésticos.   
Pidió 440 dólares para poder invertir en la compra de pollos de cría para la venta, comenta que los pollos que ella cría salen a la venta a partir de los 45 días con un peso de 5 a 6 libras, ella compra pollos que cuesta en el mercado a 2,50 dólares cada uno, también comprará alimentos para las aves que consumen en un porcentaje de dos sacos de chanca y dos de pronaca en un mes por 30 pollos; la pronaca actualmente esta costando 20 dólares y la chanca 16 dólares.
Su meta para el futuro es mejorar de salud y tener estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Carmita is a member of the communal bank Mujer y Fortaleza (Women and Strength), in the Punta Corral neighborhood. The group of women lives in the community of Turi, about half an hour outside of the city of Cuenca, in the south of Ecuador. The women in this group get along very well with each other; they spend their meetings laughing and telling jokes. They have small parties with each other for occasions like mother's day, and they are great collaborators. They even take turns sweeping the house where they meet every two weeks.

Maria Carmita is 36, married, and has three children, 17, 13, and 9 years old, who still live with her. The 13-year-old studies in a school for tailoring called Digna Rodríguez, in the Baños sector of Cuenca; the 9-year-old studies at the Francisco Astudillo school in the Turi sector. Maria works in several homes in her community, cleaning and doing domestic chores.

She has requested 440 dollars to be able to invest in buying chickens to sell. She said that the chickens she raises are ready to sell after 45 days, and weigh 5 to 6 pounds. She buys chickens in the market that cost $2.50 each, and also buys bird feed that they eat--two sacks of "chanca" and two of "pronaca" feed in one month for 30 chickens. The "pronaca" costs 20 dollars per sack and the "chanca" is 16 dollars.

Her goal for the future is to improve her health and have economic stability for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bolster his shop

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Edelyn Tresuelo T. has been a resident of Prk. Ice Plant, Brgy. Sebucao, San Enrique, Negros Occidental since birth. She is now 42 years old and is married to Teodoro T. who works as a baker in one of the bakeries in Bacolod City. They had 3 daughters but unfortunately one died because of an illness.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 and had her first PHP 3,000 loan which she used as additional capital in her food vending business. But the main purpose for why she joined was the insurance coverage that all NWTF-Project Dungganon members enjoyed - she knew that her family would benefit from such coverage.

Edelyn knew how precious such security would be to her family because at the time that she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she was already burdened with the health problems of her youngest child. The hardship and heartache she experienced with her child's medical difficulties did not hinder her from exerting more energy to sustain her food vending business. Instead it gave her the strength to continue moving on for she knew that NWTF-Project Dungganon would be her only refuge in her mission to improve her family's standard of living. Sometime in 2006, in spite of their best efforts, her youngest daughter died as a result of her lingering illness and the family was left deep in debt. But, Edelyn still remained active with the loan with no delayed payments.

Years later, when she could borrow a bigger loan, she decided to venture into a different business activity. That is when she started her "Sari-sari," or general store business. With the help of her Dungganon loans, her businesses enabled her to buy and renovate the house they were living in, which she was only renting before, have water connected to it, buy furnishings and appliances, and send her 2 surviving children to college. In the 6 years that she has been a Project Dungganon member, Edelyn can proudly testify that NWTF not only helped her through all the hardships, but also continues with her on her journey as she walks away from poverty.

For her 11th loan, Edelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 to continue expanding her business activities so that she can secure the future of her 2 surviving children and continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Food Vending Business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, ella esta separada de su esposo hace 4 años y es madre de 03, y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una socia fundadora del Banco Comunal su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora va a comprar ganado vacuno para yunta.

Su mayor deseo es comprar mas ganado y  ver profesionales a  sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las socializaciones con sus compañeras
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the San Juan de Tahuaco Communal Bank which is located in the San Juan de Tahuaco District of Yunguyo in the Chucuito Province within the Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, separated, a mother of three, and completed primary education. She lives in the community of San Juan de Tahuaco. Isabel has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years and is a founding member of the Communal Bank. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was used to buy small livestock. Now she is requesting a loan of 1500 nuevos soles with which she will buy cattle for a yoke. Isabel's greatest hopes are to buy more livestock and to see her children become professionals. Isabel enjoys socializing with her bank partners.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing cattle

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepción

texts.es:
Ramona O. se dedica a la venta de ropa exhibiendola en su establecimiento donde a diario es visitada por sus clientes que acuden para adquirir la ropa. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos por su negocio.

Actualmente, el crédito lo ha solicitado para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa ya que se le está agotando y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramona O. sells clothing displayed at her store where she is visited everyday by her clients who come to shop for clothes. It is important to point out that she has been able to get ahead thanks to the effort put in the business. Currently, the loan requested is to purchase merchandise because her inventory levels are low and with the loan the conditions of the business will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Lusbe

texts.es: La señora Lusbe, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida, ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su negocio de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Elsita, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Lusbe is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Rosario” which is in the District of Bellavista, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 48 years old, single, and the mother of 4 dependent children. Secure in her knowledge of preparing different types of dishes, Lusbe took the initiative to secure her first loan of 300 soles to start selling food. She operates out of her home, which is well suited for her business. Despite being in business for a long time, Lusbe continues to do well because of her loyal customers who visit her daily. She greets everyone with her charismatic personality.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase supplies for her daily preparation of meals such as sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, and utensils to maintain her business and provide better service to her customers. As long as she has the strength, Lusbe feels she can continue working so that she can get ahead and secure a peaceful retirement. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Elly's Group

texts.en:
K. Elly is 61 years old and married with six children aged 12 to 24 years. He is a strong and hard-working man who also helps to take care of four orphans.

Elly has a butcher shop in Kizinda town where he has been selling fresh meat for twenty years. He is grateful that, at the moment, he is able to make about $215 in profits each month. Elly says that he started as a helper for four years in his father’s butcher shop, and later started up his own, where he was buying meat in kilograms. He is happy that now he buys the whole animals for meat.

He has been successful because of the quality meat that he sells, as well as having good customer care. Elly says that there is a lot of competition in his business, but he believes this is no threat because of his good service.

He needs a loan to help buy a cow for meat.

loans.use: Buying a cow for meat.

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en: Tafa F. is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Gagaifo Lefaga. She is married and has five adult children. Tafa owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2009, Tafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia YOVANA pertenece al banco comunal “Vilcanota”.  

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La socia vive en la provincia de Cusco y viene a las reuniones de este banco comunal. Ella es de profesión contadora pública y también tiene su stand de venta de ropa en el mercado “Pacifico del Sur” en la ciudad de Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabaja y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante su profesión. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio entonces tener mejores ingresos y darse una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Vilcanota communal bank.

She is 29 years old, single, and does not have any children. She lives in the province of Cusco and attends the communal bank meetings. She is a public accountant and also has a clothing sales stand at the “Pacífico del Sur” market in the city of Cusco. She has been working for several years and she has done well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Yovana is a hardworking and enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead in her profession. She needs a loan to purchase and sell merchandise such as clothing for men, women, and children for Christmas festivities. This way, she can increase business capital and have better earnings and a better quality of life.

Yovana is grateful for the opportunity provided to her by the communal bank and she promises to make her loan payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase and sell merchandise such as clothing for men, women, and children for Christmas festivities

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu A. is currently in the business of selling fresh fish in a market and is requesting a loan to purchase more dry and fresh fish to sell. Abu is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children who go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more dry and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Samuel Ricardo

texts.es: El Señor Samuel, vive en la zona de alto tejar, es divorsiado y tiene 2 hijas que son ya independientes, el señor ofrece a la venta peliculas en formato dvd, generalmente el va de empresa en empresa ofreciendo a los ejecutivos las primisias en peliculas y lo hace ambulando, lo bueno es que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes los cuales constantemente van comprando sus videos, el trabajo que el realiza es cansador ya que tiene que caminar varias calles de nuestra ciudad, el Sr. Samuel ya lleva varios años con el negocio, el señor es muy activo ya que en sus tiempos libres, tambien ofrece una variedad de productos a las personas que estan caminando productos tales como boligrafos, llaveros, y algunos de temporada como por ejemplo juegos artificiales y algunas novedades que pueda ofrecer.
texts.en:
El Señor Samuel lives in the Alto Tejar district. He is divorced and has two daughters that are now independent. He goes from business to business and offers first-run movies in DVD format to executives. What is good is that he has a large number of steady customers who buy his DVDs. His work is tiring because he has to walk through many streets in our city. He has pursued this line of work for several years. Very active in his free time, he also sells a variety of products to people walking by such as pens, key rings, some seasonal products like fireworks, and novelties that are available.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela M. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Estela owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Estela is requesting a new loan of 44,704 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 27th from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and spareparts for the motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Edis Ramón

texts.es:
El señor  Edis V. siempre se ha dedicado ala actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de vacas las que alimenta, cuida, con el fin de extraer la leche para comercializarla en el municipio de cinco pinos y así obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de tres vacas para aumentar el hato y así extraer mas leche para beneficio de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Edis V. has always worked with livestock, raising cows that he feeds and cares for in order to get milk. He sells the milk in the town of Cinco Pinos and the income he gets goes towards supporting his household. He is asking for this loan in order to buy three cows to increase his herd. This will let him produce more milk and it will benefit his family, who he loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows to increase his herd

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary C. is from the village of Ta Preah in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In order to support her farming, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to help her growing crops. 

Her husband, Mr. Chan Vorleak Nhim, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. 
                
Mrs. Sotheary C. is the mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the public school, while the second one is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is a married mother of three children.  Her husband, Romeo is a boat driver in the community while she manages her own fish business to supply additional income for the family.   Melina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been in business for almost two years.  

Melina would like to receive a loan amounting 20,000 PHP to reconstruct her fishing business as it was partially destroyed by Hurricane Ondoy last year. The loan funds will be used as working capital for her fish business to fund raw materials like a fish net, bamboo, rope, fingerlings (small fish), as well as labor costs.  A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2006 Melina has been a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans.

Her long-term goal is to renovate her home.  Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund continued education for all three children.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success to build more long-term financial security for herself and her family.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To fund raw materials like a fish net, bamboo, rope, fingerlings (small fish), as well as labor costs

loans.name: Jesusa Saluta Group

texts.en:
Jesusa S. is from the village of Camanse, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Jesusa is the group leader for a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jesusa is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jesusa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jesusa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jesusa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jesusa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ndèye Khoury

texts.en: Ndèye Khoury N. is 59 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" DIAMAGUENE1 for two years and has always paid back her loans. Her main activity consists of selling building materials. She wants to use this loan to buy cement, iron, pipes, etc., which she will resell. The revenues generated by this activity allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Luis Diego

texts.es:
Luis Diego C. F., tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 12,10,10 y 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado (terneros), la idea es comprar terneros para engordarlos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Luis Diego trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado y está muy motiva porque con esto va a poder aumentar el número de animales que posee, al mismo tiempo que mejorará su calidad. El cuenta con un área de potrero donde se desarrollan los animales. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis Diego C. F. is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are his top priority. Their ages are 12, 10, 10, and 4. His loan will be used to buy cattle (calves) for fattening. Luis Diego wants to maintain them properly so that he can get the best price when it comes time to sell them. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Don Luis Diego has been raising cattle for several years and is highly motivated because this loan will help him increase the numbers in his herd and also improve the quality of the animals. He owns land where they will be able to develop. Luis Diego hopes in the future to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is 29 years old and married, with one child.  She operates Linda's Cafe while her husband sells clothes.  In addition, she rents houses.  She has run the cafe for three years and hopes to expand it. She uses her income to pay wages to her three employees and to support her family.  She joined Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend to a group called Millennium so that she could easily access loans.  She has requested her first loan of KES 50,000 to enlarge her cafeteria and buy food supplies.

loans.use: To enlarge the cafeteria and buy food supplies

loans.name: Emma Lilian
