texts.es: Emma Lilian D. L. M. D. C. D. 56 años D. edad, es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien trabaja desD. su casa la cual esta ubicada en Apopa, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, y otros productos más los cuales son básicos en este tipo D. negocios. Emma vive junto a su hija D. 29 años D. edad, quien trabaja como comerciante, y junto a sus dos nietos menores D. edad, quienes se dedica a estudiar educación básica. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que tanto Emma como su hija son mujeres muy trabajadoras, las cuales se dedican por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Emma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a sus nietos y su hija.
texts.en:
Emma Lilian D. L. M. D. C., 56, is a very cheerful and kind woman who works from home in Acopa, San Salvador department. She has a grocery store where she stocks items for the home and for personal use such as: soap, shampoo, bread, milk, sweets and other products that are basic to this kind of business. Her 29-year-old daughter who is a merchant and her two minor grandchildren who are in elementary school live with her. Her friends and neighbors have provided good references for her because both Emma and her daughter are very hard-working women who are completely dedicated to the wellbeing of their household. Emma is asking for funds to buy stock items for her store so that she can increase her inventory thereby offering more products to her customers thus improving her profits so that she can get ahead together with her daughter and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro de 53 años, es casado vive en una pequeña casa a pesar que es humilde vive con las comodidades necesarias. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de medicamento, siente que todavía le falta mucho por emprender, y recuerda lo mucho que le ha costado ser un buen comerciante, pues todos los días sube a los buses para ofrecer sus productos él, tiene que mostrar mucho conocimiento con lo que ofrece el lee enciclopedia, diccionarios, revistas y tras cosas.  Para el futuro les gustaría establecer su propia tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio. El dinero lo invertirá en comprar más cantidad de mercadería con el propósito de ofrecer diferente productos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 53 years old. He is married and lives in a small humble home with the necessary comforts. For more than 20 years he has been in the business of selling medications. He feels that he still has a long way to go as an entrepreneur and remembers what is has taken for him to become a good businessman. Each day he boards busses to sell his products. He needs to be very knowledgeable about what he sells, so he reads encyclopedias, dictionaries, magazines, and other literature. In future he would like to establish his own store so that he can offer better service. He will use the money from this loan to buy products in bulk, so that he can offer a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Rolando Bladimir

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 24 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Osicala del departamento de Morazán, es soltero, vive con sus dos hermanos y se dedica a la confección de hamacas.
Aprendió  el oficio gracias a su madre de la edad de 13 años y tiene tres años de manejar su negocio que en colaboración de sus hermanos elaboran hamacas, todos los días desde muy temprano se dedican a tejer ya que de esta producción depende los ingresos para subsistir.
Rolando necesita el préstamo para compra de hilos de seda de diferentes colores, manquillas, tubos, que son materiales para la elaboración de las hamacas, esto ayudara para que  disponga de los materiales y seguir trabajando para  generar ingresos,solventar necesidades básicas de su familia.
Su objetivo es realizar una buena inversión, su sueño es incrementar su negocio, ventas, mejorar los ingresos y garantizar la sostenibilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is twenty-four years old and lives in the municipality of Osicala, in the department of Morazan. He is single, lives with his two brothers, and makes hammocks for a living. He learned this trade from his mom when when he was thirteen and has been running this business, making hammocks with his brothers, for three years. They begin weaving early in the morning each day because their income depends on what they produce. Rolando needs a loan to buy different colors of silk threads, sleeves, and tubes -- all materials for making hammocks. This will help him get the materials and be able to continue earning an income and taking care of his family's needs. His goal is to make a good investment and he dreams of growing his business, sales, and of improving his earnings to guarantee his family's security.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different colored silk thread, sleeves, tubes.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es:
Alfonsa es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Alfonsa tiene un bar en su casa en donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo. Además Alfonsa junto a su esposo son artesanos textiles, actividad que realiza con ayuda de tejedores, Alfonsa se dedica al bordado de los productos, sus productos los vende a intermediarios que llevan a la ciudad de Cusco y Puno. También tienen un grupo musical. Solicita un crédito de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de instrumentos musicales. 
Alfonsa sueña con mejorar su casa con acabados, techar el segundo piso y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfonsa lives with a partner and has 4 children, 2 of whom are in school. Alfonsa has a bar in her house where she sells drinks. She works in this business every day, with the occasional help of her husband. In addition, Alfonsa and her husband make artisan textiles with the help of weavers. Alfonsa embroiders the products, and they are sold to traders that come from the city of Cusco and Puno. In addition, they have a musical group. She requests a loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of musical instruments. Alfonsa dreams of finishing construction on her home by putting a roof on the second floor, and of being able to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy musical instruments

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth M. is from the village of Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is 42 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Lilibeth owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods (products such as textiles, ready-to-wear clothing, and sundries) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in hog and poultry raising. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To make a new investment in hog and poultry raising

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence H. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Florence is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Florence owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like soap, noodles, and toothpaste in the local community. Florence has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florence joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florence is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Florence from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es: Victor tiene 24 años, el se dedica al transporte desde hace 1 año, trabaja en su mototaxi, la cual le brinda sus ingresos que le permiten sustentar a sus padres y a su casa, su sueño es tener su propia empresa y lograr incrementar sus ingresos para darle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, el solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old. He has been providing public transport for the past year. He uses his motorcycle transport and it provides him with an income to help support his parents and cover the household expenses. His dream is to have his own company and increase his earnings. He wishes to provide his parents with a better quality of life and to this end his requests a loan. He will invest in maintenance repairs to his motorcycle transport. He is eligible for a loan following good personal references and his ability to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Tima Ole

texts.en: Tima, 23 years old, has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last three years. He says the business is profitable as long as one gets the timing right –  that is when to buy and when to sell. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the cash to buy more animals which he will rear and sell in the future. Tima also plans to start planting cereals on his piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en: Solongo D. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her elder two sons attend a secondary school, while her infant son stays at home. Her husband helps out with the business and also works as an electrician to supplement the family's income. Solongo operates a grocery shop with the help of her mother and husband. She sells a variety of foodstuffs through her grocery shop. Solongo has been in this business since 2005 and has built a stable operation. For the future, Solongo hopes to continue to expand her business and save money in order to obtain assets for her children. She is very hardworking. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase more supplies and food items for her store in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and food items

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 35-year-old married man and the owner of a car tire repair and selling shop since 2004. 

Mazen is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy an important machine necessary to improve his business.  Mazen's clients can be anyone in need of such service. His experience in this field, his honesty and the service he provides attracts most of his clients. 

Mazen hopes to develop and improve his business to eventually own a big car maintenance garage.

loans.use: To buy a machine necessary for his business

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
When Laura M.’ children were old enough to go to school, Laura was ready to begin working and start her own tortilla-making business. Laura and her husband started La Milpa Tortilleria in 1998 and they have since hired two employees, bought a house and put two children through college. 

This is Laura’s third loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana. Her first two loans were for machinery and capital. She plans on opening another location with this loan and buying all the necessary equipment to stock the new space. Before Laura found ACCION, she tried desperately to access credit through banks and even tried to refinance her home. Now, she has successfully repaid two ACCION loans, each of which contributed significantly to the growth of La Milpa. Laura’s advice to people who want to start their own businesses is, “Go for it! Starting a business is not an easy task. You have to persevere, do your best, and never give up. It is a hard process and you sacrifice a lot but it is well worth it if it helps you provide a better future for you and your family.”

loans.use: To open a second location and buy machinery to make tortillas

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Madame Marie N. est une femme de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE SUD depuis le 25 juin 2002.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. Elle est détentrice d'un salon de coiffure

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son approvisionnement en effets et produits pour mieux satisfaire et fidéliser sa clientèle 

Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille par la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants par exemple
texts.en: Mrs. Marie N. is a 39 year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Montagne Sud since the 25th of June, 2002. She has been a hairdresser since she joined the Village Bank. She is the owner of a hair salon. With this new loan, she will strengthen her stock of products in order to better satisfy and retain her customers. She uses her income to improve her family's living conditions with food and to finance her children's education, for example.

loans.use: To promote her hairdressing business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia O. is from the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 33 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arsenia raises pigs for fattening and sale. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Arsenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Arsenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Bernard Sub. Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old. Gemma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates two businesses: a sari-sari (variety) store and a rent-a-car business. She has been engaged in her businesses for over 13 months and earns approximately 35,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing businesses

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 20 years old and single with children. Her business is selling clothes such as sweatshirts, t-shirts, underwear, and pants in Cusco. She buys the clothes wholesale in Juliaca, Peru and resells them on the street here in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to go to Juliaca to buy more inventory. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her cothing sales business

loans.name: Feliza's Group

texts.en:
Feliza G. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 63 years old. Feliza is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Feliza is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $126 when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008, Feliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Feliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a twenty-two year-old, single male and rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the motorcycle business for the last three years.  He started by riding a bicycle and now rides a motorcycle. His hardship is during the rainy season when it is hard to ride.  His vision is to buy his own motorcycle.  Paul needs credit to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motor cycle for transport business.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 28 years old. Ralph is single. To make a living, Ralph owns & operates a  motorela or habal-habal business, providing service to local community members. Ralph has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ralph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ralph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand his services. 

Ralph is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to maintain his vehicle. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ralph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Zobeida Judith

texts.es: Zobeida necesita comprar prendas de vestir  y calzado apropiado, porque tiene muchos clientes que lo han pedido para disfrutar de eventos   y bailar en la temporada de carnaval, fiestas de gran   derroche de talento y folclor caribe, entre disfraces, vestidos elegantes estrafalarios en un solo “disfrázate como quieras” y esto es justamente lo que haría con su credikiva,  comprar  camisetas, calzado, vestidos para niñas adecuados a esta fecha.   Zobeida inició su negocio vendiendo diversos productos mediante guías especializadas hace siete años,  inicialmente  cosméticos y accesorios , pero gradualmente cuando empezó a reunir un pequeño capital agregó ropa femenina, infantil y masculina, su primer mercado fue el de educadores y actualmente se ha expandido a otros cliente, entre amas de casa, estudiantes, trabajadores dependientes e independientes;   Zobeida cuando inició su negocio lo hizo para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar,  pues se dio cuenta que ambos debían ingresar dinero al hogar, para fomentar  en  sus tres hijos, que están en las edades de  3 a 20 años, un futuro exitoso mediante una educación de calidad.  Por eso no abandona su meta de organizar su negocio y darle un enfoque de almacén en un local  independiente, porque actualmente funciona en su propia vivienda  y esto repercute en el sosiego familiar, por eso desea independizar el espacio productivo del doméstico y ella trabajará fuertemente en ese propósito.
texts.en:
Zobeida has many customers who enjoy the events and dances during the Carnival season, so she needs to buy appropriate shoes and clothes she can sell. These celebrations overflow with great talent and Caribbean folklore, as manifested through the costumes, elegant gowns, and bizarre outfits in which people are invited to “disguise yourself however you want”. This is the precise reason for her Kiva loan. Zobeida will buy shirts, shoes, and girls’ dresses that are appropriate for this occasion. She started this business seven years ago by selling different products through specialized catalogs. At first she sold cosmetics and accessories, but as she accumulated a little bit of capital, she began offering clothes for women, children, and men. Her first customers were teachers and now she has expanded to other groups such as housewives, students, hired workers, and the self-employed.

When she started this business, Zobeida wanted to help her husband with managing their household. With two sources of household income, she is able to provide for her three children, who range in age from 3 to 20, and give them a quality education so that they will have a successful future. Zobeida has not abandoned her goal of organizing her business. Her focus is on opening a store in another location because she currently operates her business out of her home. By having a separate location, she will be able to maintain the family peace at home, so she is working hard to achieve this objective.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, shoes, and girls’ dresses for the Carnival season

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
Marina P. is from Palattao, Naguillan, Isabela.  She is 39 years old.  Marina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marina is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Marina owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Marina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Marina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Marina from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel  est un commerçant de HOPE Congo de 37 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6ans à 22 ans.

 Il commence ce commerce de quincaillerie en 2002. En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours.

Avec le second prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer son activité en achetant, des sanitaires, des robinets, des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des pointes de toute taille.... 

A l’ avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses économies, ainsi que pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin. Il pense aussi à envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes écoles pour leur formations scolaire.
texts.en:
Michel is a merchant with HOPE Congo. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of three children, aged 6 to 22. He started this hardware business in 2002. On average, his sales amount to approximately 5,000 to 50,000 francs per day.

With a second loan he expects to receive, Michel is going to bolster his business by buying toilets, faucets, circuit breakers, fuses, and spark plugs of any size.  

For the future, he is thinking of getting started in wholesale with this savings, as well as opening a large store. He is also thinking of sending his children to top schools for their training and education.

loans.use: to buy toilets, faucets, and circuit breakers

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen T., 29, who has been a local farmer for many years in the province of Kompong Tom, also raises pigs behind her house for additional profit. Khen is married to Say Sorn, 42, who is currently selling firewood to earn a living. This couple has five children. Because Khen's pig-raising business is very profitable, earning income that benefits her entire family, she will use her loan to purchase extra piglets to breed for selling.

loans.use: to purchase extra piglets to breed for selling.

loans.name: Khayala

texts.ru:
Khayala zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka kotoromu 3 qoda. Khayala K. rodilas v 1984 qodu. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas vmeste so svoyey semyoy projivayet v Fuzuli regione.
Ona uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom, v osnovnom ona razvodit kuric i indeyek. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i indeyet dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Khayala is married and has a three-year-old child.  Khayala K. was born in 1984.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.

She has been poultry farming for two years, primarily raising chickens and turkeys.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K. lives in the Baray district of Cambodia. She is a 42-year-old married woman who sells merchandise by peddling. She has been operating this business since 1995 and makes around $3.75 each day. 

To help Keo K. with their increasing expenses, her husband works at a rubber plantation. Besides selling, Keo K. has been planting a few crops on her farmland. The rainy season is coming now and Keo K. is asking for a loan to plant potato crops. 

Keo K. is a mother of two children who are both in school.

loans.use: to plant potato crops

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a 58-year-old married man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Edgardo has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost 20 years. He sells soft drinks, biscuits and other various products. He also owns a small parcel of land that he cultivates to grow rice.

Edgardo has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase rice seeds and items to sell such as canned goods and sugar. Edgardo hopes to expand his store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and items to sell such as canned goods and sugar

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, D. 64 años D. edad vive en casa propia con su esposo. Durante mucho tiempo María se ha dedicado a la venta D. diferentes tipos D. vitaminas y medicamentos que con mucho amor comercializa D. manera ambulante en diferentes zonas cercanas a su lugar D. residencia. A pesar D. ser una mujer D. edad avanzada no se da por vencida, es una mujer llena D. energía, carisma y espíritu. Gracias a su dedicación y amabilidad en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchas personas y por el momento son muchos los clientes que solicitan sus productos. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para poder comprar variedad D. medicamentos como vitaminas para el cerebro, tanto para niños como para adultos, y diferentes tipos D. medicamentos que son demandados por los clientes. Con esto espera poder mejorar sus ventas y por enD. sus ingresos para poder gozar D. una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María, 64, lives with her husband in her own house.  For a long time María has been a street vendor of various types of vitamins and medicines that she lovingly sells throughout various areas near her home.  Despite being a woman of advanced age, she is not defeated.  She is a woman that is full of energy, charisma and spirit.  Thanks to her dedication and kindness at work she’s managed to secure the trust of many people and for the moment has many customers that request her products.

This has led her to take make the decision of asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy a variety of medicines, like vitamins for the brain for children as well as for adults, and different kinds of medicines that customers demand.  She hopes to improve sales this way and as a result improve her income and to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy various medicines.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es de la comunidad Rural de Ostional, es  conocida por ser una mujer muy trabajadora.
Rosa ha estado teniendo problemas con su casa de habitación, ya que esta por empezar la sesión lluviosa,  y el techo esta en muy mal estado. Es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de Zinc y madera para arreglar el techo de su casa.
Ella está muy contenta, ya que en la comunidad existe la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo como este, ya que de otra manera seria muy difícil.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the rural community of Ostional and is known as a hard-working woman.  She is having problems with her house because of the rainy season and the roof is in a very bad state, so she is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC to buy zinc and wood to repair the roof.

She is very happy to be able to receive a loan like this in her community because it would be very difficult otherwise.

loans.use: To buy wood and zinc for her roof.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52, sells car spare parts and runs an auto service that is called “Auto Standard” with her two sons. They live together in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a divorcee and a hardworking woman who has been successfully running her business for the last two years. 

Now she is planning to expand her business by buying some car spare parts and accessories from abroad, especially China. Therefore, Oyunchimeg is requesting the loan to purchase some car spare parts from China.

“I want to grow up my business, and I want to give some properties to my sons when they marry. That is my wish in the near future. And I really appreciate the Kiva team and lenders! Thank you all,” she said.

loans.use: To purchase some car spare parts and accessories from China.

loans.name: María Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que cuenta con una hermosa estructura arquitectónica, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señora María tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 25, 22, 18 años de edad, sus dos hijos mayores trabajan y  le ayudan  económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, ha migrado para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia, la casa en la que habitan es de propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a cuidar de su criadero de cuyes en el cual lleva 14 años, en sus tiempos libres se dedican a la venta de productos Yanbal.

Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes.
 
Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Maria is 43 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived 3 children. They are 25, 22, ad 18 years old. Her two eldest children work and help her financially and her youngest son attends school in the city. Her husband is out of the country. He emigrated to provide his family with a better future. The house in which they live is their own property.

Maria dedicates her time to taking care of her guinea pig farm. It is an activity she has had for 14 years. In her spare time she sells Yanbal brand products.

Her has rejoined her communal bank and her loan will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs.

Her dream is to travel the world.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 21-year-old single lady who started at a young age making different types of mattresses and pillows, mostly the ones used for Arabian seating arrangements. 

Basically what Asmaa does is bring in different sizes of sponge that are used as stuffing material for the mattresses. She also sews covers for the mattresses. Despite her young age, Asmaa is well-known in her area in Al Mafraq.

Now Asmaa has applied for a loan to buy more sponge and other materials for the business.

loans.use: To buy more sponges and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elvira has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, charcoal per kilograms & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of charcoal & coconuts to sell.

Elvira is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo Salomon

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo es soltero y tiene 29 años. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de toda clase. Él se dedica a este trabajo hace ya mucho tiempo, pues lo aprendió de sus padres que se dedican a los mismo. Hace aproximadamente 4 años pudo adquirir su propia máquina de coser y así aumentar la producción de la familia como también independizarse un poco más y obtener mayor ganancia.
El se define como un joven muy trabajador, lleno de creatividad e invensión, tiene muchos planes que le gustaría cumplir en un futuro no muy lejano. Dentro de sus metas está tener un propio taller de costura donde pueda el mismo abrirse camino al mercado y tener aun un margen más amplio de ganancias.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, que es el insumo fundamental que utiliza en su taller de costura, además de eso quiere comprar agujas e hilos, también a ser utilizados dentro del taller.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodrigo is 29 years old and single. He produces all types of clothing. Rodrigo has been in this trade for a long time since he learned from his parents, who are in the same profession. Approximately four years ago, he acquired his own sewing machine so that he could help his family increase production. He also does some work on his own in order to earn more income.

Rodrigo defines himself as a hardworking young man who is full of creativity and invention. He has many plans that he would like to accomplish in the not-too-distant future. Among his goals are to have his own sewing workshop so that he can gain entrance into the marketplace and increase his profit margin.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fabrics, an essential supply used in his workshop. In addition, he wants to buy needles and thread since these items are also used in his work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Abakorahamwe Kyamalaya Group

texts.en: Charles is a member of the Abakorahamwe Kyamalaya group where each member guarantees one another in accessing a loan. He is 40 years old and lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of eight children. He dreams of educating his children up to University level. For six years he has been selling maize. He got the initial capital after selling Irish potatoes. His dream is to own a food store in town. Charles needs the loan to buy bags of maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for resale

loans.name: Jenny Ferth

texts.es: Doña Jenny Ferth, es maestra de educacion primaria, tiene 2 niñas menores de edad, se caractariza por ser una mujer profesional que le gusta salir adelante y lucha contra los desafios que se le presentan, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to credito para realizarle mejoras a su casa de habitación construyendo un dormitorio mas para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida, pues sus creditos han sido practicamente para ir construyendo poco a poco su casita por que se siente muy agradecida por el servicio brindado por la institución.
texts.en: Jenny is a primary education teacher. She has two young children. She is known to be a professional woman who likes to move forward and fight the challenges that present themselves. She is asking for her sixth loan in order to make improvements to her house, building a bedroom for the family to have better living conditions. The loans have been helpful in the construction, little by little, of her house, and she feels very grateful for the service provided by the communal bank.

loans.use: to build a bedroom

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a variety store in her village. She aimed to improve her business to supplement her husband's income and support their family's needs. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, they are trying their best to make the business profitable. 

She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, breads, noodles, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and makes it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, noodles, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and the father of four children.

Hussein has owned a shop since 2005, selling frozen meat. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot customers passing by him.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s walls and floors.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

Jovita has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr:
Jonas  est né au Rwanda et a 52 ans. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 4 à 20 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 

Jonas est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des chaussures destine à vendre. 

Jonas voudrait être un grand commerçant des chaussures de qualité dans  leurs marches locale. Avec le profit  Jonas voudrait  scolariser et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jonas was born in Rwanda and is 52 years old. He is married and has five children aged between 4 and 20. Four of his children attend school. Besides his children, he also take care of another person. He attended secondary school for 4 years. 

Jonas is a businessman. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy shoes that he can sell.

Jonas would like to be a successful merchant of quality shoes in local markets. Jonas will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for retail.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria, de 52 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive en su casa propia en donde le acompañan dos de sus hijos quienes aportan en la economía y siempre le tratan de dar lo mejor a ella quien a parte realiza su trabajo para no depender de ellos. El trabajo de Hilaria consiste en la venta de abarrotes, inicia todos los días sus actividades cuando apertura su establecimiento, lo limpia y ordena todos sus productos, tiene buenos clientes quienes van a su tienda por que es una de las más surtidas de su cuadra y sus clientes saben que ahí encontraran de todo, tiene cuatro años con su negocio y lo hace a lado de su hijo quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria para las actividades más duras que toca hacer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su propio tiempo a parte de tener que esperar de nadie para poder tener sus ingresos económicos, cuando empezó tenia muchas dudas, temor de que no le vaya bien, pero comprendió que todo dependía de sus esfuerzo y mucho trabajo y ahora todo le va bien y espera seguir creciendo. Ahora emprende un nuevo proyecto ya que desea empezar con la crianza de pollos. Este será el préstamo numero 12 son MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete nuevamente a ser una socia puntual como en los créditos anteriores en donde demostró porque es una de las socias más queridas y mas respetadas ya que gracias a su puntualidad obtuvo el respeto de todos. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará más mercadería para su bodega, ya que desea implementarse con arroz, azúcar, conservas y otros productos que desea tener en mayor cantidad y mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 52, is a good woman who is kind and hardworking. She is a widow and has four grown children who are independent. Hilaria lives in her own home with two of her children who help with the finances. She always stives to do her best in her job so that she does not have to depend on them. Hilaria sells groceries. Every day she starts her activities when she opens her store by cleaning and arranging all of her products. She has good customers who come to her establishment because her business is one of the best-stocked stores on the block. Her customers know that they can find everything. She has been in business for four years and her son helps with the more difficult activities required to stay in operation. What she likes about her job is being able to work on her own schedule and not have to rely on anyone in order to generate an income. When she started her business, Hilaria had many doubts that she would not do well, but she understands that all of her results depend on her efforts and a great amount of work. Now she is doing well and hopes to continue growing. Hilaria is now pursuing a new project because she wants to start raising chickens.

This will be her 12th loan with MFP. She waits to receive a small loan so that she can accomplish her goals. Hilaria renews her commitment to be a punctual member just like she had been with her previous loans. She is one of the most loved and respected members. Due to her promptness, she has earned the respect of everyone. The amount of 2500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more merchandise for her store. She wants to acquire rice, sugar, preserves, and other products so that she can have more inventory and greater variety.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, preserves, and other products.

loans.name: Mejia-Villatoro Group

texts.es:
Digna Emerita es miembro y coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Mejia-V., tiene 27 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y junto a su familia reside en el Barrio La Soledad en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Digna se dedica a la venta de abarrotería y aprendió de este negocio desde que estaba soltera, ya que su madre tenía una pulpería y ella le ayudaba a atenderla. Luego cuando se casó su esposo le dio dinero para que instalara una pulperia propia y desde hace 4 cuatros ella maneja su propio negocio. Su horario de atención inicia a las 6 am y culmina  las 9 pm y su hijo mayor le ayuda a atender a los clientes. Su mayor desventaja es que hay varias pulperías en el barrio pero siempre trata de atender muy bien a sus clientes para que estos regresen. 

Digna está solicitando este préstamo para la compra de abarrotería en general como ser: arroz, frijoles, aceite, manteca, condimentos, refrescos, carnes, lácteos, embutidos, pan, café, churros, verduras, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo Digna podrá surtir su pulpería de mas y variados productos y sus clientes encontraran lo que necesiten y eso le permitirá obtener mas ganancias.

Sus metas son convertir su pulperia en un supermercado y poder darle a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y ayudarlos a que se realicen profesionalmente y tambien sueña con construir su propia casa. Digna tiene 8 ciclos de trabajar con los préstamos de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Digna Emerita is a member and the coordinator of the "Mejía-V." communal bank. She is 27, married, and has four children. She and her family live in Barrio La Soledad, in the municipality of Juticalpa. Digna sells groceries. 

She learned this business when she was single, as her mother had a small general store, and she helped her run it. Later, when she got married, her husband gave her money to set up her own general store, and she has been running her own business for four years. Her store hours begin at 6:00am and end at 9:00pm.  Her eldest son helps her serve customers. 

Her greatest disadvantage is that there are several general stores in the neighborhood; but she always tries to serve her customers very well, so that they come back.

Digna is applying for this loan in order to buy groceries in general, such as rice, beans, cooking oil, lard, condiments, soft drinks, meat, dairy products, cold cuts, bread, coffee, churros (a treat made from fried dough), vegetables, and other items. 

With the help of this loan, Digna will be able to supply her general store with more and varied products. Her customers will find what they need, and that will allow her to earn more.  

Her goals are to turn her small general store into a mini-market, to be able to give her children a better standard of living and to help them to become professionals. She also dreams of building her own house. 

Digna has been working with Fama loans for eight loan cycles, and has paid her instalments on time.

loans.use: To buy groceries in general for sale.

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Laskmi; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende ceramicas,polos,gorras y chalinas,la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania,su sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesania como polos,chompas,gorras y ceramicas al por mayor. 
La socia es una persona muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Laskmi is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She continues with her business of selling handicrafts. She sells ceramics, polo shirts, caps, and scarves. Laskmi works as a traveling vendor from 8am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. Laskmi wants to expand and improve her business of selling handicrafts. She dreams of having a craft store. Laskmi is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts such as polo shirts, sweaters, caps, and ceramics in bulk. She is an enterprising person who has tremendous desire to succeed so that her family can get ahead.

Laskmi is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell in bulk such as polo shirts, sweaters, caps, and ceramics.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de plátanos y este la realiza de forma ambulante, esta actividad la aprendió de forma empírica, ya que por la necesidad que tenia de generar ingresos a su familia tuvo que emprenderla. A su cargo tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y que con muchos esfuerzos los ha sacado adelante y les ha enseñado a sus hijos el valor de luchar y de seguir adelante. Alejandro está solicitando financiamiento para el abono para la plantación de plátano y poder sacar la cosecha y salir a venderla.
texts.en: Alejandro is 39 years old and he sells bananas on foot.  He learned to do this on his own because he had to earn an income for his family.  He has four children to care for and they attend school.  He’s managed to get them ahead with lots of effort.  He’s shown them the value of selling, working hard, and continuing to move ahead.  Alejandro is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer for his banana plantation so that he can harvest and sell his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Vilma tiene 28 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Vilma se dedica a la crianza animales menores como cuyes y pollos, ella tiene una pequeña granja en su domicilio, ella también se dedica a la venta de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos. 

Vilma es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Vilma was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. Vilma is 28 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children. 

Vilma works raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has a small farmyard at her home. She also works selling jora [a traditional corn-based drink]. She has operated this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. Vilma needs the loan to buy chickens.

Vilma is a member of the "Pillao” communal bank. This group is made up of 13 members who live in the province of Cusco, in the San Jerónimo district.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 26 year old and a married woman. She has three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Monica is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La socia Zulma perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  
La socia Zulma continua dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo ropa, perfumes, aretes, collares entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia Zulma solicito el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Zulma is a partner in the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" from the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco. Zulma continues to work selling beauty products, such as clothes, perfumes, earrings, necklaces, among other things. She has worked for years in this business, and it does well thanks to the hard work she puts every day in her business. This way she supports her family. Zulma requested another loan to buy colognes, among other things. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy colognes, among other things.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with five children and four go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She is a poultry farmer and has been in this business for several years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feeds and vaccines.  She works from home on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to buy iron sheets to roof her rental houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds, and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Améyo Reine

texts.en:
Améyo Reine A. is a young woman of 34 and works as a merchant in the village of Agbanakin in Les Lacs prefecture. As a mother of three children, she also covers most of the family expenses; her husband is unemployed. Various grocery items compose the majority of goods she offers in the open-air display she has set up. It must be emphasized that the income derive from this business is directly used to cover daily expenses, making it difficult to save any money. In order to build a shed for protecting her display of goods, to increase customer orders, and to boost her sales, she is requesting a loan of $750.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune femme de 34 ans, Madame A. Améyo Reine est commerçante dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle supporte la plus grande partie des charges de sa famille ; son mari étant sans emploi. Les produits d’alimentation générale et divers sont les principaux constituants de son étalage dressé à ciel ouvert. Il faut souligner que le revenu tiré de ce commerce est directement investi dans la consommation quotidienne, ce qui rend difficile l’épargne. Afin de construire un hangar pour abriter son étalage et augmenter ses commandes afin accroître son chiffre d’affaire, elle sollicite une somme de $750.

loans.use: To build a shed to protect her display of goods for sale and to boost customer orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory and grow the business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer started her business 5 years ago with the little capital she obtained from her previous job. Every day she attends to each customer personally, working from 6am-10pm. Her management experience and the quality of products she offers to her customers helps her maintain her business. She sells supplies, pharmaceutical products, and faux jewelry.

Jennifer asks for a loan to invest in the aquisition of new and various products and to finish renovating her shop so that she can better display the products and, thus, improve her services and public attention.

Jennifer is 30 years old and single. Since a young age she worked various jobs and obtained a lot of experience. She had to close her first business, an eatery, because it was a rental establishment. This motivated her, along with her parents, to start a supply store, selling medicines and jewelry, too. The business occupies part of the house, which is under construction. Her goal is to improve her business and profits to continue the construction of her house and to be an example for her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Jennifer inicio su negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener en base a las ventas de su anterior trabajo. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm. Su negocio se mantiene gracias a la experiencia obtenida en el manejo y calidad de productos que Jennifer ofrece a sus clientes. Ella vende viveres, productos farmacéuticos y bisuteria.

Jennifer necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos y variados productos así como también terminar de adecuar su local para poder exhibir de mejor manera los productos que ofrece a su clientela mejorando de esta manera el servicio y atención al publico.

Jennifer tiene 30 años es soltera no tiene hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar siendo empleada en distintos lugares donde adquirió experiencia. Siendo su primer negocio un comedor el cual tuvo que cerrar por que el local era de alquiler. Razón que la motivo para que junto a sus padres decidiera iniciar su propio negocio de venta de víveres, medicinas y bisutería. Ocupando parte de su casa. Su vivienda esta en construcción. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir ayudando en su hogar y ser ejemplo para sus hermanos.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Vahobjon

texts.ru:
Vahobjon is a very modern energetic man. He is 38, married, and has 4 underage children. The entire family is engaged in Vahobjon’s business. Vahobjon has a retail spot on Isfarinskiy bus terminal, where he and his wife, with the help of their children, sell small goods including fried sunflower seeds, chewing gum, cigarettes, etc. In addition, Vahobjon rented the bus terminal’s public bathroom, which he now maintains, and earns an income by charging an entrance fee. Vahobjon personally travels to the regional center to purchase his goods. He received the first MicroInvest loan a year ago. Having received a few loans, Vahobjon significantly expanded his business. His next loan, Vahobjon plans to use to purchase sunflower seeds, as the season of low prices is approaching.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобчон очень современный и энергичный мужчина. Ему 38 лет, он женат и у него 4 несовершенолетних детей. Вся его семья занимается бизнесом и всем этим он управляет. На Исфаринском автовокзале у него есть торговое место, где он и его жена торгуют мелкими товарами – жаренными семечками подсолнуха, жевательной резинкой, сигаретами и т.п. здесь им помогают их дети. Также Вахобчон взял в аренде общественный туалет при автовокзале, где он следит за порядком и получает от этого доход в виде оплаты за вход. Вахобчон также сам ездит за товаром в областной центр. Кредитоваться в Микроинвест он стал год назад. Получив несколько займов он значительно расширил свой бизнес. Очередной займ Вахобчон хочет получить на закуп семечек подсолнуха, так как скоро наступает сезон снижения цен на них.

loans.use: To purchase sunflower seeds

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Mrs. Chao P., age 38, works with her husband selling vegetable at a busy market, earning around $9 each day in revenue. They have three children: two who are students and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand at the market so they do not have to spend a great portion of their income each month to rent a stall. This will increase their income and help them finance their children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stall in the market to sell vegetables so they no longer have to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business that is a bazaar

loans.name: Dira B Group

texts.en:
Edward, age 38, is married with 4 children (ages 15, 12, 10, and 8). He owns a cafeteria business which he began 2 years ago. His business is open from 5am to 11pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $164.

Edward hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on his business. He will be sharing this loan with sub group members, who have businesses dealing in a retail shop, selling food stuffs, and a kiosk.

In the picture, Edward is in the centre.

loans.use: To increase on business

loans.name: Dilbarjon

texts.en:
B. Dilbarjon is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. 

For the past 15 years, Dilbarjon has been selling bread in the local market. She mainly sells white and brown bread as well as rye rolls. The business is rather stable and allows Dilbarjon to improve the living conditions of her family.

Currently, Dilbarjon is asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 6 months in order to be able to purchase flour and bread for sale. Dilbarjom has borrowed from IMON in the past and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchase of  flour and bread for sale

loans.name: Kisenyi A(2051) (I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty Afukoit. She has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add to her stock. Betty is 30 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from ages 5 to 15, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

 Betty is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Justine N., Regina S., and Betty N.. Harriet N. sells used clothing and wants to increase her inventory. Justine N. operates a restaurant and wants a loan to purchase more foods and dishes. Regina S. operates a retail shop and wants to purchase a refridgerator. Betty N. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shop commodities

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 54 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa Valley. He has six children and makes a living selling food to his neighbors. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the proceeds to buy more of the provisions he needs to run his business.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Nelida's Group

texts.es:
Yessy, Fabiana and Nelida have been members of the communal bank called Chacco for 2 years. They are from the community of Chacco which is located about 30 minutes outside of Ayacucho.

Yessy is 33 years old and married with one child. For two years she has had a small shop where she sells drinks. Fabiana is 38 years old and also married, with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells grocery items. She also grows vegetables which she sells in the market of Nery Garcia. And Nelida is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She works as a nurse but right now she is pregnant and not working. She also grows vegetables.

These women will use the loan to purchase stock for their businesses, such as sodas, beer, noodles, cooking oil, soap, seeds and fertilizers. They all share the dream of being successful professionals, improving their houses and growing their businesses.

Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Chacco hace 2 años. Ellas son de la comunidad de Chacco que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yessy es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Yessy es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Yessy tiene una tienda donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Por otro lado Fabiana es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Fabiana tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además Fabiana se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que vende en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Nelida es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nelida es enfermera pero actualmente no esta trabajando por su embarazo. Nelida se dedica a la agricultura de verduras.

Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 1500 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosa, cerveza, fideo, aceite, jabón, semilla y abono.

Los sueños de Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su casa y su negocio sea más grande.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STOCK FOR THEIR RESPECTIVE BUSINESSES SUCH AS SODAS, BEER, NOODLES, OIL, SOAP, SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is 52 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is one vegetable seller out of many in the province and earns about 2 US$ per day. Her husband drives a horse drawn cart which is used to transport everything from fruit to people from place to place. He earns 2.50 US$ per day. They have two children but are too poor to be able to send both the kids to school consistently. Right now, the children help the parents in their work each day. Neang S. wants to apply her loan towards a new horse for her husband's business. Her husband is pictured here at the CREDIT office as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy a horse.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Mrs. Claudia C. is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Alejandro Silva who is 51 years old, they have 7 children studying in high school. Mrs. Claudia has worked as a maid for many years, her husband is a storekeeper and with their savings they have been able to purchase a house and put a pantry in it. They live 10 kilometers from the center of the city in a house; she has already formed customers that are mostly her neighbors. She would like in the future to open a small supermarket because there isn't one in her neighborhood and it is a necessity for the locals. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, milk, bread, sugar, sodas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudia C. posee 39 años esta casada con el señor Alejandro Silva de 51 años, poseen 7 hijos cursando actualmente la secundaria.

La señora trabajaba como empleada durante varios años, su marido es comerciante y con los ahorros de ambos lograron comprar para su casa y poner para su despensa. Vive a unos 10 km. del centro de la ciudad en una villa, posee una clientela ya formada que en la mayoría son sus vecinos.

Le gustaría en el futuro abrir un pequeño supermercado ya que en la zona en donde vive no cuentan y es una necesidad para los habitantes del lugar.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, pan, azúcar, gaseosas etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, oil, eggs, cheese, bread, and sodas, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 28 years old. She has two children, ages 10 and 14. In 2005, she began her own clothing and perfume sales shop. In one month, Halima earns a profit of around $65 from her sales.

Halima would now like to request a loan to increase her inventory of clothes, and expand her business range and clientele.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel has his own home (on Antofagasta Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz). He is a widower and receives a retirement pension on which he supports himself, covering only the most basic necessities. The loan he seeks is for refurbishing one room in his house, which he uses as his bedroom.

His previous history is favorable, and we qualify him as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ezequiel tiene casa propia (calle Antofagasta de la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz), es viudo y percibe una renta de jubilado con al cual se mantiene y puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. E El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de una habitación, la cual es su dormitorio. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y lo calificamos como un buen cliente.

loans.use: Making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and two adorable children in the small village of Saatli region. He sells women's clothing in the local bazaar. He started his business in 1996. He is not alone in his business; his wife actively helps him to sell clothes. 

Selling clothes is the only one financial source in his family. Azer goes to capital of Azerbaijan, Baku, to purchase new clothes every week. He has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase women clothes for winter season. 

Let's wish Azer good luck in new season!

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for winter season

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven tuvieron que ver con la venta de ropa, es por eso que Deysi es una excelente vendedora de estas sus prendas, tanto para adultos, como para niños, las cuales también, a veces, las deja al crédito. Tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, los cuales están estudiando, y a quienes quiere brindarles, por el momento, sus estudios, hasta que se decidan por una profesión ser. Su esposo pareja Máximo, trabaja independientemente, y está de acuerdo con todo lo que ella decide respecto a su negocio.  La meta trazada de Deysi, es crecer e implementar su negocio, complementarlo con algunos otros accesorios, pero para ello necesita de un capital  para lograr su objetivo. Apoyemos a la señora Deysi, madre talentosa, que se esfuerza arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Her aspirations since she was very young had to do with clothing sales. It's for that reason that Deysi is an excellent salesperson of these clothing items, both for adults and children. Sometimes she sells on credit. She is 37 years old and has two children, both of whom are studying. For the moment she is focused on their studies until they decide on a profession. Her husband Máximo works independently and is in agreement with everything she does with respect to her business. Deysi's goal is to grow her business complementing it with some other accessories but in order to do that she needs business capital to reach her objective. Let's support Deysi, a talented mother, so that her hard work will allow her to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Кодирова Гулрухсор. 21 год. Не замужем. Живет с родителями в городе Нурек. Два года занимается бизнесом. Торгует фруктами на центральном рынке. Скупает товар у дехкан и продает по розничной цене. У нее много клиентов , но для развития бизнеса хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, путем получения кредита. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и прибыльность бизнеса . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor Q. is 21 years old. She is not married, and lives with her parents in the city of Nurek. She has been in business for two years. She sells fruits in the central market. She buys from small farmers and sells at retail prices. She has lots of customers, but would like to use a loan to further develop the business by expanding the variety of goods she offers. This will help to increase the business's sales and profit. She will repay the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is Samuel Abdul M., age 36.  He was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is married to a businesswoman and the two have four children. Three of his children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Abdul runs a video center (a cinema with several 19” televisions) where he shows movies and European soccer matches.   People of all ages come to watch Premier League, FA Cup, Carling Cup and European Championship Cup matches.  Once in a while, he’ll also televise the German, Spanish and Italian league games.  He has never received a loan from SMT before, but is now applying for one to help him strengthen his business.

With this loan, Abdul will make a great improvement to his operation. Currently, he is using two satellite dishes, but this is not enough. These dishes cannot show all of the above-mentioned matches. Abdul will therefore add some of his own savings to the money from the loan to buy a new satellite dish that can show all of the above-mentioned matches. He will travel to Freetown, about 240 miles round trip, to buy it. 

Not having the third dish has been Abdul’s greatest challenge in his business. Many customers deserted him because of his inability to show all of the matches. But with this loan, and the dish that he’ll be able to buy, he is optimistic that he will be able to regain all of his lost customers and even find some new ones. Many of the youths in town prefer his video center to others because of its convenient location in the center of town. In addition to having a good location, he is young and many youth like patronizing with him because of their similarities. Also, as chairman of the Motorbike Rider’s Association, he is very popular among the many motorbike riders.

When business improves for Abdul, he will be able to take good care of his family, pay school fees, and provide them with more food and clothing.

loans.use: buying a third satellite dish for his video center

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: A. Béatrice est née le 18 janvier 1970 et elle s’est mariée avec BOUSSOUDAHO Hubert. Elle a arrete ses études au secondaire. Elle a 6 enfants âgés de 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, et 3. Il y a 6 ans elle a commencé son activité de vente de vivres et le charbon. Il y a 3 mois elle a commencé la poissonnerie. Dans le futur, elle voudrait developper sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Ms. Béatrice A. was born on January 18, 1970 and is married to Mr. Hubert BOUSSOUDAHO. She ended her studies in middle school. She has six children, ages 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3. Six years ago, she began working, selling staple goods and charcoal. Three months ago, she started selling fish. In the future, she would like to develop her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor Y. is 33 years old. He works with livestock. He buys and sells cattle from different marketplaces and has been in the business for the last 10 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a second loan after successfully repaying the first one.

With the previous loans, Bakhtiyor has been able to increase the number of cattle that he trades. He is married and a father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and unlike himself, be able to get good jobs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
