Sueana needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase an additional fishing net to replace the old one and fishing equipments. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Sueana  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sueana 's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net to replace the old one and fishing equipment

loans.name: Mishnel Hervins

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 26 ans , marié père d’un enfant.N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses études universitaires , il se lance dans le commerce des CD, cassettes et DVD, ses 
ventes sont considérables , il vend en moyenne 10 000 à 40 000 F Cfa par jour.
A l’octroie de ce crédit , il va renforcer son commerce en achetant :des lots de CD , des dvd, des cassettes et un graveur des CD
Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, il pense épargner et à la longue élargir son activité en ouvrant une discotheque, Comme un bon père de famille , il pense financer les études de ses enfants et construire une maison  dans sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Mishnel Hervins is 26 years old, married and has one child. As he did not have the funds he needed to be able to continue with his university education, he started a business selling CDs, cassettes, and DVDs. His sales are high and he earns between 10 000 and 40 000 francs a day.
Mishnel Hervins will use this loan to reinforce his business activities by restocking on CDs, DVDs and cassettes, and buying a CD-writer. As a good father, he wants to be able to cover his children´s educational expenses, and build a house on his plot of land. He also plans to save some of the profits from his business so that he can eventually open a club.

loans.use: to buy cassettes, CDs, DVDs and a CD-writer.

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
La señora Bilma tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Cerro de Marcovia, ahi vive con sus 2 hijos.
Bilma se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, su negocio tiene 4 años de haberlo iniciado, sus clientes son sus vecinos de la aldea en donde vive. Bilma trabaja muy fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Bilma is 31 years old and lives in the small village of El Cerro de Marcovia with her two children.

Bilma sells basic household products.  She has a grocery store in her home which she set up four years ago.  Her customers are neighbors from the village in which she lives.  Bilma works very hard so that she can get her children ahead and enjoy a better quality of life.

Bilma will use this loan to buy groceries with which to stock her business in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy soap, butter, oil, beans, sugar, rice, bread, coffee, milk, cheese, cereal and oats

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old, a married woman with four children, all four of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her son’s business of painting sign boards. With the loan, he will buy paint and brushes to make better quality sign boards for his customers and increase his profits. 

Zarina is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a driver and provides transport services to his customers. Her two daughters are teachers by profession while her third daughter stays at home and her youngest son reads in 10th standard. 

Zarina supports her family by doing clothes sewing work. She is very skilled and receives regular orders every month. 

Her son has been operating his business for the past four years and Zarina is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and increase his profits.  

Zarina wants to marry her elder daughter who is 26 years old. She is hopeful that she will be able to save some money from the loan profits for this purpose. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zarina”.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes for a sign boards painting business

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 55 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Fredrick has been working hard to manage his small stall, where he sells spare mechanical parts for motorbikes and cars. 

To help expand his business, Fredrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale, and will help Fredrick to generate greater profits and to pay his children's school fees on time. Fredrick hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business until he has the biggest spare parts stall in Luwero. 

Fredrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fredrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Mayde

texts.es: La señora Mayde se dedica a la agricultura y además ayuda a sus padres con la producción de leche. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de mediana calidad para  así incursionar en el rubro lechero para mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en casa en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Palomar del departamento de  La Paz; es casada no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de una institución financiera y al explicarle las ventajas de fondeo a través de Kiva, ella decidió usar esta vía para financiar su crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Mayde works in agriculture, and also helps out her parents with milk production.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of a pair of dairy cows of decent quality so that she can venture into the dairy sector herself to improve her income.

She lives in her parents' home, which is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the department of La Paz.  She is married and does not have children.

This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from a financial institution, and once she heard about the advantages of being funded through Kiva, she decided to use this path for financing her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of dairy cows so she can venture into the field of milk production and sales.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemi, de 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy emprendedora. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 18, 15, 6 y 3 años, ellos estudian y ayudan en las cosas del hogar. Tiene una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su conviviente y sus cuatro hijos quienes son el motivo de esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que ella trabaja mucho para poder brindarles lo mejor. EL trabajo de Noemi consiste en la venta de abarrotes y otros productos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en donde desde muy temprano abre en espera de sus clientes quienes van muy seguido pues tienen la seguridad que siempre encontraran lo que buscan, trabaja sola y lo hace en este negocio ya por cuatro años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da el tiempo para poder realizar algunas cosas más, como preparar sus refrescos para venderlos, hacer helados y todo tipo de negocio que ella cree que pueda sacar alguna ganancia. Cuando empezó no tenia ni idea de cómo era este negocio y se lanzo sin saber nada, espera poder ampliar su negocio, pues ella sabe muy bien que mientras más grande sea, mejor ganancia tendrá. Este será el préstamo número 5 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. De igual manera de los préstamos recibidos anteriormente se compromete a ser un cliente puntual y muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería para vender en su tienda, entre ellos, gaseosas, conservas, lácteos, bebidas y mas.
texts.en: Noemi is 34 years old. She is a good, friendly and enterprising woman. She lives with her spouse, with whom she has four children, aged 18, 15, 6 and 3. They go to school and help with the housework. She owns her own house where she shares her days with her spouse and their four children who are they reason for her hard work and sacrifice, since she works a lot to be able to offer them the best. Noemi's work consists of selling groceries and other products. She has a small store which she opens very early to await customers who go there frequently because they know she will find what they are looking for. She works alone and she has been in this business for four years. What she likes about this work is that it gives her time to do some other things, such as make beverages to sell, and make ice cream and any other thing she thinks that she can make some profit with. When she started, she had no idea what kind of business this was and she opened it knowing nothing. She hopes to be able to expand her business, because she knows that the bigger it is, the more profit she will have. This will be loan number 5 with MFP, and she hopes for your cooperation to continue with her goals. As with the loans she received previously, she is committed to being a punctual and responsible client. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy more merchandise to sell in her store, among them soft drinks, preserves, dairy products, beverages and more.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, preserves, dairy products and beverages.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, un joven trabajador de 22 años; vive en una casa alquilada que junto a su pareja Devora de 18 años, anhelan tener un buen futuro. Máximo, es un joven que se dedica al trabajo de construcción; empezó a trabajar hace 05 meses; y cada mañana se levanta para poder trabajar. Ya que con el dinero que gana ahorra para poder construir su propia casa. En el trabajo le va muy bien, y disfruta cada vez que conversa con sus compañeros de trabajo, sin embargo termina muy agotada por esta actividad muy dura. Con el crédito solicitado podrá  avanzar con la construcción de su propia casa ya que es su mayor anhelo. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP y esta contento con el apoyo financiero que le brindaron ya que así puede cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal agradece a las personas que le dieron esta oportunidad. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles podrá comprar materiales de construcción para la construcción de su casa, como: fierros, alambres, cemento.
texts.en:
Máximo, a young 22-year-old worker, lives in a rented house with his 18-year-old partner, Devora. They both long for a better future. Máximo works in construction and began this job 5 months ago. Each morning he gets up ready to work. He is saving the money he earns in order to be able to build his own house. His work is going very well and he enjoys talking to his fellow workers. Nevertheless, he ends the day exhausted from the very difficult tasks he performs.

Máximo will use the loan he has requested to move ahead in building his own house since this is his greatest wish. This will be his first loan with MFP and he is pleased with the financial support they have given him so that he can fulfill his goal. He is grateful to the people in his communal bank who have given him this opportunity. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will be able to buy construction materials to build his house, such as rebar, wire and cement.

loans.use: to buy rebar, wire and cement.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, administra una tienda, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, el menor de sus hijos estudia en la universidad, tiene 19 años de edad, Reina se dedica a atender clientes en su tienda, donde les ofrece productos de calidad para el uso domestico.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, jugos, gaseosas, frijoles, arroz, detergentes y jabón, la compra le ayudara para aumentar el inventario y mejorar así la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Reina es tener una mejor calidad de vida, darles lo mejor a la familia y ser buen cliente pagando puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Reina manages a store and lives with her husband and two children. Her youngest child, age 19, is studying at the university. Reina attends to the customers in her store where she offers quality products for home use.

She is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise such as juices, sodas, beans, rice, detergents, and soap. This purchase will help increase her inventory and improve service to her customers. Reina aspires to have a better quality of life, provide the best for her family, and be a good client when submitting her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, beans, rice, detergents, and soap.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married to an electrician and has two children. She used to work as a food vendor, but now she sells cosmetics. Her income helps her husband to pay the school fees for their children. 

Maame is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a shop for her business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a water vendor in Mombasa. He is single and started the business with help from the family's savings. 

After being introduced to Milango by his friends, he is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a tank. Salim will use the extra income to invest in his future.

loans.use: To purchase a tank.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a 42-year-old mother of five and the wife of Mwaura, has been farming for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 10,500. She is applying for her first loan with KADET for Kes 30,000 to purchase seeds and pesticides for her farm. She hopes to diversify into dairy farming with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 26 years old and lives with his mother and sister in Nakuru town. He is a high school graduate and is currently enrolled for a computer application course at a local college. He attends classes in the evening. Her mother is employed as a secretary in a local school while his sister is in primary school.
Gilbert was very close to his late grandmother who used to sell fruits and vegetables at the local market. When she passed on, Gilbert requested the family to allow him to continue the business at the market. He has been operating the business for 12 months now and has managed to double the sales. He is using the income from the business to supplement his mother’s earnings in providing for the family.
Because of his entrepreneurship drive Eb-F has assisted him win a tender to supply fruits and vegetables to a Tourist Hotel based in Nakuru.
Gilbert requests a loan of US $ 300 to purchase 25 bags of assorted fruits and vegetables. He will use the income to pay for his college fee and to help his mother buy a piece of land to build a family home.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary started her business in 1990 with $150. She is a widow and has four children going to school. The business has enabled her to take care of the family as a single mother.

With the loan, Rosemary wants to expand her business and diversify so that she can attract a variety of clients with a variety of needs. This will enable her to open additional channels of income to complement the clothing business.

She will use the profits from her business to educate her children, pay medical expenses in times of sickness, and save for buying a plot.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her business

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown children. She sells clothing items in one of the busiest markets in Ivano-Frankivsk. She owns three vending facilities and has three hired employees who work for her. The inventory she sells is of very high quality. Even though her prices are a little higher than average, Mariya has gained many loyal customers who keep coming back to buy clothes from her.

Mariya has been in business for 10 years. The twenty-four loans she has received and promptly repaid with Nadiya Ukraine have promoted consistent increase in her sales and profits. Currently, she has around $8,000 of working capital. Her net profit is about $2,000 every month.

Mariya has requested a loan for $1,200 to help open her fourth vending kiosk and expand her trade as a result. Her daughter just had her first baby and Mariya is enjoying her responsibilities as a grandma. She is hoping that this loan will have a positive impact on her business profitability and help her further improve the economic and social situation of her family.

Марія – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Вона торгує одягом на одному з найбільших ринків Івано-Франківську. В неї три торгових приміщення, працює три реалізатори. Товар, яким торгує Марія, високої якості. Проте, хоча ціни трохи вище середніх, в неї багато постійних покупців, які приходять купляти одяг саме в неї. Марія займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Двадцять чотири позики, які вона отримала від „Надії України” та вчасно сплатила, сприяли поступовому збільшенню обсягів продажу та прибутків. Зараз в Марії приблизно 8000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її чистий прибуток складає 2000 доларів щомісяця. Марія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб відкрити четвертий торговий кіоск та розширити торгівлю. Її дочка тільки нещодавно народила дитину, а, отже, в бабусі Марії з’явилося багато нових зобов’язань. Вона сподівається, що позика позитивно відіб’ється на прибутковості її бізнесу, а також покращить економічне та соціальне становище її родини.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: Mrs. Uy K. is 38 years old, a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a small booth at home selling groceries to the people in her neighbourhood and makes an average five dollars a day. Her husband works at the local airport and earns about four dollars a day in revenue. Uy K. needs the loan to purchase more inventory to expand her business and more fully meet her clients’ needs.  She will use the leftover from the loan to fix her house which leaks during the rainy season. She and her family greatly appreciate your support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her business.  Also, to repair her home.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. A. 48 years old and married with five children. She lives in Egor quarters in Benin City. She sells provisions and foodstuffs; she wishes to buy more provision and foodstuffs for sale with the loan of $325. She has been in this business since 1989 and has been with LAPO for 9 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Gulchar

texts.en: G. Gulchar is a 42-year-old married has two children. She is a farmer from Gubadli region and right now lives with her family in Sumgayit, situated in the East of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1997, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. In 2005 Gulchar borrowed $500 to add to her own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled and Gulchar applied for a loan of $600 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production and expanded her business. She now earns considerably more income. Gulchar would now like to receive $800 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 16 months. She eventually hopes to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for meat production and business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of the business and expand inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 27 year-old Marim S.. She is married with one 4 year old child. In 2000 Marim established a livestock business. Marim has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional cows and chickens. She thanks you for your support. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow. About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and chickens.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en: Ms. Vafa, 28 years old, is a vulnerable, low income woman. She is married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Vafa has a scanty herd of milk cows and sells 30 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and to the super market. The trade is good and Vafa can see potential to sell more milk. In order to do this, as well as increase her monthly turnover, she will require more cattle in her herd. She has applied for a $700 loan from Normicro Saatli branch for the purpose of buying a cow and increasing the number of cattle in her herd.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ilinka

texts.en: Ilinka is 52 years old and she is widow. Her monthly income is 500KM, and she works as a saleswomen. She resells used textiles, and with this loan in the amount of 1200KM ($925) she intends to buy more textiles for selling. She has 2 children and they are adults. Ilinka wants to improve her monthly income on behalf of her children.

loans.use: Buy more textiles (clothing).

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is married with children who are grown. She is from the city of Uzhgorod, where she has a small business selling meats at one of the local markets. She has been in this trade for 6 years and has many loyal customers. Nina gets a lot of help from her husband, son and daughter who all work at different vending locations in the same market.

Nina would love to earn more and continue growing her venture so she can help her children buy their own apartments. Moreover, she would also like to see her dream come true of repairing her own apartment and redesigning its interior to the way she has pictured in her mind. That is why Nina is requesting this loan. She’d like to purchase specialized equipment for her meat kiosk to help her increase her profits and reach her goals. We believe Nina’s ability to make quick and effective decisions will help her business to remain successful and prosperous in the future.

loans.use: Purchase specialized equipment

loans.name: Sopharith

texts.en:
Mr. Sopharith S. lives in Angk Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is 28 years old and is married to Mrs. Sokheourn Tith, who works in a garment factory. They do not have any children and they live with their parents.

Mr. Sopharith S. is a farmer and pig breeder in the village. He usually hires a worker to cultivate his rice plantation. Last year, he got a loan from Brasac Co., Ltd. to pay for hiring a worker, but insects destroyed his rice. Now that the rainy season is arriving, and Mr. Sopharith S. starts to cultivate rice, he needs to hire workers to work on the field. Therefore, he has asked for a loan to pay for the workers. He will also use the loan to buy more insecticides to help increase rice productivity.

loans.use: To pay for the workers and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch M. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She lives at home with her elderly mother and father who help her care for her three children. She is a rice farmer working fields behind her home. Her earnings are meager at 1 US$ per day. Her husband is a tradesman specializing in carpentry. He earns 3 US$ per day making chairs, tables, and other such wooden items. Touch M. wants to help her husband expand his carpentry business by buying him better tools and a large stock of wood from which he can work on orders.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools and wood.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Born in 1943, N. Lucia, a widow, was married to the late John Fru with three children remaining, after losing four others. She says being a widow is difficult since she has more burdens on her. Since the death of her supportive husband, she has had to start doing some of the things her husband did, which she used to take for granted. The death of her four children has also left her wishing to fight to give a better life to those remaining. In the face of these challenges, N. Lucia joined GHAPE.

Given a loan, she plans to expand her business buying and splitting firewood and farming cassava. She promises to use the profit to educate her children and see them have income-generating activity in the future. Her community stands to benefit from her activities, as she will provide them with crops and firewood. She plans to repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, seeds for farming

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widowed, 42-year-old mother of two children. Leonora sells various clothing, specializing in typical clothing of the region. She acquires her products from the regional fairs of Ayacucho and sells her products in the city of Concepción, seven hours away from Ayacucho. She also purchases cereals, small animals, etc. from Concepción and resells them to middlemen in Ayacucho. During her absence, her older son is in charge of her younger son. Furthermore, she has land in the city of Pampas where she cultivates reeds and avocados that she sells to middlemen.

Leonora is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in jumpers, blankets, blouses, and pants.

Leonora's dream is to produce more on her land and to educate her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in jumpers, blankets, blouses and pants

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who is a fighter and who, from a very young age, has had to work to support her children and husband so that they are not lacking in basic needs. Her husband works in an enterprise selling soft drinks. Julia is 54 years old, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She has two children, ages 12 and 20. Julia’s business is comprised of selling video games and other products such as wood and perishables. It has been two years since she started the business, and things are going well for her, despite the fact that she has some competition from her neighbor. The money she is soliciting is to invest into working capital to buy video games, so she can have a satisfied customer base given the variety and availability of her products. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her work area, diversify her product base and capture more clients. She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es una mujer luchadora, desde muy joven le ha tocado trabajar para apoyar a sus hijos y a su esposo para que no le falte nada a su familia, su esposo trabaja en ventas en una empresa de gaseosas. Julia tiene 54 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, sus hijos son dos, uno de 12 y otro de 20 años de edad. El negocio de Julia es videos juegos y vende otros productos como leña, productos perecederos. Son dos años de estar en este negocio y le va bien, ha encontrado algunos inconvenientes con su vecina ya que tiene la competencia. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de videos juegos, y así mantener a sus clientes satisfechos con la variedad. A futuro es ampliar el local, diversificar los productos y captar mas clientes; y también su sueño es ver convertido a sus hijos en profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of video games.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 22. She has sold clothing since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elith

texts.es: Elith, de 47 años, es madre de tres hijos que están fuera del hogar y son independientes, gracias a la educación  y las buenas costumbres que ella las impartió. Vive con su esposo Jaime, que se dedica a trabajar como vendedor ambulante, y la apoya mucho.  Elith se dedica a la venta de diversos productos plásticos y para el hogar (baldes, mata moscas, escobas, etc) y también vende abarrotes, todo esto para contribuir con los gastos familiares, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia  de sus clientes, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que necesariamente requiere de una cantidad de dinero para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo, Elith logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Elith is 47 years old and she is the mother of three children, they have all moved out and are independent, all thanks to the education and to the good upbringing she gave them. She lives with her husband Jaime. His occupation is selling door to doo and he supports her a great deal. Elith works at selling various plastic products and items for the home (buckets, fly swatters, brooms, etc.) and she also runs a convenience store. She does all of this to contribute towards the family expenses. Thanks to her charisma and to returning clients, she sees the need to expand her business. Necessarily she requires a sum of money to achieve her goals. With your support Elith will be able to get what she needs in no time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and improve her business, and to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells rice, garri (cassava flour), and other staples. She also sells frozen foods, such as chicken and turkey. She travels to Contonou to purchase the frozen foods she resells in Lagos. Esther is asking for a loan of 140,000 naira ($1200) to purchase more rice and garri for resale.

Esther is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her eldest child is 27 years old, and her youngest is 13 years old.

Esther is a LAPO client. She expressed her profound gratitude to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase garri and rice for resale

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
“I am very proud of how the members of my family do their part towards the achievement of one goal, which is to uplift the life of our family,” Leonor said.

Leonor L., 43, is married to Jaime and gifted with three children: Mark James – 24 years old, college undergraduate; Karen – 19 years old, currently in second year college and Kenneth Christian – 13 years old, a high school sophomore. The family is living in Sitio Guingab which is considered a poor and small village.

She has been engaged in the soap-vending business since the first quarter of 2008 and is requesting a loan to further invest in it. Leonor’s simple hope is to sustain her enterprise in order to assist her husband in supporting the needs of their family and providing their children with the best education that they can achieve so that they will enjoy successful lives in the future.

loans.use: To invest in her soap business.

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca C. S. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada Doña Francisca tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes el mayor de sus hijos tiene la edad de 22 años no trabaja su otro hijo de 20 años cursa el 4 año de su carrera en una universidad publica y su hijo menor de 17 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos para con su negocio son que siempre se mantenga activo para que la afluencia de sus clientes no decaiga ya que ellos son la clave para que su negocio se mantenga sus deseos son de que sus hijos puedan administrar perfectamente este negocio para que el día de mañana tengan  un poco de ingresos para subsistir sus sueños son de tener otro negocio que contenga una diversidad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y además tener suficiente vida para lograr ver esto en un futuro.

La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es una sala de videos juegos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su c asa de habitación con la siguiente dirección costado norte de la iglesia de Guadalupe 75 varas al oeste, el tiempo que tiene Doña Francisca de poseer su negocio es de 2 años, sus inicios en este negocio surgen de la manera siguiente el negocio se origina por la necesidad de hacer frente a la situación económica y al encarecimiento de la canasta básica la idea surgió por los hijos de Doña Francisca ya que ellos tenían palystations, Mario cars y otros  por lo que los diferentes vecinos que en su mayoría son niños por lo que su Mama decide realizar la compra de mas equipos para establecer su negocio en su casa de habitación y es así como al paso del tiempo ella consigue la fama de sus clientes, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para mejorar la calidad de de los servicios y de los equipos para ofertar a los clientes lo mejor en calidad de sus juegos ya que la compra de estos son muy caros y tiene que viajar hasta Managua.
texts.en:
Francisca C. S. is 51 years old. She is married and she has 3 children whose ages are the following: her oldest child is 22 years old and isn't working; her other son is 20 years old and is in the 4th year of study at a public university; her youngest son is 17 years old and is in his 4th year of high school. Her life partner works for himself. Her goal for her business is to always stay active so that the number of customers won’t drop off, since they are crucial to her business. Her hope is that her children will be able to run this business so that in the future they will have some income. Her dreams are to have another business with a variety of products to offer to her customers, and also to live long enough to see this happen. Francisca has a video game business. It is located in her house, at the following address: to the north of the Guadalupe church, 75 varas [unit of distance measurment] to the west. Francisca has had this business for 2 years. This is how she became involved in it--it came about because of the need to deal with the economic situation and because of her dwindling ability to buy basic food items. It was Francisca’s children who thought of the idea. They have Playstations, Mario cars, and other video games. Most of their neighbors have children, so Francisca decided to to buy more video game equipment to start her business in her house. As time has gone by, she has become more well-known. The loan is for working capital to improve the servcies she offers and also to improve the equipment she has so that she can offer the best quality in games. These are expensive and she has to travel to Managua to purchase them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mirdjon

texts.ru: Мусоев Мирджон житьель Бохтара. Возраст 30 лет.Имеет троих детей. Кроме его семьи , с ним живут его родители. Семья у них очень большая , но очень дружная и веселая. Он уже четыре года занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет свой собствененый магазин , который находится рядом с домом. Кредит хочет использовать на приобретение холодильника и дополнительной ветрины. Погасить же кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirdjon M. lives in Bohtar. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. His parents also share his family home. His family is big, but very happy and friendly. Mirdjon has been in the food products sales business for four years. He owns a store close to his home. Mirdjon wants to use this loan to purchase a refrigerator and an additional display. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and another display

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong S., 59, lives with her husband in Bati, Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a local doctor and sells medicines from her home, averaging the equivalent of $20 in revenue per day. Her husband runs a small coffee shop and makes  $8 a day. They have one child. Mrs. Huong S. would use a loan to purchase more medicines to sell. She is pictured here at home with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou Diémé, 53 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Niaguis Néma depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre du bois mort. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et la scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Diémé, age 53, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Niaguis Néma for seven and a half years. Her work consists in buying and reselling deadwood. She wants to bolster her commerce and to improve the living, health, and schooling situations of her children. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell wood

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат 43 летняя мать троих детей.Торгует на рынке Худжанда парфюмерией и косметикой.За товаром она сама ездит в Бишкек.Каждый займ она использует на расширение бизнеса.Раньше она продавала только духи, но со временем в её ассортимент вошли и косметические наборы и разные мелкие принадлежности для быта.
Следующий кредит хочет потратить на увеличение оборотного капитала и разнообразить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Malohat is a forty-three-years-old mother of three. Malohat sells perfumes and cosmetics at Khudzhand market. She purchases her goods in Bishkek. Her previous loans Malohat used to expand her business. In the past, Malohat only sold perfumes, but later she added cosmetics gift sets and miscellaneous household items to her assortment. This loan, Malohat plans to use to increase her working capital and to further expand the variety of products sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes inventory

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka P., 55, is married with 7 children. She has 5 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~110 USD). SPBD loans are Repeka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment such as googles, spear, torch, cooler and a fishing net for a fishing business.

loans.name: Rose Ndagire‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 5 member group. She is a 31 year old single mother of four children aged between 4 and 16 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a three-roomed house where she is staying with six people. Rose takes care of additional family members (Parents). There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose runs a bar selling local gin in Nakulabye. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Rose buys clothing from suppliers who get them from villages and doesn’t incur extra transport costs.

Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity and school fees. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenges are defaulters and rental charges. Rose has been with MCDT for over four years and is servicing her eighth loan, working this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerricans of local gin and aspires to owning a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more jerricans of local gin

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique es un hombre de 53 años, padre de 2 hijos; Wilson de 17 y José de 15 años, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es brindarle buenos estudios superiores a sus dos queridos hijos. Su vida no ha sido muy sencilla, desde muy joven siempre trató de trabajar duro para forjarse un buen futuro y poder brindarle a su familia las comodidades que él no tuvo. Actualmente se dedica al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por los vecinos de su barrio, ya que tiene más de 10 años en esta actividad y el trabajo que realiza es muy bueno. A Enrique le gusta mucho levantar paredes y techar casas, siente que con su labor ayuda al desarrollo de su barrio; por ello, tiene planeado para más adelante incursionar en el colocado de parket (pisos), lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados tablones de construcción, lo que ha hecho que su cuerpo ya no tenga la misma resistencia de antes. Enrique está muy contento con la oportunidad de préstamo con MFP, se siente muy seguro de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que es muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará una máquina pulidora de parket, para poder comenzar a trabajar en esta nueva actividad.
texts.en:
53-year old Enrique has two sons, Wilson who is 17 and José who is 15. He lives in his own house, and what he most desires is to be able to afford higher education for his two beloved sons. His life hasn’t been easy: ever since he was very young, he has always tried to work hard and provide for his family the comforts that he never had. He currently works as a bricklayer, and he is much sought after by his neighbours since he has been doing very good work for more than ten years. Enrique enjoys building walls and putting roofs on houses, and he feels that his work contributes to the development of the neighbourhood. For this reason he is planning to start a new venture--laying hardwood flooring, an activity that will help him to earn more money. In his view the most difficult part of his current job is carrying the heavy wooden planks, and his body is now not as strong as it used to be. Enrique is very pleased to have the opportunity to get a loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and he is certain that the will be able to make all his repayments on time. He is a much-admired member of the community bank as he is very responsible and respectful. With the S/.1000 loan he will buy a floor-polishing machine so that he can begin work on this new activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a polishing machine for hardwood floors

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa argentina Martínez S. tiene 39 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Rosa se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de comida. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por sus hermanas ya que anteriormente, ellas se dedicaban al negocio pero ellas fallecieron y Rosa sabia muy bien el manejo de este negocio por lo que decide iniciar vendiendo comida en su vivienda, le fue muy difícil obtener clientes porque la dirección de la casa de Rosa es muy largo, pero esto no fue motivo para desanimarla, aun así Rosa conversa con sus clientes muy alegremente. Su deseo es establecer un restaurante para proporcionarle mas espacio a sus clientes y comodidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina Martínez S. is 39 years old. She has three children. Rosa sells food for a living. She has been in this business for 7 years. The business was started by her sisters, but they passed away. Rosa knew how to manage the business well, so she decided to start selling food from her home. It has been very hard for her to attract customers because her house is very far away. However, this does not discourage her, and Rosa chats with her customers very happily. Her wish is to start a restaurant to provide more space for her customers' comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene estudios universitarios (2do siclo de Turismo), vive en el Barrio Cruzani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de golosinas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de chocolates, galletas, caramelos, jugos, yogures, etc.

Su mayor  deseo es ser mayorista, y poner un negocio de servicio de hospedaje en la Comunidad de Chinchero.

A ella le gustan la unión y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Fany belongs to the "Cajas Reales” communal bank that is located in the Chucuito District in the Province of Puno in the state of Puno. She is 22 years old and single. She has had university study (tourism) and lives in Barrio Cruzani. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 1 year. Her first loan was for 300 Nuevos Soles which was used to purchase candies to sell. Currently she needs a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be used to purchase chocolates, cookies, caramel candies, juices, yogurt, etc. Her goal is to become a wholesaler and also have a lodging service in the community of Chinchero. She likes the unity and solidarity of the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, cookies, caramel candies, juices, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Eoum

texts.en: Eoum Y., age 35, has worked for a local garment factory in Takeo Province since 2003. Typically, she makes $2 US per day. Y. and her husband work very hard all day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for their family. They are blessed to have a four-month-old child. Y.'s husband is a motor-taxi driver who makes approximately $3 US per day by providing transportation services to local people. Y. wants to take out a loan of $800 US to purchase a new motorbike for her husband, as his current bike is in bad condition and consumes too much gasoline because of its age. She hopes that a new motorbike will allow her husband to work more and thus generate more income for their family. This picture features Y.'s husband, as she was not available at the time it was taken.

loans.use: Purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Qeyrat

texts.en:
Qeyrat S. is a farmer who grows potatoes, something he has done for six years. For Qeyrat, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most.

Qeyrat is 47 years old and married with two children. Now he wants to borrow money to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop. This is a first loan for Qeyrat and he promises to repay the loan in time without any violations.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth   bakes cake and sells. She is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business since 1981. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more baking material to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material

loans.name: Amila

texts.en:
Amila L. started helping her husband grow rice last 2002. He has a 4-year old child that is her inspiration to pursue more in business. Currently, her family has a 1-hectare farm. Her dream is to make it prosper so that she could be able to give her child a college education that she never had when she was younger.

By availing loan of Php 5,000 she will be able to finace the needs in her business. The loan will able her to pay the laborers who helped them transplant the rice seedlings and toiled hard during land preparation. With this loan, Amila L. and her family, will be able to sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita L. is from Pagadian City. She is 35 years old. Perlita is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Perlita owns and operates a specialized service business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Perlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Perlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Agelo

texts.en:
Agelo R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell.  Agelo is 45 years old and married. Her husband is an engineer. She has 7 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by purchasing fish for resale at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard work helps to support her family. For the past three years, Afia has supported her husband in providing for the household by selling used shoes and ladies' slippers. There is a very big market in Ghana for used shoes as brand new ones are very expensive for the poor. Therefore selling used shoes and slippers has created a market for many women like Afia.

With her loan, Afia wants to increase her inventory. She believes the loan will help her save for her children’s education, and also enable her to rent a store to minimize her frequent hawking.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Rafaela De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rafaela de los Ángeles tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que dio inicio a este negocio, de manera ambulante cuando ella empezó a vender fue por la razón de que era madre soltera y tenía que sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, por lo que fue así de que decidió tomar la iniciativa de empezar a vender una variedad de ropa. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para trabajar y tratar de tener una estabilidad económica. Sus deseos son que sus esfuerzos valgan la pena.
texts.en:
Rafaela de los Ángeles is 41 years old. Her work is clothing sales. It has been more than 5 years since she began this ambulatory business. She began to sell because she was as ingle mother and she had to support her two children. Because of this she decided to take the initiative to begin selling a variety of clothing. It is for this that she is asking for this loan in order to work and try to have economic stability. Her desires are for her efforts to be worth the trouble.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela O. es propietaria de un negocio de venta de carteras, ropa para niños y venta de gaseosas y reposterías ubicada en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega donde a diario es visitada por los clientes para llevar los productos y también para comprar las reposterías y gaseosas para consumirlas.
Ella es una dama comprometida con el bienestar de su hogar y por esta causa trabaja fuertemente para mejorar las condiciones del negocio. El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de los productos y también para la compra de las gaseosas y las reposterías para así continuar comercializándolas en su tramo.
texts.en:
María Estela O. owns a shop in Chinandega department where she sells purses, children's clothing, soft-drinks and pastries. She attends to her customers daily who come to buy her products and consume her soft-drinks and pastries. She is a woman who is committed to her home, motivated to work hard to improve the state of her business. The financing she is asking for will be used to buy merchandise as well as soft-drinks and pastries to continue her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like soft-drinks and pastries.

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en:
Suzi A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood and is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and bundles of firewood to sell. Suzi is a 48-year-old married woman with a husband who is a driver. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery de 37 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa  propia junto a sus 2 hijos; Karen de 12 y Cristian de 6, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Para Mery el negocio de la venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le a permitido obtener los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, se dedica específicamente a la venta de polos, lo cuales compra del un mercado importante de su ciudad, para llevarlos a vender a su centro de trabajo, ya que también realiza la labor de limpieza en un centro hospitalario. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientas, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar las prendas hasta su centro de trabajo, ya que los fardos pesan mucho. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y que le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mercadería en polos, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
37 year-old Mery is a very sensible and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her two children: 12 year-old Karen and 6 year-old Cristian, who are the motivation for all of her efforts. For Mery, the business of selling clothes has been an activity which has allowed her to obtain the necessary income to maintain her family. Specifically, she sells polos, which she buys from an important market in her city to bring them to sell at her work, since she also works cleaning a hospital. What she likes the most about her work is conversing with her customers. She has been doing this for two years and she considers the most difficult thing is to have to bring the garments to her work, as the bundles weigh a lot. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and that it will bring her a better income. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay the money on time and is prepared to do so. In her community bank, she is a very happy and responsible member. With the requested $350 (1000 PEN), she will buy more polo merchandise to offer a greater variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise to improve her business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle B. is from the village of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old and is single. Michelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El señor Ronald y su hermano Aldo son dos jovenes emprendedores que tras haber trabajado tres años en una peluqueria de mascotas tuvieron la idea de abrir un negocio en el que se pueda brindar al cliente este tipo de servicio pero a domicilio nombrando al mismo PELUQUERIA MOVIL LUCKY, actualmente la empresa cuenta con cuarenta a cincuenta clientes fijos que solicitan el servicio quincenal y mensualmente ademas de contar con sesenta clientes  informales que solicitan el credito irregularmente pero los señores llevan cuenta de estos, mercado al cual se dirigen es exclusivamente  la zona sur y entre los clientes destacados podemos nombrar a una conocida conductora de television quien fue una e sus primeras clientes.

El destino del credito es para la compra de material de trabajo para el lavado y corte de pelo de los clientes de la peluqueria caN..

Esta muy agradecidos con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronald and his brother Aldo are two young entrepreneurs. After working three years at a pet grooming salon, they decided to open a business in which they would provide this type of service at the client’s home. They named their business “Peluqueria Movil Lucky” (Lucky Mobile Pet Grooming), which currently has 40-50 established clients that request service on a biweekly or monthly basis. In addition, they have another 60 informal clients who request service on credit on an “as needed” basis, so these individuals are counted as part of their client roster. Their target market is only in the southern district and among their most distinguished clients is a famous television host who was one of their first customers.

Ronald will use this loan to purchase supplies needed for washing and grooming his clients’ dogs. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his pet grooming business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe C. is from the village of Mobod Oroquieta City. She is sixty-three years old. Fe is married and has four grown children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling eggs in the local community. Fe is just starting this business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This will be Fe's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a 39-year-old lady who operates a butchery in Komarock area in Nairobi.   Her husband runs a salon.  They are blessed with two children who are in school.  She also runs a salon to earn extra income.  She has been a member of Faulu Kenya and previously took a loan of Kes 40,000.  She plans to buy salon equipment and cosmetics, increase her butchery stock and buy a small fridge.  

As a result, Annastasia has requested a loan in the amount of Kes.74,000.  She hopes to have rental houses in the future.  She dreams of expanding her business into a  wholesale one.

loans.use: Add stock of meat and buy a fridge

loans.name: Entike

texts.en:
M. is 42 years old and married with four children.  He is a livestock farmer who buys cattle to fatten then sell. He has been in the business for a period of five years, earning a monthly profit of about 40,000 Kenya shillings.

He was introduced by a KADET client. He has never borrowed from another Micro Finance Institution before. He wants to use the loan to buy more cattle to fatten.

He hopes to invest in hybrid cows and goats to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy goats, sheep and cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: N. Esther, a hardworking businesswoman of 29 years old, is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after five dependents. She has owned a spare parts shop for over twelve years. She is using the loan to purchase spare parts, grease, oil lubricants, and so forth to improve on her shop and more so to meet her customers' demands. Her future hopes are to expand her shop and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, grease, oil lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Thomas Bahati

texts.en:
Thomas Bahati is a 36 year old man who deals in the biofuel business. He also operates a second business of selling groceries and this he has done for seven years.  Thomas is a father of four. He operates his businesses from Kibokoni Malindi, where his customers are residents in and around the area. He earns a profit of KES 4,800 per month. 

This will be Thomas' second loan, after he learned about Kadet through a marketing activity. With this loan, he will source for charcoal and firewood with KES 10,000 and grocery stock with KES 10,000. He hopes this loan will boost his business so that he can expand his grocery shop, build rental houses and educate his children comfortably.

loans.use: Source for charcoal and stock shop

loans.name: Esteban Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Esteban Ramón M. R., es casado y con sus 4 hijos habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, una  de sus hijas es mayor de edad y sobrevive de manera independiente, el señor M. labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace 16 años.

Uno de los principales proyectos de la familia, está la culminación de la infraestructura del hogar, debido a que actualmente se convive en un solo cuarto con todos los hijos, es por esta razón que solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan realizar divisiones que aporten a la independencia de los miembros de la familia y al buen convivir de los pequeños, debido a que en su crecimiento, van demandando mejores condiciones de habitad.
texts.en:
Esteban Ramón M. R. is married and lives with his 4 children in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. One of his daughters is an adult and supports herself. Señor M. has worked as a security guard for 16 years. One of the main projects of his family is to complete the infrastructure of their home. Currently they live in only one room with all of their children. For this reason they request a loan to buy construction materials that would allow them to create dividing walls that would provide independence for the members of the family and good living conditions for the children, because as they are growing they need better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi M., 60, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who grows rice. They earn an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Two of the children are employed at a local company,  each earning an income of USD 100 per month to help the family.  

M. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to buy clothes for one of the children to resell at the city. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell at the market

loans.name: Rufilia

texts.es:
Rufilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Rufilia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, vive en su casa de material rustico y su sueño es construir una casa de material noble, Rufilia se dedica a la compra de tara, cochinilla y cuero, productos que acopia todos los días en la comunidad de Mollepata, luego sus productos los vende a su papa que es mayorista de estos productos, también Rufilia viaja a la feria de Huamanguilla en donde compra sus productos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cochinilla.
El deseo de Rufilia es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rufilia belongs to the Tarpuy community bank, which means to sow in Quechua. Rufilia is married with 5 children, 4 of whom study. She lives in a home made from humble materials, and dreams of building a higher quality home. Rufilia makes a living buying tara, cochineal [a type of red dye], and leather, which she gathers daily in Mollepata, then sells these products to her father who is a wholesaler. She also travels to the Huamanguilla street market to purchase her goods. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of cochineal. It's Rufilia's wish to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cochineal

loans.name: Fatoumata Bintou

texts.fr: Fatoumata Bintou B. est une femme mariee et mere 3 enfants.Elle a une boutique alimentation et vend des produits alimentaires.Elle achete ses produits au niveau des grossistes bases a ziguinchor meme.Elle a une experience de 6 ans dans ce metier.Elle fait ce metier par amour mais aussi elle en fait un moyen de gagner sa vie.Car pour elle les benefices realises vont dans les charges familiales et le reste dans l'epargne.Elle compte developper sa boutique et etre grossiste demain.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Bintou B. is married and mother of three children. She owns a shop which sells food products. She buys her products from the wholesalers based in Ziguinchor. She has 6 years experience in this profession. She does this work out of love, but also to earn a living. For her, the profits go toward meeting household expenses, and the remainder go into savings. She hopes to develop her shop and to one day become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pour renforcer son stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fish, shrimp, turtle eggs, crab, lobster, oysters, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe L. is from the village of Compol, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old and is married with four adult children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 44 years old. Lilia is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing sound system services to local community members. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Lilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion D. is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Consolacion owns and operates a manufacturing business in which she sells ice cream to community members. Consolacion has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Consolacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice cream. Consolacion is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Consolacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make ice cream

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 30 years old and is married with three children 3 to 9 years old. He has no other dependents. He lives in a rented home in Hoima, Uganda, and his family goal is to educate his children.

Jimmy has a textile retail shop and he has been in this business for two years. He started his business from the savings he got from working with the police force. He faces challenges of old stock which can’t be sold and high competition. In future he wishes to change to a hardware business.

Jimmy wants the loan to purchase more women’s and men’s clothing to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more men's and women's wear to sell in his shop

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña María resiD. en el caserío la Ceiba del Departamento D. San Miguel solo con su esposo don Carlos ya que sus hijos viven en sus respectivos hogares, ella se dedica a la crianza D. ganado y también venD. sopa D. mondongo que es plato típico y se prepara del estomago D. la vaca, este es el negocio que genera los ingresos del hogar.
Doña María solicita un préstamo pues quiere comprar vacas adultas para desarrollar futuras crías y así multiplicar su crianza; este préstamo ayudara para aumentar su número D. ganado y que pueda obtener más productos para la venta.
Las proyecciones D. ella son crecer su granja D. ganado, aumentar sus ventas y atender más clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos con la venta D. la sopa e incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Doña María lives in the hamlet of Ceiba, which is in the department of San Miguel.  She lives only with her husband, as their children all live in their own houses.  She raises cattle and also sells tripe soup, which is a typical dish prepared from the stomach of a cow.  Her business generates their household income.

Ms. María is requesting a loan in order to buy adult cows to breed, which will multiply the number of animals she has.  The loan will help her to increase her number of cattle and to have more products to sell.  Her goals are to expand her cattle farm, increase sales, and to please more customers with the soup she sells, thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Karen Minnelly

texts.es:
Karen de 19 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Da sus servicio como estilista en su casa. 

Hace 4 años hizo una especialización en Artesanía de Belleza dirigida a estilista como le gusto quiso que esta sea una de sus profesiones que le generaría ingresos. Desde esa fecha hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Tiene su pequeño espacio de corte y belleza en su casa ya que aun no tiene un lugar fijo, hace cortes de cabellos, tinturados, alisados, tratamientos etc. 
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos de belleza, sillas y muebles para tener ya su negocio bien establecido. En el futuro quiere tener un local en su casa para ubicar el gabinete de belleza y tener una papelería para mas ingresos y así ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Karen is 19 years old and she lives in a region called Playas. It's a tourist destination in Ecuador with a huge variety of seafood. She works as a stylist in her home.
