Four years ago she did a specialized course in Beauty Arts, with a focus on being a stylist because she liked it and thought it would be a good income-generating profession. Since then she has worked from 8am until 11pm every day. She has a small space in her home where she does cuts and beauty treatments. Although she doesn't have a dedicated space, she is able to do haircuts, coloring, straightening and other types of treatments. 

With the loan she would like to buy beauty products, chairs and furniture in order to formally establish her business. In the future she would like to have a beauty parlor in her home and a stationery store to increase her income and help her parents economically.

loans.use: Beauty products, chairs, furniture

loans.name: Maximino

texts.en: Maximino R. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maximino owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Maximino is just starting this business. Maximino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximino is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maximino from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es: Marciano, de 19 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Irene de 17 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Teniendo todavía una vida por delante, Marciano sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica a la siembra de cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus cultivos, los compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante, desea comprar más tierras con las cuales pueda aumentar sus cultivos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café, también comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Marciano, 19, is a hardworking and cheerful young man. He lives in his own home with his wife Irene who is 17. What he wants most is to get on with his life. Still having his full life ahead of him, Marciano knows he has to put all his strength into making a living with his work.

He is dedicated to the cultivation of cocoa, coffee and coca leaf. With the coming harvest season, he will bring his products for sale in the city of San Francisco, where customers know the quality of his crops, and buy them quickly.

What he likes about his job is to protect his crops from insect pests. He has been performing this activity for the past two years and believes that the hardest thing is to get the crops to the place where they are sold, as the bags are quite heavy.

In the future, he wants to buy more land open which he can increase his crops. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows he has to pay his dues on time if he wants to access another loan later. He is a very active partner in their community bank. With the 2,000 soles requested he will buy cocoa and coffee beans, and also bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy cocoa and coffee beans, and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 26 years old. Nancy is married and has a 5-year-old child. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nancy earns approximately 3000 PHP from her business and hopes to increase this.

Nancy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is an active member and treasurer of Ngeet Group which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for twenty years. His mixed farm produces milk, maize and beans which he sells locally. He also earns income from the sale of scrap items to the local market.

Joseph is 47 years old and married with 4 school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested this loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income obtained from the sale of milk will boost the family's other business and this will improve the living standards of his family. He says that his biggest challenge has been poor weather conditions which affects milk production and causes the prices of the animal feeds to go up. He hopes that his milk production will improve in future since he plans to increase the number of his dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela G., 38, is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months from these activities.

In 2010, Carmela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoes for her husband's shop

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus Mwau is a 29 year-old gentleman. He and his wife Priscilla have been blessed with three children between three and eight years old. 

Titus is a poultry farmer while his wife is a housewife who also supports her husband by working on their farm.  He is able to make a profit of about Kshs 10,000 a month from selling the poultry. He has been in this business for 10 years and his clients are from the busy Mlolongo markets.

Titus joined KADET LTD after he was introduced by a friend who was already a client. He has now applied for his second loan which he will use to buy more poultry for resale.  He hopes this investment will give him good profits that he can add to his savings for future use.

He hopes to have a bigger poultry farm where he can sell his chicken at wholesale to retailers. He believes he is hard-working and ambitious and with the capital needed, he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to resell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman who lives in Barangay Tan-awan, in Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fish vending and pig fattening. Her husband, Francisco, who is 60 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 22 and 27 years old. 

Juliana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juliana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $187, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use for additional capital for the fish vending business so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Juliana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of fish vending business

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El señor Simón C. tiene 65 años estado civil viudo, él cría un nieto viven en la población de Colomi que está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, El sr. Simón C. tiene una tienda de abarrotes nos comenta que necesitaba más capital para ampliar la tienda porque  tiene muchos clientes. Simón es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. 

Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, El sr. Simón C. está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito y poder ampliar la tienda de abarrotes ahora tendrá más ingreso por la venta de ( aceite, fideo, macarrón, azúcar etc.) podrá ahorrar dinero para ayudar a su nieta en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Simón C. is 65-years-old and a widow.  He takes care of a grandchild and lives in the town of Colomi that is located 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  He has a grocery store and he told us that he needs more capital to expand the store because he has many customers.  Simón is a very humble, hard-working, and responsible person.  It is very difficult for him to use the city banks as they request that he fulfill many requirements.

He had the initiative to go to come here to sign up for a loan.  He is very happy to obtain a loan and to be able to expand his grocery store.  Now he will have more income from selling oil, noodles, pasta, sugar, et cetera and can save money to help his granddaughter in her studies.

loans.use: Working capital for a grocery store

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke, age 36, is a fish vendor, a business he has operated for five years. He is the married father of four children. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business. He has also received business management training. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale vending in the future.   

He had previously serviced a loan from Faulu Kenya. He is now requesting another loan of 20,000 Kes in order to buy a refrigerator for the preservation of fish.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for the preservation of fish

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel M. tiene 52 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene cinco hijos pero  ninguno depende de ella, vive en la aldea Altos de la Cruz desde hace 39 años y se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas y los fines de semana elabora tamales y pan casero. dicha actividad le a permitido salir adelante.
Sus hijos se encuentran fuera del pais.
doña Maria Isabel es una mujer de pocas palabras y muy seria.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales al por mayor para la fabricacion de las tortillas, a si le sale mas barato y obtiene mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel M. is 52 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has five children, none of whom depend on her any more.  She has lived in the village of Altos de la Cruz for 39 years and her business is making and selling tortillas.  On the weekend she makes tamales and homemade bread.  This business has allowed her to get ahead in life.  Maria Isabel's children live out of the country.

Maria Isabel is a woman of few words and is very serious.  She will use her loan to buy supplies wholesale for making her tortillas.  In this way, her supplies work out cheaper and she makes more profits.

loans.use: to buy firewood, lime, corn and water

loans.name: Geraldine's Group

texts.en:
Geraldine C. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 28 years old. Geraldine is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Geraldine C.'s Group.

Geraldine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geraldine owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Geraldine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tunaweza Group

texts.en:
Grace M. is in her early twenties and is single. She has had a door-to-door, fabric selling business for two years. She works from 10.00am to 06.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Grace's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fabrics and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics and to start selling sodas and juice. Her dream is to, one day, open a grocery shop and sell beer as well.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group, "Tunaweza", which has a total of 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Grace is behind in a black dress.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and to start selling sodas and juice.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 33-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is only 13 years old.

Rosalinda is a farmer and tills her own land. She has been growing rice for five years. Rosalinda earns about 3000 PHP per month from her farming business. She works hard to improve her income and be able to sustain her family.

This loan will be used by Rosalinda to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, age 62, is married and resides with her family in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has one child.  Neang has a business as a weaver and earns an income of $3 per day to help cover her family's expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who works as a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Neang and her husband have had these businesses. 

Neang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more raw silk to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Dandalo, in mountainous Adjara, in the western part of the country. He is a  23-year-old farmer and lives with his parents, elder sister and grandparents. Giorgi’s father works as night-watchman in a local school; his mother is a housewife. His sister is a teacher in the same school. His grandparents are retired. 

Giorgi is heading up the family farm. He runs a small dairy farm consisting of two milk cows. His mother produces traditional Georgian cheese, which is sold on the local market. Along with the above-mentioned, Giorgi grows vegetables and grapes on 1 ha. of land owned by the family. Vegetables are sold to retailers locally and grapes are used for wine-making. Wine is sold locally to the villagers. 

With the requested credit Giorgi plans to expand the vineyard, through planting additional grape vines. He will be able to produce more wine and sell it on the local market as there is quite a big demand for his wine in the village. 

Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business and another part will be saved for house renovation, in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase young grape vines and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee is 49 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter helps with the family business and her husband herds chickens. Managing a construction material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center, Tsetsgee purchases her inventories from Ulaanbaatar wholesalers during the summer and Chinese wholesalers during the winter.

Now that she has many regular customers, Tsetsgee is planning to expand her business in the future. A responsible woman who says, "I want to sell more goods in order to earn more during the summertime," she is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories from China.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories from China

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 28 years old and a single mother of a four-year-old.  To earn a living, she runs a boutique.  She has been in the business for four years and has one employee.  She was previously was selling clothes to earn a living.  She works hard in her business so as to educate her child.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business.

She hopes to own a company in the future.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and handbags.

loans.use: To buy clothes and handbags.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is 32 years-old.  She is married and has 3 children ages 14, 11 and 8.  In 2003, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food materials for her business.  In the future, Tara plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys materials for her tea shop business

loans.name: Masline Moraa

texts.en:
Masline is married and they have three children aged between sixteen years old and ten years old. She sells water in a residential area in Nairobi. She has been in this business for four years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase a water tank to supply water to more people. She hopes to grow her business and in future diversify to a retail shop business. She describes herself as ambitious and committed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Ислом талантливый и образованный человек.  Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. С детства он хотел иметь свой собственный бизнес и стать богатым человеком. Он идет вперед по этой линии, который он представил и нарисовал для себя. Постепенно он открыл свой маленький собственный бизнес с мизерными капиталами. Теперь он расширил и занимается купля продажей продтоварами и промтоварами. В настоящее время Ислом хочет расширить свой бизнес и добавит новый ассортимент продукции, чтобы клиенты могли найти то, что искали. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Islom is a talented and educated man. He is married and is a responsible father of 2 children. Since his childhood Islom wanted to have his own business and become a rich man. Islom is still working towards that goal which he has envisioned for himself. At first Islom opened his own little store using meager personal funds. Now he has expanded his venture and sells groceries and office supplies at his store. Currently Islom wants to grow his business and purchase an expanded inventory so that his customers would always be able to find what they were looking for at his store. With this goal in mind Islom is requesting a loan of 2000 US dollars.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries and office supplies

loans.name: Vaitapu

texts.en:
Vaitapu is 41 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business selling baked goods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Vaitapu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell such as chicken leg quarters for making barbecue.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Vaitapu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Vaitapu's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking businessman who is 41 years old. He is married and blessed with six children. For the last 10 years, he has been selling cereals to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to become the supplier of cereals in his region. He is requesting a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shilling to buy beans. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become business oriented.

loans.use: To buy beans

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.es: Jhoana es socia del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta, tiene 24 años, su negocio es un taller de Bordados y Artesanía que tiene en su casa, pero antes ella se dedicaba a la compra y venta de ropa, ahora se unió al negocio de su familia y le va muy bien, agradece por todo el apoyo que le dieron cuando ella mas necesitaba y las capacitaciones ayudaron mucho para que pueda progresar, ahora este préstamo lo utilizará en comprar hilos hebillas y caminos de mesa para los bordados, esta ahorrando para poder tener una tienda en el centro.
texts.en:
Jhoana is a member of the "Sumacc Huayta" communal bank.  She is 24 years old, and her business is a workshop in her home where she does embroidery and handicrafts.  Although she previously she worked buying and selling clothes, she has now joined the family business and it's going very well for her.

She is grateful for all the support that has been given to her when she most needed it, and for the trainings which have helped her greatly so that she can progress.  

This current loan will be used to buy thread, buckles, and table runners for embroidering.  

She is saving up to be able to have a store in the town center.

loans.use: to buy thread, buckles and table runners for embroidery.

loans.name: Rusif

texts.ru: Rusif 26 let. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka kotoriy rodilsya nedavno. V svazi s etim yemu nujno uvelichet kolichestvo svoyego yejemesechnogo budjeta. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva dlya prodaji. Rusif yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric.
texts.en: Rusif is 26 years old.  He is married and has one child, who was recently born.  Because of this, he needs to increase his monthly budget.  Rusif currently needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens in order to increase its quantity available for sale.  Rusif is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his his beloved wife and child in the Fuzuli region.  He has been involved in bird farming for three years and breeds chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, a farmer in Murang'a, Central Kenya, has been in farming for over 20 years with one farmhand, producing and selling milk, vegetables and coffee to the local market. He is married with 5 children. 

Simon has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter for his dairy farm. He says it will help improve his dairy production and save him the costs incurred in wastage of animal fodder. He remains optimistic about the business growth.

He, however, laments the high costs of the management of diseases.

loans.use: To purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 39-years-old and married to Daniel. Together they have three children aged 15,13 and six years-old. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 14 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 8,000 from  the business.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for use in the farm.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her dream is to expand her size of farm and increase the amount of fruits she farms.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and pesticides.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. miguel Ángel, tiene 39 años de edad, casado desde hace 9 años, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela, vive en Las Flores Santa Bárbara.

Miguel tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la producción de café, ha trabajado con su familia la mayor parte de su vida, actualmente este negocio esta siendo muy rentable en el país. Hace tres años aproximadamente que compro un terreno de 2 manzanas para establecer su propia finca, el comenzó cultivando 0.5 de manzana ahora tiene cultivado 1.5 de manzana y su sueño es llegar a tener cultivado las 2 manzanas.  Esta muy feliz porque su finca es propia, esta bien ubicada, la zona es apta para este cultivo.  Adicional al café también siembra frijoles para el consumo.

La producción la vende en pergamino húmedo (grano fresco),para exportación en variedades Catimor y café Lempira.
Este es su primer préstamo, y es para invertirlo en comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas para mantenimiento de su finca.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 39 years old, and he has been married for nine years.  He has two children; ages one and nine.  One of them goes to school.  He lives in Las Flores, Santa Bárbara.

Miguel has devoted himself to coffee production for 20 years.  He has worked with his family for the greater part of his life.  This business is currently very profitable in his country.  Approximately three years ago he bought two “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.728 acres) of land in order to establish his own farm.  

He started cultivating 0.5 manzana, and now he has cultivated 1.5 manzanas.  His dream is to come to have cultivated the two manzanas.  He is very happy because the farm is his own, it is in a good location, and the zone is suitable for this crop.  In addition to the coffee he also grows beans for consumption.  He sells the production as wet parchment coffee (fresh bean) for exporting the Catimor and Lempira varieties of coffee.

This is his first loan.  He will use it to buy fertilizers and herbicides for farm maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: La señora Elvia tiene 24 años y está casada, han estudiado sólo la primaria, tienen dos hijos de 5 y 2 años, viven a ocho kilómetros de la ciudad en la zona denominada Quenamani, su casa está en una cerranía, como actividad económica se dedican a la cría de ganado lechero, no tienen terrenos de pastoreo, alquilan los pastos y trasladan los  mismos después de cortar hasta su casa y corral, necesitan comprar cáscara de soya para la alimentación de las vacas.  Su actividad está en crecimiento y quieren mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Elvia is 24 years old and married.  She only completed her primary education.  She has two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  They live eight kilometers from the city in an area called Quenamani.  Elvia's house is up in the hills.  Her business is raising dairy cows.  She does not own pastureland but rents it.  After her animals have grazed she takes them to her home and pens.  Elvia needs to buy soy husks to feed her cows.  Her business is growing and she would like to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soy husks to feed her cows

loans.name: Darwin Adonay

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 25 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Santa Fe en el municipio de Trojes. 

Darwin inició a seis años a dedicarse a la siembra de hortalizas y café y aprendió de estos oficios por su padre. La mayoria del tiempo trabaja solo pero de vez en cuando tiene que contratar dos o tres empleados para realizar ciertas actividades en la tierra cultivada. La jornada laboral en la finca inicia a las 6 am y culmina a las 2 pm para sus empleados, pero él se queda realizando el riego y cuidando los cultivos. 

El prestamo que Darwin esta solicitando lo necesita para pagar la mano de obra de sus empleados por el mantenimiento dado a sus cultivos de tomate y cafe. Con el apoyo del prestamo podrá seguir dandole el mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivos y sus empleados tendran una fuente de ingresos y sus productos seran de mayor calidad y los vendera a un mejor precio.

Su meta es ser uno de lo mayores productores de la region para darle a su familia una mejor condicion de vida. Darwin ha recibido tres prestamos en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old, married, and has one son.  He lives with his family in the community of Santa Fe in the municipality of Trojes.

Darwin started working at 6 years old planting vegetables and coffee, which he learned from his father.  Most of the time he works alone but sometimes he hires two or three employees to help with some of the jobs cultivating land.  A typical work day on the farm begins at 6 am and ends at 2 pm for the employees but he stays to water and care for the crops.

The loan Darwin requests is needed to pay the employees for their work maintaing the tomato and coffee crops.  With the help of the loan he will be able to adequately maintain his crops, his employees will have a source of income, and his products will be of better quality and sell at a higher price.

His goal is to be one of the biggest producers in the region and give his family a better quality of life.  Darwin has received three loans from FAMA and has completed the payments on time.

loans.use: pay for labor.

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en: Prisila, who is in her 20's, is married and has three children. She earns a living by selling secondhand clothes, works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is applying for her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She repaid these loans completely and on time. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy more items to sell. Her goal for the future is to open a large shop where she can sell her clothing. Plicila will share this loan with her group, which is called "Lotus" and has 15 members. Each member holds the others accountable for repaying their share of this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, fried fish and hot pepper sauce (shito) at Akawnda near Elmina which she has done for 10 years. She is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. Nyame uses her earnings to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees and other household expenses. Nyame will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil  and other food items

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro José tiene 41 años de edad es divorciado tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 9 años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC TENDAL está conformada  por 11 integrantes entre hombres y mujeres se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la cooperativa.

Pedro   se dedica a la venta ambulante de choclos asados y cocinados y además a la agricultura.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en  Chillanes todos los días. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos,fertilizantes para los cultivos de maíz y poder cosechar un producto de calidad.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la venta y tener mejores ingresos para la  familia. El sueño es  ser integrante de una cooperativa de camionetas en San Pedro de Guayabal.

Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es el mal tiempo y la suba de precios de los abonos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir, es respetuoso, responsable y le gustan las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Pedro José, 41, is divorced and has a nine-year-old son that he lives with in Chillanes, Bolívar Province.

The “Tendal” communal bank has 11 members, both men and women, and is located 45 minutes from the Cooperativa.

Pedro is a street vendor of roasted and cooked corn on the cob; he’s also a farmer.

His purchases and his sales take place in Chillanes every day.  He’s asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his corn crops to be able to harvest a quality product.

With help from the loan he will increase sales and have better family income.  His dream is to join a trucking cooperative in San Pedro de Guayabal.

The challenges he’s faced are bad weather and the rising price of manure.

In his free time he likes to sleep.  He’s respectful, responsible and enjoys the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Dedicación es una de las palabras con las que mejor se reconoce a Maria Elena, que con 51 años de edad tiene su propio taller de confección a terceros, y desde el cual genera los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos del hogar donde vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo. Maria Elena siempre tuvo el sueño de tener su propio negocio y poder contratar a muchas personas necesitadas de ingresos, y ya hace 10 años que lo ha cumplido con su taller, donde contrata a algunas personas por temporadas. Maria Elena aspira a que en un futuro su negocio crezca, se consolide en su región y pueda dejarles una estabilidad económica a sus hijos. Como se avecina la temporada escolar, Maria Elena se prepara para los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, por lo que comprará insumos para la confección de uniformes.
texts.en: Dedication is one of the words that most identifies with Maria Elena, who at 51 years old has her own sewing shop that generates the necessary income to cover household expenses for her husband and their four children. Maria Elena always had a dream of having her own business and being able to hire many people in need of income, and 10 years ago she fulfilled this dream with her workshop, where she hires some seasonal workers. Maria Elena hopes her business grows in the future to expand its reach in the region and to provide financial stability for her children. As the school season approaches, Maria Elena is preparing her customers' orders, which is why she plans to purchase supplies to make uniforms.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies for uniforms.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 46 year old married woman who supports 3 family members from Hay Nazal Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for clothes to sell.In the future she would like to open a shop and she hopes to marry her son's.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Erik Clemer

texts.es:
Erik es un hombre de 27 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Erik no ja estudiado un carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Erick trabaja como vendedor en una empresa de venta de ropa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación, buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Erik se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de insumos, tales como sacos de harina, manteca, azúcar, dulces, entre otros; de esta manera Erik contará con los insumos necesario para la preparación de diversos postres para su venta, con ello él espera poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales se servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su negocio de repostería y así espera lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Para la compra de insumos, tales como sacos de harina, manteca, azúcar, dulces,etc.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de chicharron (plato tradicional de Bolivia), venta de pescado, costura de chamarras, venta de productos medicinales, venta de condimentos, venta de cosméticos, taller de costura, tejido de chompas, costura de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde le enseñaron la técnica de tejido posteriormente emprendió su propio espacio de trabajo con un poco capital que tenía y con el préstamo de Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del público. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.

En la fotografía no aparese una de las señoras, ya que esta de costado y no se la puede ver
texts.en:
The “Hormiguitas" communal bank will start its 4th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office. It is made up of nine members, and led by a board of directors, of which Olga is the chair. The businesses that members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: sale of chicharron (traditional Bolivian dish), sale of fish, sewing jackets, sale of medicinal products, sale of condiments, sale of cosmetics, sewing workshop, weaving sweaters and sewing sportswear. 

The loan they will take out benefits small business owners such as Olga. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years, and joined at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business weaving shawls. She says that she learned this business in a previous job, where she was taught the technique of weaving, and later started her own workshop with a bit of capital she had and with a loan from from Pro Mujer.

The loan she will now take out is to increase her working capital (purchase of wool) which she will acquire in the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. After making the shawls, she will sell them to customers. This type of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic, and the training that the institution offers.

One of the women does not appear in the photo, as she is off to the side and can't be seen.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Missebo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSEBO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’aide financier de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Joséphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Joséphine est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Joël. Le couple a huit enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Joséphine vend depuis quinze ans à son domicile Joséphine  achète des noix de palme, qu'elle transforme en huile et revend. Parallèlement à cette activité, Joséphine vend également du vin de palme et des divers articles de façon secondaire. Joséphine procède à la transformation des noix de palme. Joséphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Joséphine ensemble avec les membres du  groupe MISSEBO, sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de palme, du vin de palme et divers autres articles.

loans.name: Lauryn

texts.en:
Lauryn is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance ltd mdi applied for a loan of 2000,000/=. She is a married woman with children and she is a business woman operating a dress making shop. In a bid to increase on her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 2000,000/=. However she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital to purchase enough stock of material so as to make modern clothes, in order to compete with others in the same business.
She is very grateful for the support of Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for sell.

loans.name: Lusitania

texts.en:
Lusitania has a cart where she sells grilled meats (mostly carne asada). She has a pretty good amount of sales during the day, but she also must sell uncooked rice to her neighbors in order to make ends meet. She is seeking the loan in order to make significant improvements to her cart. Mainly she wants to build a roof on top of it in order to shield her from the sun and heat. She will also buy meat and rice at larger wholesale quantities and cheaper prices.

Lusitania is 28 years old and has two children. Her husband works in construction and has built the majority of their home. They have two young children who go to school. /

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the small cart she sells her products from

loans.name: Amélevi

texts.en:
At 25, Madame A. Amelevi lives in Tabligbo in the region of Yoto. She is married and mother of three children, and the caretaker of five people. Her principle economic activity is the production and sales of bread. To increase her production and her profits, she is asking for a loan of %500.00. This loan will allow her to increase her production of bread and therefore increase her profits which will lead to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 25 ans, Madame A. Amélevi vit à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec cinq (05) personnes a charge. Son activité principale est la fabrication et la vente du pain. Pour augmenter sa capacité de production et accroître la rentabilité de son activité, elle sollicite une aide financière de $500 sous forme de crédit. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de production de pain afin d’accroître ses revenus pour une bonne amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Stock wheat-flour for the production of bread.

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.en:
Maria Enriqueta is the single mother of one. She lives in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon, in northern Mexico. Her interest in sales and the need to earn money to pay for her son's schooling motivated her to start her own business 15 years ago selling clothing and shoes. She has had the good fortune of watching her business grow and she has earned a loyal customer base. Right now, Maria needs a $375 loan to buy merchandise and meet the demands of her customers. It hasn't been easy for Maria to raise her family alone, but with hard work she has succeeded. If you can help improve the lives of Maria and her son, they would very much appreciate your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Maria Enriqueta tiene un hijo., es madres soltera y vive el la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León, al norte de México. El gusto por las ventas y la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para el mantenimiento y la escuela de su hijo, la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y ropa desde hace 15 años, afortunadamente ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio y ha permanecido en el gusto de sus clientes durante todo este tiempo.

En estos momentos, Maria necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y continuar creciendo con su negocio. No ha sido fácil para Maria sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, pero con su esfuerzo lo ha logrado. Tú puedes mejora las condiciones de vida de esta familia, María y su hijo agradecen grandemente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is from Rocheachi, Chihuahua. He is married and has three children. For the past six years, he has been making and selling "pinole," a corn-based beverage. He learned this trade from his ancestors. Fortunately, he has been able to make his business grow by distributing his product in nearby areas and in Mexico City. His closely-knit family has encouraged him to develop his business, and he relies on the help of his wife and three children, who weigh, measure and label the product.

In order to continue expanding his sales, Antonio needs to increase his production. He is asking for a loan of $475 to purchase raw materials. He is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Please help this business grow and thus improve the lifestyle of Antonio and his family. Don't hesitate! Decide to help them. Thank you.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio es originario de la localidad de Rocheachi, en Chihuahua. Es casado y tiene tres hijos, desde hace seis años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pinole, que es una bebida a base de maíz, este oficio lo aprendió de sus antepasados, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio distribuyendo su producto en varias localidades cercanas y en el Distrito Federal. La unión familiar ha sido un impulso importante para el desarrollo de este negocio, porque recibe la ayuda de su esposa y sus tres hijos, pesando, midiendo y etiquetando el producto.

Para continuar ampliando su área de ventas Antonio necesita incrementar su producción y solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares para la compra de materia prima, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Antonio y su familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Tazagyul

texts.en: Ms. Tazagyul is a low-income vulnerable person. She is 48, married with one child, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Tazagyul and her son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. She sells milk in Saatli town, while her son takes care of their cows. The income is too low to support the family.  That’s why Tazagyul applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $1000 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make her monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about 800-1000 USD. Tazagyul has some savings of her own to add to the loan.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed cow

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang's family has seven members. The parents are farmers who plant rice and raise two cows, the two older daughters work as day labourers and the other children are in school. The average income is $12 per month/person. Giang is requesting a loan for $75 to aid her pig-raising business, which will increase her income and aid in the family support. The loan will be repaid in five months.

loans.use: To help pig-raising business

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en: Ramila was born in 1980. She is single and lives in the Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. 3 years ago she decided to start a farming business. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Since she was 4 years old, Domitila lived with her adoptive parents, because her real parents could not keep her. It is because of her second family that she has a merchants spirit, because since she was a child she helped selling fruits wholesale, which was the family business.

Even though she is a nutritionist by profession, for the past 17 years she has worked selling potato, sweet potato, tomato, and onion at the market of La Huaca.

When she started she had nothing but 3 sacks of potato, and nowadays she brings 100-150 sacks thanks to the financial aid from EDAPROSPO . She distributes her products to 17 popular diners, a restaurant, and to people who come to her stand.

Domitila started with a line of credit for S/.350.00, and she currently has S/1300.00. Her savings group has been active for 2 years, and she is the president.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, so she can have a larger profit margin and be able to offer a better price than the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Domitila vivió desde los 4 años con sus padres adoptivos ya que sus verdaderos padres no pudieron tenerla a su lado. Fue por su segunda familia quien lleva ese espíritu de comerciante ya que desde niña ayudó en la venta de frutas al por mayor negocio al que se dedicaba su familia.

Aunque es nutricionista de profesión, se dedica, desde hace 17 años, a la venta de papas, camote, tomate, cebolla en el mercado La Huaca.

Cuando comenzó solo contaba con 3 sacos de papas, en la actualidad trae de 100 a 150 sacos gracias al financiamiento con EDAPROSPO con lo que puede repartir sus productos a 17 comedores populares, un restaurante y a las personas que vienen a su puesto.

Domitila comenzó con una línea de crédito por S/.350.00. En la actualidad cuenta con S/1300.00, su alcancía tiene 2 años de vigencia y es ella quien la preside.

Solicitaría más crédito para comprar mercadería por mayor, ya que le dejaría mayor margen de utilidad y poder ofrecer a un mejor precio que la competencia.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Nam-Minh Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nam, 31 years old, is married with two children. She farms a dozen pigs and a flock of poultry. Her family had taken out loan before from a agricultural bank in Yên Phong. That loan was for her husband to invest in his construction project. She is a group leader of a 2-persons group that Mr. Minh is the other member, whose wife has the same activity. They both would like to take out a loan to buy feed for their live stock and more piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nam 31 tuổi, chị có chồng và 2 con. Chị chăn nuôi lợn, và gà công nghiệp. Trước kia gia đình chị cũng tham gia vay vốn của Ngân hàng nông nghiệp huyện Yên Phong, tuy nhiên không phải dùng vào mục đích chăn nuôi mà cho chồng chị cai xây dựng. Chị tham gia vốn tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích hình thức trả dần. Chị vay về mua cám nuôi lợn vì trong chuồng nhà chị có trên chục con lợn thịt. Cùng nhóm với chị là anh Minh anh cũng tham gia vay vốn để mua lợn giống vì vợ anh chăn rất nhiều lợn. Tiền công đi làm của anh sẽ dành dụm để trả nợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs and more piglets.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 48 years old and is doing his best to support his family. Kamel owns and operates a grocery store. He has 4 children and lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. This is third time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy provisions and food for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions and food for his grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. María Magdalena O. is a married woman; she is 39 years old. Her husband's name is Rubén Gaona; he is 46 years old. They have three children, all in secondary school. They own their own home where they have a business selling items for fishing and bait.

In 1997, they started a convenience store with Rubén's savings. As the years went on they gradually added fishing and bait items to the store because the clientele were requesting these items, since they live close to the river, in a busy fishing area.

Some years later they formally specialized in fishing supplies, since this was turning out to be the most profitable part of the business. Maria's husband works for the city government. He is the private secretary of the governor and provides the family's income with his salary.

They began to work with Fundación Paraguay in 2003 and comment that thanks to the loans the Foundation has provided them, their business has gone along growing daily. They are requesting a new loan for the purchase of more merchandise since this is the season of the year with the greatest inflow of fisherman to the area.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Magdalena O. es una mujer casada y tiene 39 años de edad y su esposo se llama Rubén Gaona y tiene 46 años de edad, tienen tres hijos, todos en edad secundaria, posee una casa propia y en la misma tienen un negocio de ventas de artículos para pesca y carnadas.

En el año 1997 empezaron con una despensa la cual fue formada gracias al ahorro de su esposo, pero después con los años a dicho negocio fue incorporando algunos artículos de pesca y carnadas, porque la clientela lo solicitaba ya que viven cerca del río y hay mucha gente que se dedica a la pesca en esa zona.

Luego de unos años se dedicaron ya a la venta de los insumos para pesca pues esto le resultaba mucho más rentable. El esposo de María trabaja en la gobernación de la ciudad, el es secretario privado del Gobernador y aporta al ingreso familiar con su sueldo.

Ellos empezaron a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya en el año 2003, y comentan que gracias a los préstamos que se le otorgo su negocio fue creciendo cada día. Es por eso que están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías ya que en esta época del año hay mayor afluencia de pescadores en la zona.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: reels, fishing poles, lanterns, lead weights, fishing hooks, bait and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Twalha

texts.en:
Twalha is 31-years-old and is divorced with two children; ages 14 and 12. Twalha has been selling fish and soup since 2007. She works from 7AM to 10PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $160.

She would like to secure a loan to purchase more fish and meat for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and meat for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. sells maize and gari, a popular local dish. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Sarah and their four children. Demand for her food products is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Sarah is asking for a loan to purchase additional food products for resale..

loans.use: To purchase additional food products and expand her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Cecilia is a widow with six children. The greatest challenges she has faced in life are losing her husband and two of her daughters and watching her son fall sick with a mental illness. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for a loan to help the remaining children and care for her ill son. Since joining GHAPE, she has taken and repaid six loans. With her previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, groundnuts, and yams.

Given this loan, Cecilia plans to buy manure, seedlings, and more land for crop cultivation. She will also pay for labor to assist with clearing new land. She hopes this investment will expand her farm and increase her profits, in turn allowing her to better provide for her family, including her sick son. She also intends on opening a savings account for herself to save some profit for future use. She loan will be repaid in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months after the disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, manure, and more land; to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 23 years old and single, lives in Beirut.

Mohamad works for an electronic equipment company. He works on packaging and delivery of the machines to the company clients.

He is requesting a loan for USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorcycle that will be more efficient for delivering the packages. This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorcycle for Mohamad's delivery work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: For the past eight years, Florence has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is 29 years old and married with three kids who are schooling. She is a busy trader who sells palm oil and other products like tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans and maize on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which slows her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase more stock to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: Florence would like to increase her stock of palm oil, tin tomatoes, yams, etc. for her small food stand.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inicio con este negocio ya que vive en una avenida principal de su colonia y era un buen punto para iniciar un negocio y ella decidió iniciar con la venta de comidas. Ella necesitaba tener un negocio que le dejara buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. comenzó vendiendo en una mesita afuera de su casa aproximadamente hace 15 años y conforme fue creciendo el negocio las ventas se fueron incrementando y así pudo acondicionar el frente de su casa para establecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algunos utensilios que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because she lives on a main avenue in her residential area, so it was a good location for her to get into food sales. She needed to have a business that would bring in good profits so that she could help her husband with the household expenses, thus giving her daughter a better quality of life. She started out by selling food on a little table outside her home approximately 15 years ago. As her business grew, her sales increased; hence she was able to fit out the front of her house in order to properly set up her business.

She needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase some kitchen utensils that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores, es conviviente y madre de un niño de 02 años de edad. Actualmente vive en el Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.500 incrementó su capital y compró más polleras y mantas, los cuales alquila en diferentes festividades. A los  25 años de edad se inició con este negocio porque no encontró trabajo y después de dos años tuvo su familia. Actualmente continúa con su negocio y abrirá una tienda más.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 03 juegos de polleras nuevas de Desaguadero para continuar con el alquiler de dichos trajes.  

“Mediante estos créditos hemos mejorado nuestros negocios” manifestó muy contenta Rosa.

Su gran deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener más tiendas para alquiler de polleras.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old, finished high school, is married and has a child who is 2 years of age. Currently, she lives Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno and is a member of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With this first loan of S/.500 she increased her working capital and bought more traditional clothing which she rents for different events. At age 25 she started this business because she could not find work and after two years she started her family. Currently she has her business and will open another store. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 3 new sets of traditional skirts from Desaguadero to continue with the rental of these outfits. “Through these loans we have improved our businesses” said Rosa very happily. Her big dream is to grow her business and have more stores for the rental of traditional skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 new sets of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Ташпулотов Раджабали житель города Яван. Возраст 56 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем разведения крупно рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где имеет нескольких бычков. Узнав, про возможность получить кредит обратился к нам за помощью. Получив кредит он планирует купить еще одного бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabali T. lives in Yavan. He is 56 years old, is married and has 4 children. Rajabali supports his family by raising large livestock. He has a plot where he has several calves. When he found out about the opportunity to take out a loan he turned to us for help. After taking out a loan he plans to purchase one more calf. Rajabali plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sr. Maria tiene 37 años de edad, habitante deL barrio memorial Sandino,  en la capital de Managua, casada con un  hijo de 11 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como taxista ya que es un ingreso mas para su hogar. Doña María trabaja como vendedora de ropa, zapato y tiene una pequeña pulpería inicio con fondo propio con una experiencia de diez años. Sus planes para con su familia es brindarle un mejor calidad de vida y que hijo tengan la comodidad necesaria. En ámbito laboral es seguir brindando buena atención y servicio a sus clientes y adquirí su propio salón de belleza que le permita obtener un mayor beneficio y a corto plazo sus planes son construir su casa y otra modificaciones a su vivienda. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y brindarles seguridad, protección y un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora María is 37 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, in the capital of Managua. She is married with an 11 year-old child. Her husband works as a taxi driver since it provides more income for their home. Doña María works as a seller of clothing and shoes and has a small grocery shop that she started with her own funds and with ten years of experience. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a better quality of life and for her son to have needed comfort. In the work environment, it is to continue providing good customer service and to acquire her own beauty salon that will allow her to earn more profits. In the short term, her plans are to build a house and make modifications to her home. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans, she will succeed in buying construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, and to provide better security, protection, and assets for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Finish Building her House

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté, 39 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants scolarisés en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter du bissap, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre et autres pour faire des jus et glaces qu’elle vend. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration de l’entretient de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, 39, is married, raising four children, all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for two and a half years. Her business is buying bissap (hibiscus flowers), monkey bread (baobab tree fruit), sugar, etc. to make juice and popsicles for sale. Her income allows her to help support her family better. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing bissap, monkey bread, etc. to make juice and popsicles

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old, married to Niba Gideon, and the mother of two children. She lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, Cameroon. With inadequate parental support during her own childhood, she could not make it through secondary education. Finally, she joined GHAPE at this juncture in her life and, after obtaining training in business management, she obtained her first loan of 40,000 Frs in 2007.Her achievement from this loan was plowed back into her medicine store. Alice plans to invest this loan in the medicine store by buying more medication.

With the profits from this loan, Alice hopes to expand her business and support her children, improve their education, and improve her family’s living standards. She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is set up so that her payments are small and regular.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., a 51-year-old resident of Trapaing Krosang village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Ha Hoeun, is a construction worker. Sokhom is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new family home.

She has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new family home.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es: Yuliana es una joven soltera, que a sus 22 años, todavía vive con sus padres, a los cuales quiere mucho y desea darles una vida más tranquila. Como todos los jóvenes de su edad tiene muchos sueños, uno de los cuales es tener una profesión, meta que no pudo lograr debido a que no contaba con el dinero necesario, actualmente tiene un negocio de fotocopias y poco a poco su vida está mejorando. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo para estudiar las materias que necesita para ingresar a la universidad, espera que su negocio crezca más y tenga más clientes, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y lo que más le disgusta es tener que estar pendiente de que las hojas no se atasquen dentro de la máquina fotocopiadora. Yuliana quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más queridas, ya que siempre está muy alegre. Con el dinero solicitado incrementara su capital de trabajo y comprará materiales necesarios para negocio; como papel, toner, grapas, etc.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a young single woman that at 22, still lives with her parents, whom she loves her very much and wants to give them a calmer life.

Like many young people her age, she has many dreams; one of them is to have a career, a goal that she cannot reach because she can’t count on the necessary money.

Presently she has a photocopy business and little by little her life is improving. What she likes most about her job is that it allows for time to study the subjects that she needs to enter university. She hopes the business grows more and has more customers. She has been doing this for a year, and what she likes least is to have to be dependent on the pages not jamming inside the photocopy machine. Yuliana wants to improve her life and knows that with a lot of effort she will accomplish it.

This is the second loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all the fees on time as she will want to request another loan later. In her communal bank she is one of the most loved partner members and is always very happy.

With the money requested she will increase her working capital and will buy needed materials for the business such as paper, toner, staples etc.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the materials for her business / Compra de materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region in the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is settled in the Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs.

This young, single man has been selling agricultural produce for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business by buying more agricultural produce: milk, yoghurt, potatoes, and fruit.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural produce: milk, yoghurt, potatoes, and fruit.

loans.name: Sulufaga

texts.en:
Sulufaga E., 48, is married with 9 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~115 USD). SPBD loans are Sulufaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, a rake and fertilizers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда скоро погасив очередной кредит хочет получить следующий займ. На полученые деньги она хочет съездить за товаром летнего ассортимента.В основном хочет привести детские футболки и мужские сорочки и майки.За все годы кредитования у Мавджуды увеличился оборотный капитал и следовательно торговля.За всю свою деятельность Мавджуда ни разу не нарушила условия Фонда.
texts.en:
Soon after she repaid her last loan, Mavjuda decided to request a new one. She wants to use this loan to obtain summer goods assortment. She wants to primarily bring in children’s t-shirts and men’s tunics and tank tops. Over the years of borrowing, Mavjuda’s working capital and sales have increased. Mavjuda has never violated any of the fund’s terms.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain summer goods assortment

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal “ LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2” ,vive en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. A1 Lt. 14 ,ella tiene 38 años y 04 hijos.  
              Se inicio con la venta de pescados  en compañía de su esposo , con su primer préstamo de s/. 300.00 lo invirtió para poner su propio negocio de venta de pescado.
              Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 compró un bote para que ella y su esposo fueran a pescar y así poder tener mas ingresos para su hogar.
            El tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente satisfecha por haberle dado la oportunidad de salir adelante y darle la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of "La Flor de Canela 2" Communal Bank. She lives at Urbanizacion Munizipal Mz. A1 Lt. 14. She is 38 years old and has 4 children. She, along with her husband, began selling fish and with her first loan of 300 soles invested in the establishement of her store to sell fish. With this loan of 1500 soles she bought a boat so that she and her husband can go fishing thereby incrasing their family's income. She is grateful for the opportunity that working with Manuela Ramos has given her to get ahead and better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Carmen
